description:
Skylark is a bar with a good vibe. They've got a bunch of art on the walls and a couple of booths. I sat at the bar for a bit and talked to the bartender. The drinks are priced low for the hood and you can get a stiff red bull vodka for about $8.

It's divey but has good DJ's + staff. I was in the Mission on the lookout for anywhere with good music and a decent crowd, unfortunately in was a Wednesday night. Walking down 16th street, Skylark was  the one place with good music bumpin. To be honest the bar was empty when I walked in with only a few people inside but as the night transitioned a few more people showed up and that's when the energy changed. It wasn't packed by any means but a couple folks got on the dance floor and before you know it there most of the people ended up on the floor. The DJ seemed to be practicing for most of the night but once people got on the dance floor, he picked up on the energy and matched the music with the dancers. With the crowd on the floor he did a nice work of keeping the energy up. My Wed night was shaping up to be pretty dull but Skylark was able to keep my Wed night respectable among the many sleepy bars I walked by on 16th.
author: Sasha G.

description:
Good music but it can get really hot and stuffy in there. Bathrooms are always a mess, especially the ladies room ( smh ) but hey you can't go wrong with a $5 cover charge so if you want a place to dance, have drinks but still leave drenched in sweat then Skylark is the place for you. 

A lil advice to the ladies, check your shoes before you walk out. I can't even tell you how many women I saw walk out with tissue & paper towels stuck to their shoe because its all over the floor.
author: Gwendolyn T.

description: I went here for the first time ever in my life with ny girlfriend and a few of her friends. I am never coming back. Drinks were okay. We got a free cabaret show. However the service was just awful. My friend won a free drink and they did not want to give it to her. My gf tried talking to a bartender named Griffin I believe who was a jerk had no class and was rude to her. We asked for a manager he said there is no manager. We spent quite a few hours and $200 here and for us to be treated this way?! Nope my friend lost her card and while looking for it we lifted up some seats and saw how filfthy this place really is.
author: Gee M.

description:
Came here on a Friday night while visiting in San Fran.
Took me 20 mins to get the bartender to even acknowledge me ordered a vodka and rebull and found a fly in it. Took me another 20 mins to get her acknowledgement and when I tell her she gives me a dirty look rolls her eyes and dumps my drink and makes a new one. A simple apology would've been grateful. RUDE RUDE RUDE!!
author: Daniel C.

description:
Came to Skylark Friday night for the free Burlesque show. Showed up at around 7pm after work and the bartender was attentive. I sat in a comfy booth and met some friends. Then the show started and this drag queen came out and started playing trumpet - have to say he was pretty dang good. He was poppin out some jazz classics with some bawdy dancers faux stripping. it was fun, cheap and cheerful and the joint was hoppin. I had a shitty week at work and the Frose and vibe helped me get my weekend groove on. Only bummer was hip hop DJs come out at 10pm and couldn't stay that long.
I would come back here.
author: Anna A.

description:
Perfectly solid, no-frills dive bar in the Mission. However, unlike most dive bars, Skylark actually has a legit cocktail program. I was quite impressed with their spirit selection.

I came in for a quick pre-dinner pop (aka Tequila shot). The bartender had a heavy hand and my drink cost me less than $10.

I can't really say much more about the place because it was more or less one-and-done for me. That being said, if I was in the neighborhood again, I'd def come back for some more hooch!
author: Kevin B.

description: I haven't been to this place for a couple of years. It was a $5 cover but it's SF so can't complain too much about that. Inside is still the same red decor as I remembered it in the past. DJ was spinning a good mix of different types of music from TLC, 112 to Big Sean, Drake, etc which is what I always enjoy. $8 Vodka Redbull just to give you an idea of how much a drink would cost here.
author: Gerard Y.

description: About two months ago my date and I went to this bar after eating at that adorable cantina next door. We had a great time. Drinks were good all night. They played throwback 90s music. It was cool. Crowd was mixed. Two months later we went back. Drinks were better this time. I hope my date left the bartender a good tip. The crowd left so much to the imagination. There was a pretty light bright back twerking. Cutie pie. The dj played the exact same music from last time. My date was chilling but I almost died of bad vibes. I feel bad, I know he wanted to stay. I wanted to stay to at least for the good drinks. The music was cute the first time. Second time not so much. I will probably go back because humans enjoy abuse. Naw for the drinks their fire. They need a NEW dj on Saturday nights.
author: Terina C.

description:
The best thing that Skylark has going for it is the music!  You might not think it from outside, but they always have some bangers to play here!

Aside from the music, it's an OK environment.  Nothing super special though.  Their selection of drinks is pretty nice; they always are able to make my favorite couple of drinks for not a lot of money!  The prices are pretty decent here, especially considering its location in the Mission.  It's a really nice place for an after-work or school drink with coworkers or friends.

The thing I don't like so much about Skylark is how crowded it is.  It's a pretty small place with a small dance floor, which doesn't allow for much movement or dancing for that matter.  It's pretty dive-y, which is great for people who like that a lot, but I'm not the biggest fan of that, but I'll still go sometimes for decently priced drinks, good music and pupusas next door! It's always where I'll end my skylark nights!
author: Kevin K.

description: Solid neighborhood bar that many refer to as a dive, but feels more like a saloon with all the stools along its counter and plenty of chairs and tables at which to sit. In the past, they've offered deals and drinks honoring President Obama. In these darker times, the fun nevertheless continues with cheap happy hour drinks and an inexpensive selection of cocktails thee rest of the day. Service is fast and efficient, and the bar can accommodate group events. Gets the job done well.
author: Vincent L.

description: Lots of great options of men always. I come here mostly to make out, but also dance. They play all the best slaps. F it up, F it up!
author: KT D.

description:
No cover on Satudray night so that was good. 

They didn't have the obamatini which was prominently listed on their menu, so we settled for some wine. Ordered some malbec from Argentina that was absolutely delicious. At $8 a glass it was pricey, but the pours were very generous and at least 1.5 glasses. Cool place to check out.

Dance floor is ratchet AF.
author: Edward W.

description: I live in Fairfield and it's my first time at Skylark. My boy Cam from SF told me about the spot and Margaret the bartender is AWESOME and totally hot!
author: Angel C.

description: Love love love this dive bar in the Mission, where I alway have a great time on the dance floor.  DJ's play dope hip hop beats and my fave bartender, Margaret, is attentive, on point and fast! My go to place in the Mission. Oh, and prices are reasonable. A place where you can still find native San Franciscans, always a good time at the Lark!
author: JJ D.

description:
Good music, great bartender on weekdays and cheap drinks. 

Casual afterwork place on weekda
author: Maria R.

description: My favorite place in the mission! I always like to stop here when I end up in the mission. The Dj's are great and the bartenders are attentive!
author: Iza C.

description:
Skylark is my cheers.

Its filled with locals and the staff know me by name.

In terms of bars, skylark has a variety of cocktails and great beers on draft. The space is large, ample TVs and great music. Almost every night of the week they have some themed party, but shout out to free burlesque/comedy nights on Fridays! While to some, this may be "just another dive" in the mission.... The glue that keeps me coming back is the service. Jordan and Dino (who I hear is no longer there, Hi Dino!) are engaging, charismatic bartenders that are quick on their toes. Zero attitude and always keeping your drinks filled with a smile.... Something that is hard to come by these days, especially in the mission.

Pro tip: happy hour is 4-9pm 7 days a week and they allow outside food. Pupusas next door are life changing.
author: Ryan L.

description:
3.5 Stars

HH
$4 pints
$5 wells 
Good amount of seating
Friday night around 6pm is relatively quiet 

Overall Thoughts

Curious to what the night vibe is like once it gets packed
author: Eddie W.

description: Went to The City with My Husband, In laws , & Cousins looking for Fun Bars we went to a few but wasn't quite what I expected happend to be walking toward another bar we were directed to by another pedestrian from the area we heard them playing E-40 and we decided to give it a chance I'm really happy we did it was exactly what we were looking for !! They had a live DJ , & Dance floor it was AWSOME there was allooooot of people there and barley any room to move around so there was a lot of bumping in to people but honestly when your drinking and having a lot of fun it doesn't matter !!! I Can really say this place is amazing and we will definitely be coming back !!!!!!
author: Mrs L.

description: Skylark is a diamond in the rough. With its recent update the bathrooms are the cleanest in the mission and it has a new nautical charm with murals by Amanda Lynn. It's almost two bars in one. At happy hour you can sip on whimsical cocktails from their menu or decent wine and after 10pm the relaxed cocktail bar transforms into a dance club. It's the best of both worlds.
author: Jetsetgirl B.

description: Love going to skylark. Only thing is its not too big. But they have nice seating on the perimeter and along the bar. Dance floor gets crowded. They always play the best music and everyone loves to dance. It's a nice atmosphere and cool place to hang out at with some friends. They play rap, bay area music and popular hip hop music. And staff is friendly. If you want to dance and sweat, this is the place to go.
author: Alexandria S.

description:
Ha! My friends and I ended uo here one night after we spent some time in a bar nearby, where the people were rude and stuck up. There was literally no room. Just elbo room :| 

I asked the security guard where I can go, and he recommended me here. There was a $5 cover.  Threw us all off bc in Vegas, we never pay a cover haha! But we paid anyway.  The place is not that big.  Very intimate to say the least.  They were mixing hip hop with 90's hip hop.  We weren't here very long, so I didn't order a drink.  We did go to what is the "dance floor" and I danced a little bit.  The whole vibe was something like an underground party.  Speakers bumpin, dancing extremely close, like the sweat from the other person will hit you.  Some of the folks there were extremely gone, so they were more like swaying and throwing themselves, rather than dancing. But watevs I guess.  

I heard reggae nights are the nights to go.  We were only in town for the weekend.  An experience for the books, that's for sure!
author: Demetria W.

description:
If you don't mind the smell of ganja, the lingering soot of regret, or washing your hands where someone decided to deposit their gastric contents, then this place is for you!   Having grown up in the city and being exposed to just about everything (family business in the TL), this place feels like SF.

The bartenders, the drinks, the incessant bass intermixed with the cliche of high hats all make for a great vibe.  

Note:  Having lived just around the corner, this place, for visitors from out of town, may make some people feel uncomfortable.  Why they are my friends, I am not sure-- but this area is not for the faint of heart or snobby foo foo poo poo heads.
author: John L.

description:
Skylark is the only dive bar I can rely on for a good time, any day of the week! Discovered this place over a year ago and I haven't stopped coming. The 2 main bartenders (Dino & Jordan) are humble, friendly and great listener if you need to vent after a long crappy day! 

They also have one of the best happy hour deals, $4 for wine or beer and $1 off of cocktails until 9PM daily. And when I'm lucky, I stop by on the day that they play some old school jams or hip hop. People overlooked this place due to the exterior or they think it's "ghetto" but trust me, it's spacious inside, drinks are good, bartender are great, and it's my go-to place after a long day!
author: Katie N.

description: Hole in the wall spot that plays hip hop music. Could have better mixes on the songs they play. That $5 cover- (Double Dutch charged the same) it's really your preference both are equally the same in music and crowd but my friends opted for it hoping for a burlesque show. Crowd is mixed- anywhere from the nerdy tech boys to the middle age crowd.
author: Kai A.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday. I don't remember if there was cover. If there was I think it was $5? But you guys know how I hate paying cover for anything. 

Anyhow, I really liked this place. The bathroom was near to the dance floor in case you had to yak. There was barely anyone there. The music was nice and the drinks a plenty. If I'm in the mission again, and there really is no cover, I'm hopping in!
author: Lynn C.

description: Great local neighborhood hang out with really nice bartenders and a great free variety burlesque show on Friday nights! Yeah can't get any better than that!
author: Rasa V.

description: The 5 star rating is for the Friday night DJ and music selection on the night I was there (May 19,2017)--Music: HipHop (current and older); R&B (current and older) think --Naughty by Nature--Prince--Ghost Town DJs--Michael--Tina Marie--Jay Z--etc. If you love the genres/artists mentioned and cutting a rug, you will enjoy this place. The dance floor is small and it gets packed and hot in here, but again, you are coming for the dancing, not the seating selections (although there are some around the perimeter, bar, and front room) or the ambiance (whole in the wall)--the crowd is a mix but looked like a lot of locals who knew about the place and came for dancing. Also, there was a $5 cover which was well worth it considering we danced for about 3 hours straight. The block this place is on is very busy at this time of the night with some interesting folks around...we had a great time!
author: Ana G.

description: Ended up going here with a bunch of friends, the hip-hop music was just right. The place had good vibes and the people, mostly locals, minus all the touristy riffraff.
author: Manny F.

description: One of my favorite after work "dive bars", and I mean that as a compliment! Good happy hour, great bartenders and they can make a COLD dirty martini. Bartenders are friendly and make your drink exactly the way you ask.  Love this place.
author: Daisy G.

description: No Cover Cabaret on Friday nights. Great night out in a friendly bar, but if you're coming to Skylark on a Friday night, be warned that at about 8pm there's a FREE cabaret & burlesque show. It's a bit tricky to see what's going on some of the time because the lighting for the performance space is inadequate which is a pity because most of the performers are really good. It's a short show with lots of variety as there are different acts every week - comedians, burlesque, make burlesque, singers, musicians. The bar really needs to sort out the lighting for the performers though...
author: Kym S.

description: This is one of my favorite bars. Cool, classy, subtle mermaid/seafaring theme, powerful drinks, nice/attractive people. And being in the mission, it's close to EVERYTHING. Want some pizza? Around the corner. Pupusas? Next door. Sushi? Across the street. Sometimes they do fun and sexy shows ;)
author: Jesse F.

description: Skylark is a gem. The space is big enough to not feel crowded with a full house and small enough to feel intimate. I particularly love the Esther Williams-esque Skylark Mermaid mural on the ceiling. Drinks are well balanced and they have a wide selection of spirits to enjoy. You can sit in a cozy front windows, at a cabaret table, around the dance floor, or (of course) at the bar. I've danced many a Friday night away on the Skylark's dancefloor! It's my go-to bar in the Mission.
author: Kitty O.

description:
If I could give this place a 0, I would. I was very disappointed coming here. I came here with a group of friends last night, April 16, 2016, and wasn't able to get in. Apparently my Florida DL was a fake, according to the bouncer at the front door. Never having tried scanning it, he "knew" it was a fake because he had spent several years "hustling in the streets" as he put it. 
What really aggravated me was the fact that he acted as though him giving it back to me were doing me a favor. I honestly would have wanted him to keep it so I could have called the officials to get it back for me. 
"How you gon' hate from the outside of the club when you can't even get it?" I guess though.
author: Brandon B.

description: About as divey as u can get and not a good area. But Guinness on draft and only $4 during happy hour and a good burlesques show for free on Fridays. The bathroom is really nice and clean!
author: Skinny Coach u.

description: Services drinks only. Great Happy Hour specials and great drink prices for the area. Walked into a burlesque show on Friday night. Turned into a club with DJ spinning banger tunes.
author: Dawit B.

description:
90's hip hop r&b?  DOPE
stiff drinks? YES

$3 entrance fee on a Saturday when it's dead arse fck in here? dislike, especially because the "dance floor" is the size of my bathroom. That's hilarious.

This is a bar, not a club. You can come here and have a chill night though!
author: Susy C.

description:
Skylark is chill. Light one up and don't worry too much about it ;).
Always good vibes. 
 I just wish it were a little cleaner .
author: Tia M.

description: Came here to celebrate my sisters bday on a Saturday nite & we had a blast. The drinks are kew prices and the music was great!! Will definitely come bk
author: Ari B.

description: The worst bar I've ever been too, I'm 21 and they took my California ID for no reason because they thought I looked young, I can't believe they would hire some bouncer that takes legal ids that's insane that is against the law. This is such a horrible bar
author: Dakota G.

description: The bouncers at this bar are incredibly rude and pull random people aside and call them out on supposed "fake IDs". I'm 22 and the light skin chubby guy with the beard thought he was in a Vegas and tried acting all macho and wanted 50 dollars to get my "fake ID" back and into the bar. This guy should be reported to the police immediately. I hope the owner reads this and fires him quickly.;
author: Danny J.

description:
Great place for happy hour! Even on weekends!
Came here Saturday night to kill time, and the beer was only $3 and my mixed drink was at happy hour price too. It is a great dive bar to get the night started. We walked by afterwards and we saw how busy it was. We'll try it again after 9pm next time.
author: Mayra E.

description: I was looking for a bar in the area and came along this one.  Went in with no expectations but came out pretty satisfied.  They had NBA games playing on the TV's (the main reason I was there) and the beer selection is decent.  They had a variety of random cocktails as well that sounded good.  The bartender was very friendly and made small talk to all of his customers.  Seems like a lot of locals come here as the bartender seemed to know a lot of the patrons by name.  I would definitely come back here again when I'm in the area.  Very low-key setting.
author: Cynthia L.

description: This is a great place to end up towards the end of a night out in the Mission district.  This is a great place to end up when you just want to dance and do not care about anything else.  This is a great place to go when you want to walk into a bar that always seems to be a little hazy and fragrant.  In all seriousness, Skylark is a decent place to go dance to hip hop music.
author: Alex E.

description:
Went in here a few months ago with some friends for happy hour during the day. The waitress was friendly and made strong drinks. My friends and I were one of the few people in the bar. There is art on the walls and ceilings which makes this a memorable spot! 

Would definitely come here again. Not sure how the bar is during busy times.
author: John D.

description:
Party Rock Wednesdays NO more... *SIGH*

Remember when you can party every night of the week, get smashed, and STILL arrive to work on time, bright-eyed and bushy tailed? Sadly, those days are long gone for me. Nowadays, I can't even make it to 8 PM after happy hour as my eyelids droop faster than when an 80 year-old grandma takes off her bra.  

Anyhow, for those 20-something young professionals who I envy, the BEST night to come to Skylark is on Wednesday nights for Mixtape Wednesday. It's the only night of the week they charge a $5 cover (after 10 PM) so you know it's crackin'. The DJ spins a good mix of Old-Skool Hip Hop to keep your booty movin' all night. 

Being the Golden Girls that we are, I being Blanche, the liquid courage inducing man-hungry fluezy sans the male admirers, my girls and I came to Skylark a week and a half ago for some post-dinner drinks. Happy hour was still in effect (ends at 8 PM), I ordered one of the tasty $5 cocktails from the HH menu. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/SdXPtsreVImvvL2V2hP8vQ?select=dcJl5JBPoEVA2HZ_cy2cww The Red Robin is a vodka based cocktail with a tangy plum wine flavor. The nice, male bartender even gave us some peanuts and pretzels to nosh on with our alcohol inducing appetites. 

The HH crowd was not easy on the eyes and I doubt "drink till he's cute" would work here unless you wanted to be carried out in a gurney. This ain't the FiDi that's fo' sure!

OTHER NOTES:
*NO cover except Wednesday nights
*NO dresscode
*Divey and dark 
*Live DJ spinning every day
*Very small dancefloor in back
*Crowd is ghetto with a touch of hipster
*2 large booths and about 5 tables for sitting
*One dirty restroom for each sex
*2 for 1 drink offer when you check-in via Foursquare
*CC's accepted
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Sure, it's a dingy dive. 
Yeah, it smells like bathroom, because it's probably not that clean. 
Sooooooooo what. 

Strong cocktails, decent whisky selection, nightly specialty drinks for $8. Go during the week when it's not packed - you'll actually be able to hear your friend talk across the table before you go to your *actual* destination. Just don't expect to be able to see her. Good place to meet if you like hiding in the dark.

(Note: I feel lucky that my phone didn't get stolen out of my bag, apparently that's a common problem here?)
author: Ray J.

description: Outstanding neighborhood bar close to BART. Excellent long running FREE Friday Night Cabaret show produced by the fantastic Hunny Bunny. Great drinks, cool vibe, nice new nautical theme.
author: Mike P.

description: We were visiting from out of town and heard about this place. We had a couple of great local IPAs (at the bartender's recommendation) and he also gave us great ideas on where to go next. A fun spot to include in our very brief visit to San Fran!
author: Molly B.

description: Love this place! Any time I head into the mission I always start my night with a Skylark $4 pint. My lady loves this place too. Musics dope. And Brian the new bartender is HOT.
author: Chris E.

description: Great service! Great drinks! Found this bar while walking back to Bart one day and it made my day!! 100% recommend!
author: Margeaux K.

description: AMAZING selection of Bourbon: Blanton's, Basil Hayden, Four Roses, in addition to many others.  RARE for a San Francisco  bar.
author: Brian M.

description:
Small narrow place and a bit dim.  But this place was live and active.  Many people hanging out, drinking, dancing, and ultimately having fun on a Saturday night.  They were giving away "sample shots" of tequila and I was able to get a few in before I started feeling bad that others weren't getting "sample shots."

I absolutely loved the music playing.  A lot of it was old school R&B/Hip-Hop to now.  Anywhere from Montell Jordan to 2 Chainz.  It was a $5 cover, but you were then given a $5 chip used to purchase drinks.  Definitely a smart way to get people to buy stuff at the bar.  I would come here again the next time I am in SF.
author: Geoffrey C.

description:
Skylark- A local neighborhood bar in the Mission. Last night I just needed a night out due to a frustrating day. Luckily I remembered my friend throws parties here every Wednesday, so I knew were to go. I don't usually hang out on the weekdays but I hear Wednesday nights here is the place to be. 

When I arrived, barely no one was there, so my friend and I had a drink. 30 mins later a couple of my other friends joined me and I noticed the place got packed! Note this place is not big at all, just a small bar with a capacity of about hmmm maybe 70? Music was old school hip hop and a diverse crowd. Drinks were averaged price, with a small dance floor. 

Overall..I had a good time, I had forgotten that a lot of people go out on a Wednesday night. Cool chill spot to hang out at.
author: Kathy V.

description:
Good: location, eclectic crowd (which can be good and bad but I liked that all kinds of people felt welcome there), the music was ok. You remember a good DJ. I won't remember this one.

Bad: $5 cover. Really?? For this place? The space is not great either, the ceilings are really low so there is not a lot of room to breathe. But the worst part was the bouncers who were so flippin' rude. They were just cold to me but they were so rude to the group in front of me. I felt like I was trying to get in a den in Hunt's Point or something.
author: H J.

description:
If you are looking for Hip Hop to dance to without having to deal with all the Club BS, you should come check this place out.  No cover and the dance floor is always packed.  Sure it doesn't have all the hottest people, but everybody is there to have a good time!   From outward appearances, it can seem a bit ratchet, but once you have  couple of drinks and step out on the dance floor, its all love.

Drinks are fairly cheap ~$7 and the bar is pretty quick, even when its crowded.  Open seating, but that pretty much fills up even before the dance floor gets going.
author: Veasna H.

description: I've been fan of the Skylark for years, mostly because of the eclectic DJs and music they host. I'm a particular fan of the Monday night reggae scene they have going. The DJs like Vinny Ras, et al. spin some awesome classic roots mixed with occasional dub. You gotta smell the iration aroma inside to believe. Best to go with a group of friends to maximize the experience. When inside, take a look around, the old-school facade has been enjoyed by thousands over the decades. Let's keep this tradition strong!
author: Brian J.

description:
Always fun-! Good music and super cool bartenders ;-)
Every Friday burlesque show is neat--!!
author: May Y.

description:
If you want your phone to get STOLEN, go to Skylark!!! It doesn't matter whether it's inside your purse or your pocket. It WILL get stolen. And the worst part about this is the people who work here know who the thieves are, but don't do a damn thing about it!!!!!!!!! 
NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Our go to place when we visit SF. Music on point, they play hip hop/r&b. Drinks are strong and pretty reasonable in price, we drank vodka n cran, I guess the bartender wanted to be super stingy with the cranberry juice. Lol! I didn't mind at all!! It is kinda small and there's one bathroom for the girls and one for the boys. So when there's a line it goes out onto the dance floor. And if you go into the guys bathroom, the door doesn't lock. Lol!!! So bring a friend. All in all its amazeballz!!!!
author: MaliaAdrian M.

description: It was grew except for the lost of my wallet, I was pick pocketed and realized this as soon as I left the bar, and went back in to look for it, but obviously it was no where to be seen. Bartenders and bouncers did little to help.
author: Karen D.

description:
Service = friendly.  Granted, I'm sort of deaf, and when he asked me to pay for my first kamikaze, I totally did not hear him.  Oooops!

Happy Hour, FTW!! 

I'll be back here for cocktails.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night with friends for a much needed night out. Our Mission tour guide is an elitist when it comes to night life in the City so we entrusted him to find flavors from all over in this colorful town! 

Our main venue for the evening was at the Skylark. I had a great time perusing the bar, dancing away (sheepishly at first) to the sounds of 90s pop/R&B and belting (maybe shouting) out tunes from the good ol' days! 
The all female DJ's were awesome! Very attentive to their audience and danced along with everyone while handling things behind the booth. It was certainly a sight to behold. 

The dance floor is relatively small, but not crowded at all when we went. It was the comfortable kind of crowd where you're not touching people as you move along. 

The only issue we had was the bartender gal not coming to the other side of the bar to take our orders. She eventually came and all was we.

A very down to earth venue, great music and a lot of people in their mid-20s who actually enjoy the music that's being played.
author: Jennifer N.

description:
Great drinks. Music was on point. Dance floor a definite plus! 

I came here for the first time with friends on a Friday night and had an absolute BLAST! Me and my boyfriend don't go often to lounges like these but we had so much fun, we will definitley be back!
author: Rocky G.

description: Fun dive bar with PBR and entertainment on tap!  Fun patrons.  Bartenders are friendly and fast at slinging great drinks.  Check it out Friday nights.
author: Zach T.

description:
Friends decided to come here on a whim. They wanted to dance, and the line at Double Dutch was long. Whatever, no big deal. 

Walked over to Skylark, and got inside. Right after making it through the door, I already knew I didn't want to stay. Yes, it was a Saturday night, so I expected a ton of people, but good lord. Seriously, don't be offended if i put my hand out on your back to pass by you. It's a freaking courtesy, i DON'T want to touch you just because. People acted SO offended that I was passing by them. I didn't realize that you owned the entire place. Jeez

Anyway, this place smells of desperation. There's a TON of people just standing around the dance floor. Seriously? You're taking up room by just standing around. We were in there for no more than 3 minutes and my friend gets her phone STOLEN out of her hand. THREE MINUTES. Tried looking for it, no luck. Went outside for air, came back in for a little bit and we decided to be done with this place. Total time spent in this place: 5 minutes. 

Maybe I'll come back another time, but good lord. It's more of the people in here that is the deal breaker for me.
author: Steph W.

description: Love Skylark, have been coming here for the last 7 years. They get in some great local DJs and always play my slaps. Great service and nice bartenders, shout out to Brian, always working hard and being respectful and genuine to his customers.
author: Cat M.

description:
The ambience of this place is awesome. There wasn't a lot of people when we went, the music wasn't overly loud, and they were playing some nice old school stuff (not hip-hop when I was there). It feels like a place you can visit with a group of close friends and you don't have to scream your lungs out.

They also have 2 nice booths for groups to sit at.

However, I wasn't so happy with the bartender. My Hendrick's gin&tonic tasted bad...can't taste the lime juice or the gin's natural sweetness. It's pretty hard to mess up such a classic drink. Next time I might just stick with a beer -- hard to mess up, and I still get to hang out.

No cover needed Friday night.
author: Alice C.

description: With all the rave reviews, I thought it'd be more fun. The ceiling mermaid is pretty cool, but the extreme hip hop music? no thank you. that cannot be considered as dance music in my world. It gets crowded really quickly, an odd collection of fake hipsters and cocky SoMA/Marina kids. eh. we left early.
author: Zara S.

description:
To the people writing negative reviews: what did you think this was, Double Dutch!? 

Skylark is the perfect place to kick back and have a quiet beer. Later on, you can rock to a live DJ spinning old flatjacks, seven-and-a-halfs, and even dusting off a few original NWA folkways recordings.

I was trying to forget about a woman who didn't know desire, so I came in here last week. 

The beats were bumping, and beer was even quieter than usual.

A few notes:

1) The DJs tend to spin a lot of semi-acoustic/industrial proto-Gaga post-rap. I dig it, but if it's not your thing, you can always go to Double Dutch or just go die.

2) Don't go to the bathroom if you aren't prepared for weirdness. I opened the door and saw a hundred leagues down into the abyss, locking eyes with a slumbering cephalopod deity.

3) You can't just make yourself stop loving someone. Even at Skylark.
author: Benjami N.

description:
All I remember is drunk dancing/falling for two hours while singing along to GUCCI GUCCI LOUIS LOUIS FENDI FENDI PRADA. I'm going to assume I had a good time. 

My friends refused to let me drink anymore so I have nothing to say about their beverages haha. There was no cover and the guys at the door were so nice! I hate when you haven't even entered the bar yet and people are already being assholes. The bar was packed with people but not to to a claustrophobic extent. 

I didn't even notice how pretty the outside of the bar is until I drove past it the other night. All those pretty lights!!!
author: Tiffany V.

description:
This place got 3 stars.. exactly what it should get.

This is one of various bars on 16th street. 

ATMOSPHERE: low-key night out. No cover, drinks are decently priced ($7) I bought the skylark drink which was pretty good and sweet for 7. Some tables to sit but it's a narrow bar (like the rest of SF haha) with a small dance floor playing old school hip hop 

CROWD: mixed, kinda ghetto

OVERALL: This is the type of place you go to chill or pregame for a bigger place haha, not one to spend all night at unless you really just want something low-key. We came here because it was right across a $10 parking lot and then we walked a mile to Bruno's haha. But there are plenty of other bars to check out on 16th.  Whether you stay or hop, have fun! It's an alright place :)
author: Raquel Y.

description:
Been going to skylark for a while and usually a good spot.  Went in this weekend and both my friend and I got our wallets stolen.  Hasn't been the first time I've seen this happen.

Music is usually great, bartenders are quick but the place is getting shady with all the thefts...
author: Chris P.

description:
Love this place! I lost my cell here & someone returned it to Jordan the bartender who then returned it to me later that day. That is rare in this neighborhood.  

Plus, this place is a guaranteed good time. Everytime I've been here, the music is great, the people are fun & the staff is fantastic.
author: Alisha O.

description:
My favorite spot in SF 
Best music, people, neighborhood 
Liquor stores everywhere so drink first then go in.
author: Gabs T.

description:
Not my favorite place but definitely ok.
The night I came here I just wanted to relax and have a beer. The music was way too loud. It was almost empty so it felt a bit overkill to have it that loud. But maybe that's a good thing if you're in more of a party mood.
author: Diana G.

description:
Funny what a few shiny lights will do to reinvigorate a dingy, relatively forgotten (at least as far as I'm concerned) rathskeller in the middle of the Mission, huh?

I'd literally forgotten this place was even around, and while waiting for the trusty 22 to pick me up and sweep me away, I noticed that Skylark erected a spiffy new sign that looks as if it were a cast off from downtown Las Vegas that found new life in San Francisco. Bright white bulbs and an old school aesthetic that draws you in like a mosquito to a florescent blue electric aura. It's quite the eye catcher, and because of the new addition to the awning, I found myself bellied up to their bar in no time with a frosty drink in hand as I awaited the arrival of my coach which was scheduled to arrive some 14 minutes from the moment I sauntered through the front door.

It'll be interesting to see how many people have a similar reaction to my own. The addition of that sign could very well be the best thing that ever happened to this bar!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
The bartenders and the bouncer were not friendly at all, but I really loved the vibe of the place. Great location near BART and their reggae show for Bob Marley's birthday was a great time. Lots of dancing, lots of green, and moderate drink prices.

Another semi- downer was that there is a $20 card minimum. I hate that about the mission, that they have cash only policies or ridiculous card policies. Credit is so prevalent that they should help their customer base by accommodating.
author: Jennifer S. C.

description:
Always a good night every time I come here!

I've been coming here since I was in college some moons back. Still a popping place for both the newbies and everyone else in between!

Great bartenders and service! Drinks galore and quite yummy and great prices!

The DJ they had when we went was awesome! The music was crazy and it was a great mixture of the 90s and today which I found myself literally dancing the night away!

Slight downside, their bathroom is not as clean and well-kept regarding my standards.

All in all, still a fantastic venue to come out to for drinks and dancing!

Toodles~
author: Mae M.

description: If you like fat douche bags who won't let you in the door when the place is completely empty, this is the place for you.
author: Jon S.

description:
Dropped by on a random Saturday night, fell in love.  Played 90s, hip hop (Kevin Little, Mariah Carey, Juvenille, etc.)  small dance floor, but its exactly what I expected when bar hopping in the Mission, SF.

Got 2 drink chips for my birthday. Wasn't fond of the $5 cover but I guess the tokens made up for it!
author: Alyssaaa S.

description: This is the shittiest bar service ever. I tried to order a whiskey and coke and the dumb ass bartender kept yelling back at me saying it was loud...guess what? You're at a bar with music, don't yell at the hand that pays your bills fucking asshole. I simply was trying to explain my drink order, sorry if that was frustrating for you, get a new job if you can't handle a loud work area where you make a living off tips. Wow.
author: Marlene N.

description:
Headed out for a cousins bday & we all ended up here by someone else's choice.
I couldn't hang too long. 
Not the greatest crowd. Ghetto & those trying not to be.

Ladies,  if you like bastards groping you as you walk the thin line between bar via dancefloor to get to the restroom, this is your heaven. Especially when you turn & have no clue which gross looking gold toothed mofo just cupped your ass.
Lucky I didn't know who did it as my 6'5" friend may have handled his ass as well.

I'm sure this can happen anywhere but I don't like cramped spots for this reason.

Music sucked anyway.  Bartenders were efficient at least & the bouncer wasn't a douche.
Not recommened regardless.

Pass.
author: Athena S.

description:
Note: I've never been to Skylark on a Friday or Saturday night.

The few times that I've gone to Skylark, it's been the middle of the week, around 7pm.  The music is good, the drinks are well mixed, and the bartenders have all been friendly and helpful.

It's a good place to hang out if you want to be able to talk, and not have to talk over loud music.  There are some booths around the exterior, so you can comfortably sit with a nice group of people.  And lastly the ambiance is relaxed and a little retro.

I like Skylark, I always think of it when I'm near 16th street.  Check it out on a nice slow night and enjoy yourself.
author: Margaret I.

description:
Was ghetto before and still ghetto now!

If I ever want to run into one of my homies from Westmoor High School and get caught in that awkward conversation of oh hey how are you how's everything and not have the conversation materialize into anything then stand there awkwardly until one of us is like Let's take a shot!! while Too Short- Blow the Whistle is playing in the background, then I go to Skylark. Wow there were so many grammatical errors in that sentence but it's OK, it's a review of Skylark haha. What more can I say about this place. It has a good location and somewhat cheap drinks. The music is good and the ambiance is hyphy. The crowd is rough most of the times. I wanna say I've heard of a couple of stabbing happening here but you can still have a good time. 

Skylark is good for groups and if you just want to dance to the entire collection of Mac Dre and Andre Nickatina which just so happens to be one of my favorite rappers. Security has stepped up their game over the years so that's good to hear but you can tell Skylark is going through a bit of gentrification as all the Mission is going through. Skylark after it closes is always interesting because there is always a fight or something going down but the hot dog cart is there too so I'll take the risk for the bacon wrapped hot dogs. It's a gamble to drive here since you may spend some time finding parking but I usually don't have a problem with it. 

Overall, come at your own risk.
author: Javier G.

description: I've been here a few times, and I've never encountered any sketchy people or felt uncomfortable. Though, there are some undesirables that stumble in closer to the end of the night. I've never seen any drama. I don't normally come here on weekend though, just weeknights. It's more chill and has less people usually. They usually have a decent DJ that plays good music. Good place to just kick it with friends and dance. If you don't like dancing, you can also sit at a table and chat it up with friends. Good for large groups and super laid back. Drinks are not badly priced, and some of the bartenders are heavy handers. They are not shy with the liquor at all.
author: Natasha S.

description:
Ghetto- FABULOUS. 

This is one of my favorite places to hit up when I am in the Mission. Yes - the crowd can be a bit intense sometimes - people ready to fight outside, bouncers yelling at people, a mob outside, but just be smart and go with a group of people (A group of 3 little girls here would be a bad idea!). Once you get through the initial culture shock of the outside, you'll hit up fast working bartenders; a row of cozy little tables with candles and a dance floor in the back. The DJ's spin a variety of hip hop (mostly) and top 40. The crowd there just loves to groove and boogie and it always puts me in the mood to whip my hair bath and forth. The DJ's are really nice - if you type in your song request on your phone and show the DJ they'll usually play it (a dance part isn't complete without BRITNEY) or if you ask for a BDAY shout out -- they'll do it for you without giving you a hard time!  

The escape plan out of this neighborhood isn't too bad, getting a cab has been pretty easy around here. Also - you'll always find a hot dog cart outside or just walk down the street to Arinell's.
author: Christine B.

description: Oh my goodness, I loved the music here! I came here on a Tuesday (random, I know), but it was still so much fun. There were surprisingly a lot of people here for a weeknight, but not to the point that it was super crowded or overwhelming. The people that were here all seemed like regulars and casually seemed like they knew at least one person working there. The bartender was friendly enough, but she got pretty busy and forgot our order at one point. She made it up to us with a super strong drink that she said was on her and I thought that was really nice. Overall, I had a lot of fun here and I'd come back!
author: Steph U.

description:
Came for Reggae Mondays. The people are friendly, the drinks cheap, the music good. 

What more can you ask for?
author: Jane N.

description: Great location. The dj was playing awesome music. Unfortunately, the lady bartender was not friendly or welcoming. She refused our card payment, even though she just accepted it 10 minutes prior. We had to wait about 3 minutes for her to finish texting until she acknowledged us. Hopefully it was just a bad night for her. Other than that, the atmosphere was pleasant.
author: Yasmin H.

description: Bouncers are whatevs, I'm a small Asian girl so no one really messes with me =) I've never been here when there was a cover, but I have seen this place get pretty packed! They have decent music, cheap alcohol and a diverse crowd of people. The last time I was here it was kind of muggy and nasty inside... other than that I have no complaints, pretty average bar.
author: Elaine N.

description:
-Good music
-Good drinks
-Cool bartenders
-Reasonably priced

Now can you say no, to a place like this?  Came here on a Saturday night and I couldn't have had more fun!  I can't wait until the next time we visit this place again.
author: Eddie F.

description:
Great music
Good drinks, standard price
No cover -  woohoo!
A bit small, can get a bit too crowded at times.
Convenient location to enable bar hopping
author: Kinjal S.

description:
My boyfriend and I popped in earlier today, at about 5:30 pm.

There was an obese guy in a black t-shirt and jeans, with a cap worn backwards, with a dog. Fair enough.

The issue:  The dog was on the bar, eating dog biscuits, slobbering all over what should be a SANITARY place.

Gross.

The bartender had no issue with the dog on the bar and, in fact, the same bartender who was petting the dog, made cocktails with his hands, squeezing lime. This is ripe for all sorts of germs to spread.

Gross.

I don't want to have cocktails while a dog is sitting on a barstool, playing on TOP of the countertop, while an obese, greasy guy is immune to the health hazards this poses.

I'll be contacting the SF Dept of Public Health.
author: Sara D.

description:
My favorite bar in town.  Its a gritty mix of 16th Street BART overflow and hip young revelers. The drinks are cheap, the bartenders are adorable, the DJs are awesome and dancing is mandatory.

Make sure to keep an eye on your belongings, but that goes without saying in any dark street level bar.

BONUS! There's a free burlesque show at 8pm every second Friday of the month.
author: Christina L.

description:
Good people, Good Vibes, Great Music!

Stepped in on a Monday, & it was REGGAE NIGHT which was super dope since I'm a huge fan of reggae. Place was packed with an awesome crowd.
Only downfall was the drinks were a bit pricey. 

All in all, great place to go for some island music!
CHEEE HEEE!
author: Chantel M.

description: This bar is a money making machine for pit-pockets. I had my wallet and phone stolen here and immediately alerted security. He was not concerned at all, rude and unhelpful. He suddenly found my wallet 20 minutes after it disappeared. Of course, everything of importance was gone. I personally think it was an inside job. I told the security officer who I thought maybe had possibly taken it and he told  me that he knew who I was talking about but when the police arrived, suddenly his mind went blank. The police warned me to stay away from this bar as this is a constant problem. I also reported to the police that I felt that this was an inside job. I will never set foot in this place again.
author: Valerie B.

description: My phone was STOLEN out of my purse while I was wearing it. Not an easy feat, these are professional thieves... beware!
author: Lauren W.

description:
I've been to Skylark twice now. I'm really not much a fan of the city-considering how grimey it is, but I love Skylark.

Walking up to the bar, you hear old school hip hop bumping out the door & there's an attractive bouncer checking IDs. Even my very straight guy friends think he's cute, haha. Anywho, walking into Skylark it's really dimly lit-just the way I like my bars. The more drinks you get in you & the darker it is-the better everyone looks. When you first walk in, to the left, there are a few booths to sit in. Next to those those is the bar, which normally contains about two bartenders & a bar back. In front of the bar-more seating! And then back in the back corner, there is a good sized dance floor with seating & tables around the wall. So there's definitely plenty of seating.

Everytime I've been to this bar & went to order a drink, I've never had to wait more than 3 minutes. I LOVE that. There's nothing better than a bartender on top of their job. The girls are cute & quick! Which you wouldn't think would be too much to ask for, but in busy places like the city & Oakland, it generally is. The drinks are priced VERY fairly. The first time I went, I was drinking whiskey/7-ups & sweet baby Jesus were they strong. The second time, I was drinking chardonay, which the bartenders were making a point to fill my glass to the brim. They know how to get their money!

The only reason I didn't give this bar 5 stars is because the music was a bit slow for my taste on a Saturday evening. Don't get me wrong, they were playing tons of Tribe Called Quest, which is one of the ways to my heart. BUT on Saturdays-I just wanna shake my ass haha. 

Overall, I will be back to Skylark for my monthly visit in November! Good times, strong drinks, attractive people, good music, and FUN!

:)
author: Tori F.

description: Been coming here since my 21st birthday... Always a fun time at the lark! Security is sweet to me, bartender ladies are always cool, ruby skylark is my drink of choice. Monday nights you can smell the kush in the air for Reggae night, always a good time! The crowd is always mixed. So much fun!
author: Jen M.

description: Love love loved it here. GOOD hip hop music without it being too crowded or ... I'll say it... Not ghetto! Not a single complaint. Except maybe the mirror in the girls bathroom is covered In stickers and graffiti but that's petty! I'll definitely be back!
author: Nikki K.

description:
"What if we go there and we can't fade up...hang on I'll call them"

*Ring Ring* 

Chong looks at me hangs up and chuckles while saying "wtf! WTF! was I really gonna call them and ask them if it's cool to fade up on Monday?"

The idea of going to Skylark arose while contemplating how to make our Monday night more memorable. The final brigade and it was between watching Friends with Benefits or smoking and drinking in the mission.

SMOKING AND DRINKING! SMOKING AND DRINKING! 

Parking was found all too quick, but don't let this miracle story fool you because a Monday night in the hipster district doesn't usually entail a filled street, maybe just filled bike racks...several filled bike racks...

But what's this? It got even better. 2 attractive guys (we later found out they were the masterminds behind the music ingenuity we heard all night)  welcomed us and said "NO COVER TONIGHT" What? Really?

I got a Corona and an orange juice for 7 bucks plus tip, which is the usual price I pay for a Corona elsewhere, on top of a ridiculous $20.00 cover charge. 

Their beats slap, Chong and I loved every song that played and we meshed with the interesting crowd. The air was hot and sticky and everyone had passion in their eyes (partners immersing as one to the reggae on the dance floor) friends having a good time, and people either by themselves or away from their friends sitting down just mellowing out. I loved the vibe and the ambience, very unyielding and accepting. I forgot what it was like to just get lost in music, something i haven't done since I was young enough to go to the Warped Tour. 

Did I mention the best part! Rolling up and fading up in the corner and no one giving you a hard time or trynna hit that! God bless this place.
author: Olivia Vanessa R.

description:
I'm not quite sure what this place was before or what it's like on a non-Burning Man Friday night, but I am a fan of the Skylark. It's pretty big inside, has lots of seating, big front windows so there's lots of natural light during the day, and there's a DJ at night that has yet to disappoint or bore me.

Happy hour runs from 5pm to 9pm daily and features $4 draft beers (of which there is a decent selection) and wine, and $5 specialty cocktails. Live burlesque during happy hour on the second Friday of the month. 

There are other specials posted around the bar that are available all night and you can order and pay for tandoori and other Indian appetizers and sweets at the bar from the nearby Alhamra Indian.
author: Kristina A.

description:
Another fun little bar in a long string of fun little bars that I experienced during my San Francisco trip. This time, we decided to hit up the Mission District. By the time midnight hit, the place had a pretty good crowd, both on the dance floor and in the bar area. The DJ was playing a pretty good mix of music, including some hip hop that brought me back to my high school years.

Unfortunately, I don't have much more to say about the place. It's a bar. They serve drinks (which are actually decently priced, but of course, I'm comparing to overpriced Vegas).
author: Paolo D.

description: Came here twice... the day before Thanksgiving & this past Saturday. Cheap drinks & good music. It just sucks that people take up the dance floor by standing around. The crowd is pretty diverse, an even mix of races. There's one bathroom & a line tends to build up. I read a lot of reviews that this place is "ghetto". It's 16th & Mission, what do you expect? The security here are on-point. I witnessed some shit I don't think I'll forget that night. Overall, this place is a cool little spot to go to if you don't mind all the commotion going on.
author: Sara L.

description: The one bar that has a sign that says beware of pick pocketers lol. There is always a fight.a guy was killed there a few weeks ago. If your into the whole trap vibe and hood theme your in the right spot. All your going to find there are a few good girls that didn't know what they got them self into and alot of prostitution
author: Alonzo T.

description:
I came here on the night of my birthday this past Wednesday. It was a cool experience.

One thing that sticks out to me was that the people at the door seemed pretty damn unprofessional with charging cover. When my two friends and I got to the entrance, I got that vibe that they just started to just $5 cover when we got there. Maybe it was $5 all night, but I still got a vibe that we got owned and they just wanted to spite us. This notion was reinforced when I paid some girl, and she gave me change from her personal wallet, wtf? Yeah, so this was kinda whack. But whatever, I was already pretty drunk, we were there, and $5 isn't too steep.

The place is small and cozy, music is decent, and there was some eye candy. Average.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Love this place! Friendly atmosphere, good drinks, and no cover! My friends and I love to come here to relax after a long week. I would've gave this place 5 stars if it wasn't so darn small! The back is where the dance floor is at but it gets really crowded, I think I can handle about five minutes of dancing then I have to come up for air!

Parking is a BITCH, so try carpooling with a designated driver or take BART! its only down the street! Overall a great place to have fun with friends or FIRE IT UP while making new ones! ;-)
author: Miriam H.

description:
DON'T JUDGE A BOOK BY IT'S COVER! 

That saying applies to this bar. 

Ok, so at first I did NOT want to go in. It didn't seem it'd be my scene because I'm so use to bars that play non stop electro/techno/indie funk shit. And the bouncers outside were smoking blunts and seem so thugly that it was intimidating. 

I went here on a Friday night and I ended up having a great time. It plays old school rap, terrible hip hop songs that you use to love in high school, reggae, and some recent popular songs. The DJ was pretty unique with the real turntables, no laptops. 

The crowd was super mixed, dancefloor gets crowded, you gotta squeeze yourself in there. I was able to get my freak on without weirdos creeping on me. Bartenders are super nice and the people are friendly.
author: Danneth C.

description:
No mistakes, this is a grimy locals joint, but it's cheap and the DJ never does me wrong.

Surprisingly mixed crowd on Fri/Sat as well. I guess no matter who you are or where you came from, everyone can appreciate a little Black Rob circa 2000 spinning on the 1s and 2s.

Crowd is a lot friendlier than first impressions would have you believe as well. I once bulldozed straight into a guy who looked like Troy Polamalu's 6'5" 350 lbs. cousin, causing him to spill beer all over himself, and he just gave me a gentle pat on the head and offered to buy me a drink for getting in my way.

Beers instead of beatings. I'll take that any night of the week.
author: Leo K.

description:
Pros-

- AMAZING HIP HOP!!
- Cool diverse crowd!!!
- No cover
- Cheap wine
- Cool red ambiance....
- Really nice bar tenders!!!  Nice staff in general!
- Contrary to what everyone else was saying, It was not ghetto and      parking was just as bad as it is all over the city... stop whining people!!!)

Cons- 

- Small !!!!!!!!!
author: Beth M.

description:
When I go out to the Mission, I expect the following: 

1. Drunk people, especially drunk white people (Thanks Manda!) http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/8IWmfmTLWsGMvN-NCWXJbA/l
2. Drunk people who can't dance (Thanks Manda!) http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/-EvZdQpc4yKNkJcrOnDOmg/l 
3. Drunk people throwing up curbside http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/awI3RxjNwcHW6cBjr0KgzQ/l

I'm not racist. I love white people. Just ask my PIC J$. 

I found all of this at Skylark. I also found cool DJ's http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/3U9eCz8-5xCiVO-nxHGu1A/l , lots of space (tall ceilings are a plus), very awesome bartenders who invited me behind the bar to compare tattoos, and a friendly bouncer who didn't threaten to kick my ass. Aside from that, Skylark's distinction among the Mission seems to be the patrons: I lump them into a category called "I don't live in SF" crowd. 

There's nothing wrong with this group of people. I used to be one of them, so kiss my leet yellow ass. They're just usually the ones who end up getting mugged walking down the wrong street at 2AM while looking for their cars.

There's nothing wrong with nothing being wrong. There's just nothing special. Skylark serves its purpose as a start point, rest stop, or ending destination during your Mission crawl.
author: Jason C.

description:
I've been here a few times and decided to go one more time before I wrote a review. Ya it still gets 3 stars from me. 

-2 for not have any hefeweizen's .. at all.. seriously?! It really needed a minus 2 for that. 

With that said, I like this place. Good crowd of people, good music. We managed to get a table with a group of us. It's a good place to stop and get a drink but I don't think I would spend all night here. Anyone who calls this place ghetto... what do you expect.. you are in the mission after all. :)
author: Danielle K.

description:
Ew, this place is so gross.

Grindhouse was playing on the large screen above the bar.  Really, could you try any harder, Skylark? 

My friend took some skeezeball up on his offer to  dance, not the wisest idea from the start.  And I had to shake his warm, sweaty hand (twice!), then deal with the leering eyes of his cohort.  Where's the antibacterial when you really need it?  

Drinks were not that cheap, not that good, and there was a minimum $20 charge for a credit card tab.  We paid cash and got the hell out of there, quick.

The crowd is just weird.  And gross.  I can't stress that enough.
author: Joanne G.

description: Went there on a friday evening. They had a free burlesque show, which was "interesting".  Drinks were not good. Not cold enough beers, not enough strong or tasty cocktails. There were not too many people and most of them were able to find seats, so that was nice.
author: Rohit J.

description: Was here at 8 and they had inly one bartender so it took a while to get drinks, it was chill though and got a few word in with the bouncer. Came back later at 11 and bouncer hooked it up and let it us all in line skip and all. It was hella crowded though but we were still able to find a table. Had a fun time.
author: Dang L.

description:
I've been to Skylark during the weekend, but I have never been here on a Wednesday.  Apparently, I've been missing out!

$5 cover, drink specials, good jams, and a mixed crowd, what more can you really ask for?  

While I am totally hating work right now on this Thursday morning, I cannot help but reflect on how much fun I had last night and giggle.

Only downside: One bathroom per gender.
author: Christine S.

description: Good energy and good people. Have been on both a Friday and Saturday nights. Cover is cheap, only $3. If you get there early enough you don't pay anything. The DJ was really good, mostly hip hop. Security guards are cool for the most part. The only bad thing is that one of the times I was there there was a shooting right outside so we all had to get on the floor. I literally cut one of my knees because I was wearing a skirt and there was glass on the floor. I also wish it was a bit more spacious.
author: Marlo M.

description: Great drinks reasonably priced. It was just too hot and smelled "fishy" and like a high school dance! The DJ was awesome though! Had the dance floor not stunk, I would've given this place 4 stars!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
I love this place!!! Nice ambiance, great bartender and lite on the pocket book. 
The DJ was well-versed and took requests and played a song for my b-day! Jasmine is the best, she remembered where I was from and that it was my b-day and got me a couple drinks celebrating my commencement! She makes the BEST margaritas ever!!! Definitely heading back when I'm SF.
author: Tony S.

description:
Yikes! This place is kind of a disaster. My girlfriends and I went barhopping one night on Mission, and this place was our second stop. We literally stayed there for 10 mins and then bounced. It's dark, and the crowd was super pushy. Plus, it smelled disgusting in here! It was like a mix of weed and garbage cans (barf). Before we went in, the bouncers told us to keep watch of our phones and to not put them in our back pockets (umm sketchy much?!)
Two stars only go to their music because it was poppin during the 10 mins I stayed!
author: Marilyn W.

description: Small place and a lil dark however I enjoyed every minute of it, to the Barrista show, to the drinks and even the pupusas being cooked outside , I had a great time and wouldnt mind going here again. Possibly on a Saturday night :)
author: Alyce S.

description:
I'm glad I love all sorts of music. Sometimes when I'm not in the mood for some Judas Priest or loungey Brazilian bossa nova, I love listening to hip hop. Back then I used to go to shows in the late 90s/early 00s to check out DJs spinning dope ass beats in the background while b-boys battle each other on the dance floor. 

Went here last night because my cousin and my other friend were spinning at The Deuce (event that takes place every last Sunday here) and since I'm going to be leaving this beautiful city in a couple days, I had to come out and play and see them one last time!

It was pretty chill and laid back and the music (hip hop, including yay area classics, funk and soul) was poppin' (just like my lipgloss!) and the drink special of the night were peach bellinis which I happily sipped the whole night. I didn't get up to dance (food coma---they had birthday cake for some of the DJs and sandwiches) but I had a good time talking to folks and enjoying the music. I'm really going to miss this city and I hope Portland has some bars like this up there!
author: kristin e.

description:
My sorority sisters wanted to go out on a Monday night. Usually I'd say no, but decided that I was up for it because I hadn't hung out with them in a long time. What's good on a Monday? No clue. But we decided to go with the Mission.

Monday night at Skylark = Reggae night. Not my cup of tea, but I'm open for a good night regardless. When we got there, there were a bunch of people outside, so it seemed like a good choice to come here. NO COVER..which is always nice, haha. We walked in & the room smelled like straight-up S M O K E. It was NOT okay. It probably didn't bother a lot of people, but I'm not a fan. It was super crowded though. Music was going..but I guess Reggae isn't my style. Some people had 1 drink here & we left for somewhere else.  

I've been to Skylark before on a different night of the week. It was cool. Nothing too special about it though. 

I don't go to the Mission much. No plans on coming back for Reggae night...but maybe on a different night. 

There's only street parking.
author: Jessica A.

description:
I liked this place. We went there Friday, 6/17/11 at around 12a. The night I went, there were a lot of black people (YUM!), a few white people and then some other mixes. I'm not being racist. I'm just telling you the races who were there on this particular night.
My friends got bothered by some guys, but I didn't. Awesome, bassy, dirty, gritty, rap/hip hop music. Just my style. No cover fee. Super cute bouncer. SUPER CUTE BOUNCER. People were lighting up inside; grinding etc. Got super crowded around 1am.
author: Fi K.

description: This place SUCKS. Trust me, save your cover money and go somewhere better. The bartender that "helped" us was really rude. I approached the bar, the bartender acknowledged me, and some super ignorant dude and his girlfriend pushed by me (there was literally 1 foot between me and the bar) and she served them right away instead. I asked for Avion (pronounced "Ah-vee-own") tequila and soda and she said "What?" and I said AVION, I turn to my boyfriend to confirm that I'm saying it right, and she whisks away to help someone else. She comes back a few minutes later and I say the same thing- point to it- and she tries to correct me by pronouncing it wrong (AY-vee-own, *eyeroll) and said "I didn't have a clue what you were talking about so I just had to come back to you..." Really? RUDE. I then asked for a Bulliet and diet coke... she gives me a bulliet and sprite. At this point I'm like how does she have a job here? To top it off these weak drinks were $8... We left within 5 minutes.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
My friends really wanted to take me here because they said they played good music and had cheap drinks.  I have to say if thats what you are looking for, Skylark is the place to be.  They had 3 dollar well drinks, and can I just say my cranberry/vodka was clear...they are VERY generous there.  Very much worth the $3.00.  We went on a Thursday night and it was hip-hop music and a really good female DJ.  The music was awesome, and the dance floor was small but still danceable....

As the night went on, the dance floor grew more and more crowded, and people kept smoking weed on the dance floor, which I guess if you want to get a contact high is good for you, but I personally don't like second hand smoke going into my lungs when I'm trying to get down, so that bothered me...All in all though it was a really fun place with awesome music and VERY affordable drinks.  Good spot...def would go back!
author: Gaby G.

description:
I would have be REALLY drunk (like fall-on-my-face drunk) to enjoy this place at all. I've accepted the fact that just about every bar/club has its share of ghetto d-bags. BUT, this place is flooded with them...as in every second, there's a dude trying to hump someone from behind... at the bar, at a table, on the dance floor, at the bathroom...seriously, CALM DOWN. Even with my boyfriend there, they would aggressively stare and try to talk to me. 

The music ranged from decent to "my ears are bleeding."
author: Gloria B.

description:
Things I liked about Skylark:

*The bartender was super friendly immediately upon arriving
*My Stella tasted particularly refreshing and sweet (?)
*The Dj was playing good hip hop like Gang Starr
*Friendly people approached us and bought us 2 more beers, which then turned into fun conversation w/ potential new friends
*The appealing eye candy sitting at the bar
*It's location in the Mission
*It's a good place to pop into if you're waiting for the 22 bus 
*The round tables in the front, providing better conversation for groups
*The Trivia question napkins

Yup it has some cool features...so basically A-OK sums it up.
author: Sonya D.

description:
This review is only for Mixtape Wednesday, and maybe sometimes on Monday. 

Mixtape Wednesday is a good event with some even cooler people. The drinks can be a bit pricey but they make them pretty well. The music is good, and so are the friendly staff. 

Check it out if you get a chance, you won't be disappointed. Or will you?
author: Louis C.

description:
According to Rebecca Solnit, author of "Infinite City," the Mission District of San Francisco is at the city's phrenological crossroads between "Love of Sex" (SoMa) and "Desire for Liquids". 16th Street is specifically designated "Desire for Liquids", and after a trip to Skylark the reasons are obvious. 

Very strong, reasonably priced drinks. Great music (it was old-school hip-hop night). Conveniently located on the 16th Street corridor just a block from the BART. The scene here is a mix of the young professional crowd, hipsters, and locals from the Mission.

The place was surprisingly neither jam-packed nor deserted, at 10pm on a Friday, so it was a great launching pad for the rest of our night.
author: David P.

description:
This spot definitely gets crackin on the weekends. They got a boss looking bouncer outside making sure underage kids don't get in. When you walk in you know this is a hood rich party with sweet dank aromas flowing through the air and the beats hitting strong. In the back, you can see people getting down and sloppy drunk on the dance floor. 

Best and worst thing about this place is the men's room. Once you open the door and step in, this wave of rank piss hits you right in the face, so bittersweet in a weird way. The room itself looks like a mini dungeon from a saw movie. But the best thing is the community urinal, it's an honor to see one of these relics from the past still in action. It's an old school tub looking thing that can accommodate 2.5 people at the same time.

About the drinks, mediocre. 

If you're looking for a hood party in the city, this place is the place to be.
author: Patrick L.

description:
Fun place for some drinks after work. They're not strict with their dress code and music was on point- 90's hip hop to current . Pretty crowded but still had enough room to dance around. Only frustration were the drunks bumping into me and spilling my drink! 

One of the bartenders was too slow but friendly. Drinks were good. Can't go wrong with tequila on rocks :)
author: Y R.

description:
Last night the Skylark saved my life... cause you gotta get down girl. 

Ok, so it wasn't actually last night but Sunday but who the fck is counting anyways? 

Sunday was a fun day at Delores with a cute boy who was moving way too fast.  Mucho rapido para mi.  We had left the park and he was talking about going somewhere where we could be alone.   Then it hit me!!!  We're right by my favorite ass shaking location.  Score one Skylark, zero for Don Juan.  

Got there around 9:30pm.  For all you serious shakers I recommend coming early as the dance floor is free and the music is bumpin.  The (cuter then the guy I was with) bartender made me a perfect vodka cran and that's when it began.  

Dancin' dancin' dancin!!!!!

Been coming here off an on for about a decade anytime I've really just needed to move my feet and always been pleased.  Never had anything stolen, seen any fights, smelt anything funky, or what ever else people are bitching about.  Always a good time.  No regrets.... except that I didn't even get the bartenders name.  Goodness gracious.... way too cute or maybe it was the heavy pour.  Nope, he was a little dope.  

Oh, also right near the 16th Street Bart which is kinda awesome if you want to shake it for a bit before you head home.   Sucks that Bart closes at Midnight though as I was tempted to order just one more.  

I've mos def been there later.  I've been there until the lights came on numerous nights, but I stand by my favorite time to be there is before the dance floor gets packed and your ass gets grabbed (1:55am).  Realistically though, you can't shake what your Mama gave ya and not expect a little bad behavior.  

Skylark, I don't care what people say.... I fckn love you and your dirty beats.
author: Misty M.

description: I came up to visit SF with a few of my girls for my best friends birthday. I didn't think we'd find anything crackin on a Wednesday night but I was wrong. It wasn't crazzzyyyy, but I had fun! Skylark has a good feel to it, I loved the music, and mostly loved the crowd. I don't know if it's Skylark or it's just Frisco-heads in general, but it was nice to be offered a few "you don't look like you're from around here, welcome" dranks as soon as I walked in from chill, NONcreepy boys. That doesn't happen too often in SoCal :)
author: Elysse P.

description: I went with friends to go for drinks and hit the dance floor. The drinks were affordable and music was pretty good. The place wasn't totally packed but had enough people to have a good time with. Its close to public transportation too.
author: Rigel A.

description:
Skylurk! Can be awesome, can be creepy, can be smelly can be fun...it is what it is! It's a cool spot on 16th if you want to chill with friends, dance, listen to hip-hip or just hang out; kind of an all-in-one bar. Always a lot of people here Friday & Saturday nights so it's def. one of the places to be on the street. 

They have 3-4 of their own specialty drinks and a combo of corona + shot of patron called the juan on juan for $11...Not sure that's much of a deal though since a shot of patron and a shot of patron would probably come out to $12 or so, but whatever, I get it anyways. 

Pros:
- No Cover charge
- Hip-hop music + amazing DJ
- Good drinks/not slow behind the bar
- dance floor + tables across the bar.
- No dress code (it's a bar!)
- They take card (forgot the minimum though if there is one)

Cons:
- It's small (but kind of makes it cozy and cramped)
- No baseball caps.

An awesome thing about Skylark (indirectly) is that it's on 16th street so there's plenty of bars to check out and a ton of food on the street. Add this to your 16th street bar hopping list!
author: Arnold N.

description: i love skylark!!! Best music and nice sized open dance floor. I prefer weekdays cuz weekends get very crowded. Old school hip hop is my fave n this place is slappin.
author: Julia ..

description: Can you say creepers?  I have been here a few times because my friend is in love with the place, and each time I've felt uncomfortable.  There are dudes who just sit and stare at the dancing girls...I mean I guess this happens at all clubs/bars but since this place is so small, I notice it more. Anyway, I've just never been impressed by this place.  Like i said, my friend hearts it so I'm obligated to go.  She loves the attention she gets from the creepers, so ya... Anyway, this is not my first choice, although I did notice the new sign and it does draw more attention than the old one did.
author: Steph L.

description: Went on reggae night. Pretty casual atmosphere and the drinks were big and cheap, my vodka cran was strong and fairly priced for 5$. It was crackin for a Monday night! I would definitely hit it up on a weekend night.
author: Julie H.

description: Great drinks, great music... just a great place to hang out with friends. Whether you wanna dance or just have a few drinks this place is it for me.
author: Adree A.

description:
This place has gotten pretty sketchy on the weekends. I still love the music ( old school hip hop) and the fact that they don't charge a cover. 
We were literally in the middle of two fist fights on Friday night. They started at the women's bathroom and rolled out onto the dance floor. Felt like I was on an episode of Jersey Shores. Not a good look...
author: Ravi K.

description:
Promise: I had made a statement to my friend to be nicer to people at bars/clubs, well...look where it got me?

Scene: Crowded dance floor. Girl (I thought was drunk) fell on me, so I turned around to ask if she was okay. Her and her jerk friends laughed and then mocked me with "are you okay?" Wow, when did asking if someone was okay become something to be mocked for - well, eff you very much, next time you fall, I hope you hit the dance floor, literally because this bitch will not be there to catch you. Just sayin.

I went from never coming here to being here three times in the past two weeks with different sets of friends. I guess this is THE spot. I've had fun each time I have gone because of great company, but there were a few bumps in the road here and there with the aforementioned event being the most upsetting.  

There are definitely good times to be had at this place, but beware of creepers and lurkers while you dance and people who may fall on you and then be mean to you. 

Ruby skylark is the drink I'd recommend. :)

$20 credit card limit when busy and no limit when it's not. See how much I've learned!
author: Dolores L.

description:
Great experience last night during the fundraiser for the flood victims of the Philippines.  Of course, it was attributed to the small yet sizable crowd, no creepers, dance worthy music and a non-gross women's restroom for once.  Everyone who worked there was chill and friendly.   This probably isn't the experience you'd get on the weekends.... Home turf tuesdays plays a mix of r n b, hip hop and reggae.  Thank God for that, cause I'm so sick of that trance electro sh**. 
Drinks were strong (enough).  My favorite that night was called a Grapefruit Skylark?  Tasted exactly like the fruit, and hid the taste of alcohol pretty well.
author: Sierra D.

description:
Yelp Rating says 5-stars equals "Woohoo! As good as it gets!"

It can definitely get better.  But I will say that if you have your expectations low and are ready for some shenanigans, this is the place to be.  Just come in with a comedic attitude and you'll be fine
