Ever watch a movie so terrible that its actually good? Or hear a song that is so awful that it becomes a hit? Like being Rick Rolled?  Well this little gem is so bad that its good.   Come here with your friends and you'll leave with great stories to tell.  The only caveat is that great stories are seldom from good experiences.  

In all seriousness, the music is pretty damn good at the Skylark.  You'll hear some of the best 90's rap and hip hop.
author: Tuan M.

description:
The postive:
-Smoking weed is pretty much legal here in the back
-The drinks are cheap to average in price
-There is no cover to get in

The lame:
-It's usually slightly empty
-The floors and walls look "sticky"
-The bathroom line is longer than the line to get in
-The guys there look lame, and the girls are usually fat. (just being honest no time to get pissy)
author: Melzie C.

description: Always a rad place to check out. Not the fanciest place in San Francisco, and not in the best neighborhood but if you like an old fashioned dive bar with awesome bartenders then this is your Bar. It's pretty close to Dolores park so we always make it a point to stop here. They have live DJ's and their drink specials are awesome. Every time I come here I end up spending 6 hours there with out even realizing it.
author: Kayla D.

description: I absloutley love this bar, I come here often and the bartenders are so warm and welcoming. The musics awesome and I always have a great time there! The bartender always has a new creation for me to try and that is hard to find my friend ,I will admit the crowd gets a little wild"rachet" but I mean if you don't bother them they won't bother you. Love this place
author: Anissa H.

description:
Lots of mixed reviews but I had a blast here. Came here after having dinner at The Summit and got my dance and drink on with my cousin and our friends. Before we knew it, our buddy Mel decides to get on the turntables and plays many old school songs and happily dedicates Ready for The World's "Oh Sheila" to his girlfriend Sheyla. 

Imagine drunken dancing and romancing with grinding and double shots in hand. Dance dance, da da dance. 

Wicked hangovers for everyone except yours truly as I was DD, but it was a damned good night. Need a replay! Who's in?
author: Tisha G.

description:
Sad to say we went here on New Year's Eve and it was a huge disappointment.  They charged $5 before 10PM, which okay fine it's NYE, acceptable.  They kept telling us people would be rushing in any minute and it would go up to $15/head.  So we just went in.  

Place was dead empty and you could sit anywhere you'd like.  Bar was empty so we ordered some drinks.  Someone ordered a goose and tonic and the other person ordered a gin and tonic. Badly enough with no one in the whole bar, the sucky bartender made a super sorry drink with 90% tonic.  Really?!  That's why I just stuck with straight shots man.  In order to make those drinks taste like a normal goose and tonic, my friends had to order a shot of goose and a shot of gin, then separately and pour it into their goose/gin and tonic.  That's just all bad.  Killed the mood and the experience.  Could have just made some drinks at home.

As the night progressed, sluttier and sluttier, yet fatter and fatter chicks kept arriving.  They thought they were hot ish because they started dancing on each other where people were sitting near the bar.  NOT CUTE if you're larger than life.  Have some class.  It's not a hoe show.

The dance floor was packed.  After the clock struck twelve and everyone started trickling out a million people tried to exit as two of my friends tried to head to the dance floor o the right side of the road.  Everyone was stuck in a jam and this fattty mcfat fat (seriously huge) decided to yell at my friend, saying "move your fat ass."  This coming from her to him when he is a stick.  Hilarious!  But anyway, this place is g-h-e-t-t-o with bad drinks, dirty bathrooms, low class folks, and horrible bartenders. Oh wait, I already said that.  Anyway...don't come here.  Go to the place around the corner.
author: Dee H.

description:
I can see this place being a hit or miss just depending on the crowd that is present on the night you go.

We had some creepers, but they weren't bothersome.  Music was good (actually old school, not hip hop that is 2 years old), and that's enough to keep me around, despite a less-than ideal crowd.  We came here from double dutch, and I was much more happy with this scene.

Pretty pricey, which can be annoying, because I'm not sure why YOUR stoli-soda needs to be more than $7, EVER, but maybe your soda water has electrolytes in it... idk?
author: Ashley B.

description:
I'm not familiar with San Francisco, let alone the Mission area, and I expected it to be pricey. I was pleased to find that this was not entirely the case. Skylark has no cover, which is an immediate plus in my eyes. The locals claim this place has great music, particularly Hip-Hop. Sure enough, the dj's selections were one point.

However, I had to take a few stars off. The drinks were not that cheap. Most of the mixed drinks I ordered were about 7-8 dollars. Since this is more of a dive bar spot, I would've preferred it to be a little less than that (or maybe I'm just super cheap). Also, there was a $20 credit card limit at the bar and I heard that the bathroom situation wasn't that great.

Other than that, it seems to be a pretty chill place. Walk in, grab a vodka redbull, and nod your heads to the sounds of A Tribe Called Quest and Gang Starr.
author: Sash E.

description:
To be fair, I'm going to list its pros before cons:
- good dance music (hiphop and reggae)
- Ghetto.
- no cover
- If you're a woman, chances are you'll be the tallest and thinnest one there. At least that's how I felt.  And I'm only 5'3"...
- they serve alcohol, if you can get to the bar.
- they are near BART
- um.... 

CONS:
- Ghetto. This is both a pro and con, depending on who you are.
- If you're a man, chances are you're the shortest and weakest one there. There are some BIG MEN at that joint, and they like to fight.
- No room anywhere, at all, for anyone. Dance like a sardine, sandwiched between the short, fat women and the massive, punching men.

So now you've been warned. If you are a massive man looking for a fight, have at it.  If you are a woman of homely appearance, you can go be the Hot Thang.  If you are neither of those, keep close to the door so you can flee when the Samoans start throwing each other around.
author: Mari C.

description:
Watch out- this place can be a bit sketchy.

I went here on a Saturday night for a friends birthday. No cover, fun dancing, but my iphone was stolen. right out of my purse. Another one of my friend's also lost a phone, and another, a purse.  SO, beware: keep your belongings close.
author: Leslie S.

description:
Juan on Juan = shot of Patron and a Corona ... $11

NO cover

Dope, laid back music (not that crappy club shit you hear everywhere else, sorry Jason DeRulo)

Mixed crowd filled with all kinds of random ass people.

Good foods spots open late all around the area.

...and sometimes they project cartoons on the wall !!!
author: Tim L.

description:
Let me keep this very simple: MONDAY NIGHTS REGGAE.

Cons:
The seedy neighborhood, the slightly cramped space, and the not so glam venue.

Pros:
AAAMMAAAZIINGG DJ's. Its a laid back atmosphere, with an eclectic mix of friendly locals, the drinks are inexpensive, and the fun goes on till 2. Plus, there's tons of late night food joints nearby for those late night munchies. The dance floor is  separated from the general lounge area, and the best part,  there's no cover charge. Yeaup, all this awesomeness fo' free!!


Take a cab to and from the place, and you have virtually no reason not to stop by. See you on the dance floor!
author: Gabriella C.

description: Pickpocketers!!!!! My girlfriend had her wallet stolen out of her purse. Look at the other reviews and you'll see that it's a regular occurrence. Don't go here!
author: Thomas L.

description:
This is the first bar that I stepped into with NO ALCOHOL smell! It smelled so sterile and clean, if you closed your eyes you wouldnt know that you were in a bar!

We were pulled into this bar due to its projected ambience from outside. A DJ was playing music (I cant tell what genre he was playing but all I can say was that it was good music!). Once inside, the ambience was even better....pretty and soothing deco.

The bartender was nice and friendly eventhough he insisted to see my ID as he thought I was underaged. Ruby Skylark was the drink I ordered. The bartender checked on us a few times to see if we liked our drinks and came back to for longer conversations as maybe he thought we were chattier and friendlier than other drunks, lol. 

We left the place feeling good and happy! Thanks to the service and the A-A-A-A-A-ALCOHOL!
author: Elly G.

description: I was attacked by two huge girls (more like whales) thirty seconds from walking in. The bouncer named, DeDe, confiscated my friends pepper-spray before we walked in. I could have used that to defend myself, so maybe this bar should re-evaluate some of its rules. As soon as my two friends and I walked in, these two girls shove their way through to the front. I turn and say, "Hey you don't need to shove" and without warning the tall one (about 6'2") turns around and launches towards me with a fist. So I duck and protect my face (I'm only 5'2" and less than 100 lbs btw). I feel her hitting me a few times and as soon as she backs up I go to hit her, but her huge friend comes at me from the side and attscks me too. Shortly after, the fight is broken up by the crowd. I have minor injuries and the bouncers take my friends and I to the corner. Then, they kick us out... No report, no questions. What kind of establishment does that? I'm appalled by the bouncers and the ghetto ass girls that attend this place. For as big as those girls were, I could have been seriously injured. DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE. You're safety is in jeopardy.
author: Aileen S.

description: I'm not very impressed by Skylark. After a while, all the bars in the mission begin to look the same and this is no exception. It is the  first bar from the 16th Bart Station that I always end up at in between plans. I don't think I'm very much into it but the bartenders are nice?...Yeah.
author: Hannah A.

description: I will say my glass is half full on this one.. Great music, mostly Hip Hop.. Tables in the front..dancing in the rear..if you can elbow your way through the crowd.. It felt like a closed tupperware in here after awhile..need. more. air..cough* Gasp*.. But aside from that, I had a fan-effing-tastic time popping my booty to da beats. The place was crowded and the crowd was hot, sweaty hot, but having a great time.
author: Sara F.

description: Good music, not too crowded, just my style. Other bars in the area get way too jam packed and too hot. This place can get crowded but not bad enough that I can't move around and dance. Bartender was really nice and you don't have to wait too long to get drinks. Groups usually just stop by for a bit before moving on to the super poppin' bars (extremely packed) so you don't have to wait long to get a seat or table along the side. The bouncers were funny and frisked my friend for his birthday. Hilarious.
author: Leslie Y.

description:
A friend once described this place as "the gift that keeps on giving."  That is correct if the gift you're searching for is a raunchy, outspoken, disastrous harlot of the night.  Can't lie, we (Amol R., Soonde and Jones)  used to spend way too many nights in "the lark."  WAY TOO MANY!  I had to take a stand.

Meat market defined.  The parties aren't bad, if you enjoy a packed dance 'club,' too often full of undesirables.  I would give less stars but from what I remember, the young ladies were always happy to dance.  Sometimes too much so.

the juan on juans (yes, multiple) and a little jager made for interesting -and luckily for the ages, cataloged (read: recorded)-stories.  

I feel like I'm drunk right now just thinking about that place.  

Also, if you're gunna go, be drunk.
author: jan s.

description:
I am a fan, indeed. I love me some mission dive bars, and when I want to start the night with some hard liquor before I switch to pints, my first stop is always skylark. 

Wells are 3 dollars, the bartenders are helpful and generous and they have even let me sample stuff on occasion. All of the house drinks are pretty good but the RUBY SKYLARK is what gets the night off to a great start. Its a concoction of ruby red absolut ( a heavy heavy pour), grapefruit and pineapple juice. They taste delicious but look out because they can sneak up on you! They have a wide selection of booze ( ouzo shots and pear cider chaser anyone?) 

No matter the DJ, the vibe continues to be chill. A wide mix of folk no matter the day. If 420, chill beats, dark interiors and sparkly gold cushions are not your thing, please don't ruin it for the rest of us. 

Plus one star for trivia napkins, minus one star for single stall ladies room (gross but its a dive bar people!). Plus one star for taking cc ( usually without a minimum during happy hour). Minus one star for shootings happening outside ( I want to hope its unrelated). Plus one star for always running into people from high school in their grown and sexy attire! 

Get there early to make hh prices and snag a table!
author: Ali R.

description:
Wasn't really sure what to expect when we came on a Wednesday night. Much to my surprise there were quite a bit of people. When we got to the door I was a little shocked they were charging $5 a head for entry. We debated it among the 3 of us and decided to go in anyway since we drove all the way to the city and already committed. 

I won't lie, there were a bunch of dudes. I'd say a good 75% were guys. Again, already committed so we chug along. Fortunately the drink specials were reasonably priced and the music wasn't bad. We made the best of it and took advantage of the drink specials.
author: Jan C.

description:
Music was good. I was totally all over the dance floor...but I think I was the only one...

Given...it was early on a Wednesday night so that could have attributed to lack of people willing to dance.
author: Lidia Z.

description:
Went here twice..went on thursday, which the DJ was spinning nothing but 80's music..reminded of my nostalgic days growing up..went back on a monday nite and bonus...reggae nite! love this place immediately 

The drinks were reasonable and strong..cool, local folks..none of that stuckup..im out of town vibe that usually get on the bigger and trendier bars..
author: Mark R.

description: It was cool in here, nice spot. Full bar, nice happy hour. Had a live Dj, spinnin Hip-Hop [very happy about that]. I was here for a good 3 hours. The drinks are standard prices. Top Shelf $10+. They seemingly have a more private area upstairs in the rear. Part of the interior design is this upper level. It's a good size place to dance and do your thing. But, definitely go on a good night is the key.
author: Erik R.

description:
I hardly leave reviews as I choose not to persuade based on my experiences, but after a random (7/3/2012)  outing with two of my girlfriends they asked me to leave a review since I already had an account.

This is for the hardworking ladies who bounce multiple careers and hardly has the time to go out into the nightlife anymore, but when they get the phone call from their girlfriends urging you to go out since "tomorrow's a holiday, no excuses".  When you don't feel like getting all dressed up to just go into the city, but have to look presentable since your old pals from college come into town, you have to show them a good time, then you hit up the bars!

Yes we often get stares since we RUN in a diverse group (when we're the crowd that comes through Asian, Latina, and African American: holla).

As we drove into the City, we get the phone call that our other friends from out of town will no longer be joining us. What do we do? Turn back on the bridge or party like we're out of town... I picked the latter (Hey, since I already wasted $$$ of my makeup for the  night that you can't get back lol).

To our luck, we got to the City with no problem, found parking a block away and started walking to the bar when I remembered (oh snap, I forgot how the neighborhood looks and we're a little too overdressed). Everyone else in the bar were dressed casual and even though we thought we were under-dressed for the club, we were WAY too overdressed for the bar. FAIL!

The bouncer/security guard was cool. He even directed me to the restroom later that night when I didn't have my contacts on and was bummed when I couldn't find it. There was no line since it was a Tuesday night, but I guess they have something called Home Turf Tuesdays? here weekly so it was mainly hiphop and BAY music. HEYYY! Finally, none of that techno music you could never dance to in Vegas. lol

It wasn't that packed yet when we arrived at 10:30ish, but there was a good amount of people. We grabbed our drinks from the bar first from the guy bartender who was quick and attentive. Kudos!

Then, we walked to find somewhere to sit (there's limited seating) because who wants to stand up and sip their liquor when you're a lady. We got lucky since there was a table spot right near the DJ set up was and we asked some patrons one table over if the table was free and she said she thought so, but the DJ was sitting there before (oops, sorry if we hogged your table DJ)!  We sat there for a majority of the night since I've never really been sober enough to check out the crowd. It was diverse and everyone was really into their own thing which was cool. Sure, we had a few people come up to us, but we just laughed it off, we weren't trying to have our noses stuck in the air like our **** didn't stank, but we were definitely not getting up to dance with them lol. So we just kept drinking and drinking...

Tip: The tables are a little slippery so if someone bumps into the table or if someone's heel kicks the table by accident (which happened), be ready for the aftermath. Glasses and liquor spilled all over the floor. We sat at the table not quite sure if we needed to start wiping the floor (OCD mentality) or go tell one of the bartenders. To our surprise, one of the many DJs that were spinning that night must have seen what happened so he came over and asked us what type of drinks we had, and I wasn't sure why he asked us that question. I was thinking he would've been more concerned with the glass on the floor. He disappeared for a few minutes and we weren't sure if he was going to report us for the mess or not, but HE appeared with drinks for us! And, the barback came a few minutes after him to help us clean up the mess. How nice!! I still felt totally bad even though I didn't cause the incident, so I leaned over and gave her a $20 tip to thank her. We couldn't find the DJ until later that night to thank him for the drinks also. Such a sweetheart. We never got his name though.

We were ready to bar hop down the street, but for some reason we enjoyed ourselves at Skylark that night enough to stay there for the entire night and then we left to grab food!

A Great Night out with my close gfs  to toast to a Good Life.

Other Quick Tips:
*Don't expect too much from a chill bar. Cheap Drinks (They have specials), Open Small Dance Floor, and Music you can dance to.
*If you don't want to be grabbed onto by creepers, then don't make yourself available to do so. We handled it pretty well.
*We liked how they had multiple DJs spinning all night (especially female DJs) woot woot!
*Nice DJs and attentive staff
* More packed and no breathing room on Fri and Sat
author: C T.

description:
Bad experience at the skylark involving a bouncer...

Talked to a few other people who have had similar experiences with the staff here. Seems like the management of the skylark hire thugs, not people with any kind of professionalism, and this makes for a dangerous environment, not a place to let loose and enjoy oneself. 

If you choose to go, just be careful.
author: Alan S.

description:
Really?  What is so great about this place?  *Yawn*

This is the kind of bar to visit only if you happen to be stumbling around the area and can't physically walk any further.
author: Cianne M.

description: You might get shot, but it's totally worth is for the sweet hip-hop dancy dance that goes down there -- wear your sluttiest outfits b/c lord does it get steamy.
author: Rachel N.

description:
This would be the definition of San Francisco.  This place has talented DJs jamming nonstop different days of the week.  Diverse crowd.  The drinks are strong and not too expensive.  This is definitely a place to go to, if you want to get your groove on. Reggae/Dancehall is on Monday Nights and it is 4/20 friendly on that day. Why yes, you read right! 4/20 friendly inside! Awesome environment and you feed off people's positive energy. Awesome! 

One night, my friend and I, pre-gamed before bar hopping and just went inside here, and danced the night away, without having to buy any drinks. Pure dopeness! :)
author: Antonina B.

description: Hidden, mad reggae on Monday nights.  Don't come if you want to avoid second-hand smoke! :)
author: manish v.

description:
this whack ass club.... do not go here... my phone was stolen and security didn't help, bartender didn't help, bouncer didn't help.  this place is hella ghetto!!!!!!!!!!  if you don't have an entourage than do not enter this place.  these people are hella sketchy!!!!   when my phone was stolen the security was trying to escort me out of the club when i reported it.  then i went to the bartender and she was trying to give me the owners name but she only gave me the first name and last name initial.  which tells me they all know whats going on there.  then i left and was trying to ask the bouncer who the owner is so i can talk to the owner about the issue he wouldn't tell me.. luckily i have a witness and cops were rolling by 16th street and i flagged them down.  made a police report and will never return here again... they do not know who they messed with ... be careful when you go here.. do not bring any valuable items because if you do they will not help you if someone takes them... 

apparently thats been a problem from what the bartender told me .. and the cop that took the police report..

i would not even put one star bu only to post this....
author: Merrell D.

description:
This place was pretty busy even on a weeknight, which is usually a good sign. I support the whole marijuana legalization ordeal but when I was there, it seemed that many of the patrons were getting lit which is okay but I don't particularly appreciate smelling like pot when I didn't even smoke any! It might have just been the night - it was kind of a themed night so maybe it's not always like that (wow, i'm at work right now and Bob Marley just came on the radio - coincidence??)

The bar itself is pretty cool. I accidentally walked into the men's bathroom though because I didn't know the women's bathroom was on the right. I was wondering why there was a huge trough in the bathroom and why it smelled and looked really bad. I just shrugged it off though considering it was a bar's restroom. My boyfriend made fun of me though when I complained and told me it was the men's bathroom. 

So today's lesson, the women's bathroom at Skylark is on the RIGHT SIDE!
author: Christina B.

description:
Came on Wednesday night because I kept hearing that it's the place to be midweek...

LOVE the DJ!!!  Would go back strictly for this!  But the bartenders are also nice, though they knew the person who was ordering my drinks because he is a Wednesday night regular...so not sure how I would've been treated if I was ordering myself.

Bouncer tried to make me pay cover but I laughed it off like he was joking because um...there's no cover at Skylark...is there?!
The female running the door for the promoter that night was awesome!!...Nice to meet you Tran!! =D

Skylark is HOT!!!!  No really...it's like a freakin sauna in there!  No sardine dancin on the dance floor for me.  Now I know why we were just chillin at the bar near the door...to get some breeze/air!!  But it's okay...I'll dance anywhere so at the bar it is.

I wouldn't plan to come here unless I was meeting people here, but I wouldn't complain about coming either...it's a cool chill spot.
author: Ninja H.

description: Good drinks, no cover, nice booths, napkins have trivia on them.
author: Matthew P.

description:
Been here several times on Thursday nights. Pretty decent place, kinda ghetto crowd, if you're into that. Recently, as we speak I've been denied by the one bartender countless times after he acknowledged me. I'll say one visit everything, but the douche with the facial hair. Looks Latin could be white is one of the worst bartenders ever. You can see by my past reviews this isn't a bs incident. 

Thursday nights ok. The douch bartender. No. I give it
One stars bc I've had a decent time here before. The douche bartender just fails it. Wouldve been a 4.
author: Steven C.

description:
Skylark is a nice place to keep in your back pocket.

By that I mean it's a surefire go-to spot. I've seen 2 sides to this place. On special/ weekend nights, it was wild 'n crazy, especially on NYE. Around peak hours it's pretty much crackin'. And no doubt, it gets crazy packed.

Music consists of a good mix between hip hop, rap, R&B, and old school hits (right on). Drinks like $10 Tokyo Teas are well made but can gradually damage your wallet. But if you don't mind limiting your selection, they offer a number of drinks at discounted prices. But for anyone, having 'x' amount of drinks can lead to 'x' amount of fun. So drink responsibly.

On the other hand, nights can also be chill. I tend to appreciate the atmosphere more without all the hustle and bustle of a packed house. Slowing it down once in a while isn't half bad. Somewhere in between the pace of the music, spotting a cute female bartender and the dim mood lighting, I was put at ease. Strangely, it was serenity in the works.

Overall, Skylark isn't the best nor the worst. Recommend it, I will because if I'm ever barhopping in the Mission, I'd know this place would come in handy.
author: Will S.

description: If I'm going out and if the city happens to be s.f I have to go to skylark I love this place its okay in size but I cant complain I always end up having an awesome time
author: Hanna T.

description:
Enjoy'd a night out with friends last Saturday. 

Pros: No cover, Diverse crowd, Inexpensive drinks, Bay Area Music. And if you don't want to spend your money at the bar, there is a corner store literally two doors down! : )

Cons: Only two bathrooms (one for the men and the other for women), Crowded, Small dance floor, needs better ventilation. Dance floor smelled like urine!!! Yuck! 

If you are drunk enough...any place can be a happy place :) 

Would I be back? Sure. No doubt. It's definitely a lively place!
author: E C.

description:
I've been to Skylark on both Tuesday and Friday evenings.  Tuesday was  real treat, because it wasn't too crowded, my drinks were just right, and the music was off the hook.  I danced until I started spinning, and had to catch that last Bart train home.

Now Friday, that was an entirely different evening.  We were there way too early; so although we were able to enjoy happy hour prices and socialize, there was no DJ--bummer!  And as time passed, a burlesque troupe prepared to perform.  Um, no, not how I want to spend my Friday, so we left and hit up another spot.

I'm looking forward to another Tuesday evening, and possibly a Saturday.  We shall see...
author: Felicia P.

description: This is my Monday party.  It is Reggae Night.  The drinks are expensive, so drink before hand.  Or in front of the front door like everyone else... not joking, there is a party of it's own thrown by those dressed too shittily to get in, i.e. winners.  The crowd is always the same, the music is great, and the air is thick. ;) It is very crowded and never try to go to the bathroom, but if you muscle your way to a table it is a perfect place to start off your week talking with friends in the the smoke.
author: Meara G.

description:
I came here on a night where they had female DJs spinning. I must say its one thing to be a female DJ, but the fact that they played good music that night makes it even more amazing. You can say it was rather hot haha. 

They did charge cover that night, but only for the support of the DJs. I guess they normally don't charge cover here, but considering they played a good mix of hip-hop/r&b (especially from the 90s), I didn't mind paying.

The place has they "ok let's go have a couple drinks and move on to the next bar" feel to it. Nothing wrong it, it's just that I don't picture myself being there with a group of people for the entire evening. Hey, at least I considered coming here. It's not the nicest looking place either, but what do you expect? Something like a Vegas nightclub? Pfft.

Crowd here is pretty good too, though it was predominantly hipster. No rude folks or anything like that. In addition, there's plenty of space to sit. Then again, there weren't too many people inside yet since we got there when nightlife hours started. Nonetheless, it's a good place to get your bar hopping night started. Solid 3.5 stars.
author: Loren John B.

description: i've been going to this place for the past few years and this place never disappoints me. I usually go here on Thursday and Saturday nights (randomly). The music they play are hip-hop and some old school hip-hop, which are not bad. The area could be a little ghetto, since it's in the middle of Mission but other than that, it's a perfect place where you could just randomly go on a random night out. It's definitely a great last minute night out.
author: Toni Rose M.

description:
This place is actually really fun.  When I first thought of a bar in the Mission, I did not expect anything too special.  Man, the drink specials at this place are a great deal:

$6 Slamsterdam - a Jager type of drink (really sweet for my opinion)
$11 Juan on Juan - a shot of Patron and a Corona

The other ones i don't quite remember, but there is a dance area for those girls you are with to dance if they want to.  

One thing to beware is the guys' bathroom is weird.  They have one of those horse trolley things that is really weird.
author: Min P.

description:
Skylark never disappoints. I've been here mostly on Thursday nights since it's not too crowded. Coming here on a Friday or a Saturday is always too crowded and I usually end up leaving and going to another bar. 
On Thursday nights they play Hip-Hop, the music is good, and the drinks are moderately priced. 
Aside from seeing people outside getting taken away by paramedics due to alcohol poisoning, the Mission is the best part of the city to go bar hopping in.
author: Pish P.

description: It's a bar with music.  The bartendars are OK and the dancefloor is tiny.  The bathrooms are your average bar bathrooms.  The parking sucks (mission) but the crowd is cool (when I went).  Oh yeah, i went on a Thursday night and shout out to DJ Inkfat for throwing on some really great hiphop.
author: Don A.

description: this place is pretty dope. i used to come here during the week to hear good music and have a couple drinks! service was great they play good hip hop and i like the whole look of this place. this is always a spot to visit when i come to SF!
author: Christian D.

description:
Fun bar my homies, cronies, and damsels like to hit up for a light weight groove session. 

Small and gets pretty packed. Some rift raft strolls through this place but security/management does its best to regulate. They play "slappers" "slumpers" and "thumpers" old and new on the regular and sometimes allow you to smoke jah herb right smack dab in the middle of the dance floor. Worth stopping by for a a drink and a dance if your in the area and bar hopping, wouldn't stay for more than a few hours in my humble and honest opinion + I've seen a few fights go down here. 

I've had some great memories @ the Skylark no doubt!
author: Phil H.

description:
Went here on Saturday night for like 10 mins.

No cover.  Bouncer didn't card us as we just walked past him and inside.  Place was hella crowded.  Crowd was hella ghetto.  Music was straight hip-hop ghetto bay area club hyphy shit.

Place was small and reminded me of those ghetto basement parties around the dance floor.

Saw someone get punked outside in front of his girlfriend.  Had to bust out the SFPD who didn't do shit, the SF fire department, and an ambulance.  Pretty funny scene.

Located right next to some Mexican and Pizza joints.
author: Chris T.

description:
This tiny place was packing quite a diverse crowd. I appreciate that they don't charge cover, and their drinks are reasonably priced. The bartenders were friendly and attentive. Pretty chill bouncers, good hip-hop/R&B selection on Fridays. 

People on the dance floor kept swaying into me, either because they were so drunk or they just didn't care. The floor itself was sticky, and funky smelling in some areas. You'll have to wait for the restroom since there's only one for men and one for women.
author: Leilani N.

description:
Out of all the bars i went too, this one was one of my favorites. Yes its sketchy but it reminded me of one of my favorite dive bars in LA. 

The music is sick, drinks are cheap and strong, and you have your shady guys trying to hit you up, so beware just incase your boo leaves to use the restroom.
author: Aidan V.

description:
I only started really going here a few weeks ago for the Wednesday night party that goes on here. Wed night is usually really crackin, but its been getting more and more crowded by the week, almost a little bit too full for fun. 
As far as the bar goes in general its not too shabby, but nothing special at the same time. Typical 16th and Valencia bar...but thankfully the hispters/bike punks choose to stick to themselves at Delirium so they wont annoy you here often.  Drink averagely priced, but when it gets busy do expect a long wait for a drink as there are never more than 2 bartenders that Ive seen here.
author: Vilen G.

description:
It's a pretty cool hip hop bar I go when there's nothing else to do in the Mission. It's pretty standard as far as these bars go. Kinda small, dance floor in the back. The drinks are cheap, and I like it! The crowd is urban and generally the polar opposite of the Marina crowd.

Note: They play Juicy by Notorious B.I.G. every single time.

I also recommend Double Dutch on the next block. It's a little more hip.
author: Diana N.

description:
It is an kind of a interesting place. Small with a decent amount of people on a Monday night. The drinks are ok and the place is a bit dirty. What I remember the most of the place is the napkins with trivial.  That was pretty cool. My group ended up going through the napkins trying to answer all of the trivial

I would go to this if I an bar hopping. Pobably not a place you want to stay for too long.
author: Jimmy H.

description:
not too into bar-hopping but i LOVE skylark. great mix of ppl, lively and entertaining. Fun to sit and people watch or great for dancing. the music is a cool mix that is appealing to all age groups. 

suggestion to all the folks who feel SKYLARK is too "ghetto" & "dangerous"...TAKE YOUR ASSES TO A BAR IN THE MARINA!!! :-P
author: Monica T.

description: No matter what anyone ever says about Skylark, this is the spot!! I've been coming here for almost 2-3 years now & I love it every time.  When I first found out about it me & my girls came almost everrryday! Reggae night (soo chill), Mixtape Wednesdays (better now), Thursdays (so much better before than now), and Fri/Sat's are always the best, but it gets too crowded sometimes.  The bartender's are the sweetest!! Erwin (my fave) he's always smiling, ready to go, and makes the drinks perfect! The music is mostly Hip-Hop and R&B, which is what I like so don't come here if you're looking for some rock or other music you wouldn't like this place or the crowd.  But aside from the music the atmosphere is great, spacious, dance floor gets crowded at times but it's always fun.  This is my go to place if all else fails I know Skylark won't let me down & til this day it hasn't =) my first true bar love Skylark, so many memories & more to come!
author: Christina O.

description:
We waited 20 min in line to get into a barely packed bar and once we scanned the room and noticed the scene, we quickly downed our drinks and left. What a waste.

The music was good (they were playing a lot of old school hip hop) but nobody really seemed into it. Maybe we should've came a little bit later, but it seemed pretty dead to me.

FYI, check in on foursquare for 2 for 1 specials on drinks!
author: Stefi C.

description:
Pretty chill bar. The DJ was good. We stumbled into this place on a drunken Friday night and had a blast, but i think I blame that on the alchohol.

go here with a good crowd and youll have a good time.

ive been here sober, not so much fun. the DJ wasnt too good that night.
author: Susana M.

description:
I love everything about this place. The set up is basically everything I could ask for. I think I have ended up at this place almost every night that I've been out in the city in the past year. The inside is super cool and the art work and crap on the walls is awesome. 

The first time I came to this place, my date told me to order a drink which he planned on paying for it only to realize that he didn't actually have any cash. He was gone for so long that the bartender felt bad and gave me a shot on the house and then let my friend and I have the original drinks that we ordered. That says a  lot about the staff, they want you to have a good time, you want you to have a good time. Fun is had by all. Not to mention the people that frequent this place are often pretty foxy. 

The dance floor is perfect, good music, not too crowded. 

And its walking distance to La Cumbre. 

Bottom line: you can always count on Skylark to show you a good time.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I always wonder what this place is doing in the mission.  It's a little ghetto, but sometimes you need excitement in your life.

I like Skylark because:
- The play good music (Hello E-40!)...best in the mission if you ask me.  
- I can get my dance on with my girls
- It's pretty ghetto

I don't like Skylark because:
- The bathrooms are gross 
- I don't like having the bathroom door kicked down while I'm in it.  Then again I probably shouldn't have been in the boys bathroom.  I was just trying to pee and the girls line was way too long.
- Men attack you like a piece of meat and you do feel like a piece of meat, but not a good cut
- You can't dance with your girlfriends without feeling a penis on your thigh...wow dude, you're short
- Men are cheap
- It gets REALLY crowded
- It's pretty ghetto

Regardless if I make a fool of myself at Double Dutch I definitely roll on over here.
author: Justine D.

description: Michelle, the bartender and "manager" asked me if I wanted to "get punched in the face" when I asked her if I could request a song from the DJ. Great customer service! Michelle is a real C U Next Tuesday.
author: Alicia K.

description:
Came here back in the day...liked the atmosphere.  Of course we came from a smaller, even more cramped bar before this one.  Dance floor is small, although you don't really care when you're drunk off your ass and someone is leading you.  Nice and dark, so anyone that is aesthetically challenged, this is the place for you.  It's crowded...and when the club gets out, everyone hangs out on the sidewalk.  

Good times in SF.
author: Nathalie C.

description:
Dark lighting sets the mood right, it goes along with the raw and dirtiness of Skylark.  Add some Golden Age Hip Hop, a bit of Reggae and alcohol calls for a great night, even better for my wallet!

Slim place, plenty of seating, trivia napkins!

Feel free to tag up the restroom... lol
author: Abraham E.

description:
PROS: 
1. The drinks weren't terribly priced. 
2. Eclectic selection of music.

CONS: 
1. Drink selection. 
2. The music was lacking. Better off bringing your own iPod and plugging it in.
3. Would never pay a cover charge for this bar.
author: Pamela V.

description:
One bling-bling star for proving that San Francisco has the friendliest crackheads on earth.

I'll just quickly sum up the review part that I hate this place. The music isn't what it used to be, the crowd is no longer as friendly as it used to be, and it takes at least 15 minutes to get a damn drink in here.  Oh, and 15 minutes to take a leak when there are cretins doin' the nasty or doin' rails in the bathroom.

Now, back to good part. This used to be my one and only Mission hang when I was a B&T kid from the south bay. They got good DJs, it was always easy to start conversations with the people around you, and they mixed stiff drinks and served them up quick.

On one particular Friday night of cruising into the city, we decided to roll in my buddy's brand new Lexus. We parked a block away and decided to go in for a cocktail before heading out to dinner elsewhere in the city.  

Upon returning to the car, we noticed a group of haggard-looking gentlemen (and one lady) huddled up against the car, lighting up a glass pipe.

My friend hit his alarm-deactiviation button thingy and the car made its chirp. Immediately, the group of crack cocaine afficionados backed away from the car and moved further into the sidewalk. As we entered the car, one of them explained very politely, "Excuse me, sir. I did not realize this was your vehicle. Allow me and my associates to back away - we didn't mean any trouble."

So, yeah, if it wasn't for the lure of Skylark, I wouldn't have learned that San Francisco is home to the most polite and articulate crackheads that have ever graced this earth.
author: Omid T.

description:
I've been to Skylark Wednesday nights several times but I must say with the less-packed venue, no cover, and plenty of room to sit, Monday nights are underrated.

Last night was the first time I could clearly see the dance floor. They had a california flag hung up and despite the lovely reggae music, all that was going through my mind was, "a california bear, all up in your ear while I'm playing with your hair, b*tch I'm a player."

Skylark Wednesdays have the Juan-on-Juan's though (shot of Patron and a Corona!). those are cool.
author: Sheila D.

description:
I spent most of my night in the bathroom or standing outside smoking Newport's with my friend who'd just gotten her weave did and a chickie with a name tattoo peaking out of her full-cleavaging BeBe shirt. I don't know how my life could get any better than that. Then 'Back That Ass Up' came on. 

Thought I'd provide the soundtrack from last night:
"Ain't nothing but a hoochie mama, ain't nothing but a hoochie mama..."

In this case, these mamas wore brown lipliner with mauve lipstick, trannie style, and ordered Long Islands. The gold-grilled dudes wanted to just eat em up. Making me hella jealous, biatch.

The bar is surprisingly clean, barkeep pleasant and aims to get people wrecked. Strange decor, weird space for the dancefloor. Top 40 hip-hop. Wait, where do you want to go again? Good luck with that.
author: Ligaya T.

description:
Don't F@#&kin TOUCH me!!!

yes you! 
Why does every place that plays decent hip-hop in the city have the guys that go behind you and start touching you?  I don't care how hot you may think you are but unless I get a handshake first.... Don't F@#kin TOUCh me!! 

I mean can't a girl just go out with friends to dance? 


Overall okay club/bar. But if you're a woman don't go without 4-5 other girlfriends. If you have male friends along with you that number can be lower.
author: Stacy F.

description:
This is place is whatevs.  Milf bartending, but she's cool.

Ghetto dudes on the floor, which leads to the highlarious moment of the night; when some white dude went to said milf bartender and asked her to handle the rude dudes in the back.  Her reaction was "uhh hit up the guys in the front"

The worst part of this spot was the bathroom.  I know bathrooms at joints like these are not suppose to be good, but this spot was one of the worse that I've ever been to, hands down!

Probably more of a chill spot during happy hour?
author: Mark L.

description: I love Skylark. I have been coming here for the last year and a half. The bouncers are always cool as well as the bartenders. Tip your bartender well and you will get rewarded with strong drinks. Sometimes the lines can be ridiculously long and take forever to go in. Great bar if you want to go hang out with some friends and get WASTED!
author: Gilbert L.

description:
Haters be damned!  This is the best place to go dancing if you want to get low.  Want to hook up?  Looking for the "beautiful people"?  Find someplace else.  
PM me if you want to go dancing on a Sunday night!
author: Kati K.

description: Bumpin' on a Thursday night. Really. Had a chick behind the turntables, a dance floor filled with people, and the drinks coming off the tap. I wouldn't necessarily say that I liked it her, it's a bit dingy, and on a social spectrum, the crowd is decidedly less up-scale, teetering towards thuggish, but whatever. It's a good time. The ridiculous light bulb lighted singage out front is a bit over-the-top, but ensures that your friends won't miss it when you're giving directions.
author: Tony L.

description:
Hmmmmm... I only started going to Skylark for drinks when a friend dragged me to the Wednesday night event... little did I know I knew the people throwing the Wed. party and everyone and their mama from Daly City to SF to Oakland was there... So this review is for Skylark Wednesdays!

Good crowd, very diverse in ethnicity and age group... Great music old school hip hop to new school... and most importanly they play a lot of Musiq Soulchild --- Like AIJUSWANNASING Musiq Soulchild --- and it works like a charm because once everyone here's the beginning of Just Friends  "du du du du du dump, dump, dump, duuuump" everyone, I mean EVERYONE grabs a girl or a guy and ends up on the dance floor... NO STRESS, NO DRAMA, GREAT BARTENDERS, STRAIGHT UP GOOD WEDNESDAY NIGHT FUN!
author: Chrysantha C.

description:
Great place for those that just turned 21 and want to get into the Mission bar scene. Crowd mainly consists of youngins trying to get their mack on as distorted rap music plays in the background (kinda like a low-budget music video).  So if you're looking for a meat market in the Mission, this is the spot! 

Why give an extra star? Cannot blame the bartenders (service was pretty quick). Plus, I can have a drink here while waiting for my order at Arinell's around the corner.
author: Zell C.

description:
I hate the fucking Skylark. The Skylark is for tools, underagers sans fake IDs, and people who like bad hip-hop and equally pathetic DJs. 

The Skylark used to be my regular bar, and it seems like it was cooler back then. Maybe that was just because I had only been to one or two other bars in the city before. I will give the Skylark three plus points though: the bartenders are awesome and good at what they do, the DJs on reggae night are good, and they play cool movies above the bar. But even on reggae night its not really worth going because the patrons are all stupid. Thank god it isn't contagious or it might seep out into the street and infect unsuspecting passerby with an undying desire to dry hump to bad music and wear 50 Cent's clothing line. 

Perhaps the worst part of the Skylark are the guys that run the door. On Halloween I left my debit card behind the bar and the bouncer refused to let me back in to get it with no apparent reasoning behind his logic. The other night he refused to let me in because, and I swear to god this is true, I was drunk. 

What kind of a dipshit doesn't let a drunk girl into a bar?! BARS ARE FUCKING DRUNKERYS!!!!!!!! You should ESPECIALLY let the drunk people in. 

Furthermore, on certain nights they charge cover fees to come in and see their worthless DJs. They expect people to pay money to get into the Skylark? What, do they think they are a good bar or something? New Year's was one such occasion and my friend and I straight laughed in the doorman's face. The sad part though is that many people actually do pay the cover fee..... guys you're only encouraging them. Seriously. 

So my advice about the Skylark is that if you're going to go there, make it early enough that the place has virtually no customers, the door guy hasn't arrived yet, and the DJ hasn't started. If you wait too late and go anyways at least be prepared to have a good laugh at the Slim Shady and Lady Soveirgn look alikes.
author: Slasha S.

description:
Skylark is located in the heart of the Mission district. The crowd last Friday night was very very mixed, and the music was um, different. The DJ that was scheduled to spin (hip-hop) that night had car trouble and never showed. SOoo we were kinda stuck listening to Latin music- from the 1950's with a little Reggae sprinkled in just to keep us guessing.

The two tables near the front window are the only ones large enough to fit large groups. A half an hour in, we found ourselves playing trivia with the questions printed on napkins from the bar. Quirky huh? And pretty dorky, fine.

This place has potential. It actually got pretty crowded around midnight, despite the music. Fun place to people watch, plus drinks are pretty cheap.
author: Elaine T.

description: This place is really chill, the drinks are strong, the music is good, the staff is fast, and this place entertains a pretty diverse crowd.  I have enjoyed myself everytime I have visited, but I will admit I was a little unsure since its right on 16th street.  I try to stay away from that area no matter what time of day since there can be an abundance of unsavory people.   I know it sounds a little insensitive but its female self preservation, more for safety reasons than anything else. If you do go dark and stormy is pretty amazing, and their drink specials are pretty good.... shot of patron and corona anyone?!
author: Loretta M.

description:
I got more action walking the length of the bar than I've gotten in two weeks at home, which was entirely more distressing than erotic. Maybe I'm out of practice at ghetto bars. I tried to recall all of my old defenses: "I have a boyfriend, a UFC fighter, actually." "I am lesbian" (that one always backfired, now that I think of it), "I have 6 kids who need a good man in their lives." But just like new computer viruses, the guys anticipated all of these lines and had upped their game--before I could stammer anything: "I know you have a boyfriend, baby, but just dance this one song with me."

I notice that a lot of my reviews complain, "When it first opened,..." or "Back when this place was cool,..."  so maybe I'm the one getting boring or snotty, but I'm pretty sure Skylark didn't used to smell like a floor of a fraternity house after a long weekend (and don't say, "how would you know?" not cool). 

The music was good (for top 40 hip hop and for the bachelorette party we were on), but I wouldn't seek the place out on a weekend any time soon. Good bartenders, as others have noted, but certainly not worth being cavity checked by the guy behind you while you're waiting for drinks.
author: Gretchen T.

description:
Can you give a bar a good review based on comedic value alone?

When my friend Paul suggested we head over here to get away from the smooshy nature of Casanovas, I said sure, I'm always down to check out a new bar.

I walk in, and for a brief moment had to do a reality check and make sure i was still in the mission.  Where are all the hipsters?  Where did all these ghetto-fabulous bootie shakers come from?  I didn't realize that people in the mission were inclined to "Back dat ass up".  

We found seats, we ordered cheap-ish drinks, and had we felt like it...could have gotten our groove on in the back.  Maybe gotten crunk or something?  I do know that when one of the guys in my group went to use the bathroom in the back, he got regaled with calls of "Heeey white boy", as they did in fact, back  their ass up.

Entertaining yes....if i am desperate for somewhere to sit at a bar...i would probably be back, I just don't know if it will be a destination spot.  I don't know if i'm able to get THAT hyphy.
author: Lauren F.

description:
Eh???  what???  I'm nodding yes, but I can't hear a single word you're saying.  (you get the picture)  What saved these lucky stars was the songs the DJ was playing:  from Jane's Addiction to Roxanne Roxanne to B.B.D.'s Poison.  I was diggin' the songs, just wish he toned it down a bit.  
Happy hour was okay, the $2 beer was PBR (which you could probably get anywhere else, which elsewhere we went after 4 rounds).  $2 well drinks (I don't see the point)
I'm not shutting it off, but it won't be the first place to go for happy hour in the Mish.
author: Gemma P.

description:
This place is not really my scene, which is unfortunate because there's no cover charge, they serve up affordable drinks and they play decent music that'll get your rump shakin'.

The layout of Skylark (long and narrow) guarantees that you're going to bump into/step on/generally annoy as many people as possible as you make your way to the dance floor in the back. Based on the reviews of people getting groped, maybe this is by design...

As a note, it took so long for someone to take me and my friend's second (and final) drink order that we could've bought our own beer making kit and ingredients, figure out how the hell to use it and brew our own beer before getting served! Granted, this was on a Sunday during Labor Day weekend and it was really crowded, but still...
author: Art D.

description:
It was once a destination when it first opened but now ... just another bar with a DJ...

I think that killed SKYLARK....It was cute when it was just a bar with music and you went for a beer that turned into 5 pints and a burrito from La Cumbre.
author: Teddy d.

description: Skylark is awesome. I stopped by for a couple drinks with friends and I totally left with my phone! The Asian bartender is super nice and makes the best drinks.
author: B M.

description:
This place is pretty scary.

I only came here once last year, and it was with some out-of-town friends who were basically petitioning for a place to dance over all else. Every bar around 16th street was packed, so it was Skylark or bust. Oddly enough, I managed to enjoy myself on the dance floor for all of maybe five songs, despite the rampant marijuana fumes that were infiltrating the place...but once some dudes starting coming in with the hard sell, I had to say check ya later. 

Two stars for being an actual meant-for-dancing venue in the mission. Never again, though.
author: Shannon R.

description:
Thank you ghetto ass guys in the back of Skylark who crowd around the dance floor, you have taught me much about picking up the ladies. Like the fine art of grabbing a woman's hand as she walks out of the dance floor dehydrated to get a drink of water. Pulling her into your web of sweaty, ball stank game. Singing her a sweet serenade of "baby"'s and "wassup"s.

 I have much to learn. Or maybe this bar is too east bay for me.
author: F B.

description:
Look, I know I'm not the target audience for this bar (target audience? Jesus Christ on a stick I need to get out of marketing) but this place is like if two frat boys had a child then blasted bad hip-hop and served watered-down drinks from within that child.

Okay, that similie may have derailed a little bit, but still! This place sucks like whoa.

Perfect if you like date rape, blasting your lats, audtioning for MTV's The Real World, or the part in Bambi when Bambi's mom got shot.
author: Jake S.

description:
Still one of the great spots in SF.

My old review still stands, now more than ever.

Skylark isn't for the yuppies...peace!
author: Samurai J.

description:
One word to describe this place: G-H-E-T-T-O

I'm not a high class person by any means, but this place is full of ghetto-ass people.  Example: my friend and I were on the dance floor minding our own business when this chick who was trying to get by bumped into my friend.  My friend didn't really care, but this chick had to nerve to tell her to watch where she was going and starts trying to pick a fight with her!  I told her to calm down and they she starts yelling at me about how she's gonna kick my ass!  I just started laughing at her, turned around, and continued dancing.

However, I will say that the bartenders were friendly and made good drinks.  But I would stay away from Skylark unless you're in the mood for a fight!
author: Jolene W.

description:
Skylark is a total knockoff of the Holy Cow scene!  There should be only one "Holy Cow" bar in San Francisco, if you think you'd like another - Skylark is the place for you.

Don't waste an evening, by visiting the Skylark.
author: Anthony B.

description:
This place is pretty cool.  We went tonight (a Tuesday) and the DJ was ok.  There was only one bartender so service was a bit slow during a few points in the night.  Overall it was pretty good.

The setting is dark and red.  The DJ is setup in the back of the bar, and the seats near the DJ are really loud.  The seats near the bar are much better for hanging out with friends and talking.  Regardless, it was loud in there.

Drinks were good.  I drank beer, but one of the ladies in our group had a couple Ruby Skylarks that she really enjoyed.  I tasted one and it had a strong grapefruit flavor.  Not bad.

We will go back.
author: Ryan W.

description:
The scene: Sticky floors, dimly lit, sparse dance floor.

The crowd: Guys in the uniform (blazers one size too big, jeans two sizes too big and shirts three sizes too big) and girls upping their hoochy ante with attires that have an inverse relationship to he frigid outside temperature.

The music: Bad hip-hop. Bringing back Montel's Return Of The Mack was a nice trip down early 90's memory lane, but the rest sucked.

The vibe: Angry. One guy was already too drunk (it's 10pm people), and you could tell every sip of booze combined with every note of hip-hop was getting this overly testosteroned crowd ready to thrown down.

We left after 15min, which was 14 too many.
author: Jason B.

description:
Okay, the first two or three time I came to Skylark it was up and poppin, the music was cool, the crowd was nice, and the drinks were on par.

Now I come here and see how it has pretty much gone downhill.  The place can be disrupted by Sureno's (blue rag gangsters if you don't know who they are) either inside or hanging outside.  The crowd is still pretty much the same as are the drinks, but the DJ's just don't seem as good anymore.

In fact, the last time I went there, the DJ had a horrible time blending the tracks together and it just made the music annoying.

I eventually left early and walked over to Blondies (stay tuned for another review shortly on the above mentioned business)

Sorry, the Skylark is a mere shell of what it used to be...
author: Mike V.

description:
It's hard for me to be too critical of this spot.  I mean, expectations should never be too high if someone calls out "Skylark".  On one hand you've got no cover, no dress code, a decent amount of seating, and a good chance of listening to a DJ spinning some above average hip-hop.  

On the other hand, those aforementioned things tend to attract a "diverse" crowd and it starts getting pretty grimy around 12.  I know that sounds kinda bitch-ass.  I just wish hip-hop and grimy wouldn't go hand-in-hand.  I mean, you would think that hip-hop would be a little more grown & sexy by now, you know?  Read the reviews, women love dancing to hip-hop.  Can't we get a Jay-Z "Excuse Me Miss" video-type spot in the city? Sorry, I digress...

Anyway, my suggestion: Go early and bounce early.
author: Tommy O.

description:
The Mission is so comical to me at times. Everybody wants to like it, because we live in a pretty snobby and trendy city that dictates if you don't like the Mission, then you're sorta an outcast. Well, the Mission has its draws, and certainly its drawbacks.

Skylark, though, is cool. Totally cool. I will say this, however... last time I was here, a massive fight broke out, and bouncers were flying EVERYWHERE to calm everyone down. No worries, our drinks were safe. But no matter - here's a chill spot, in the Mission, often with a good DJ, that knows how to make a drink. And it's PERFECT for a party of 3, 4 or 5.

I'll be back here, soon, but it was still super weird to have to shield not only myself but those I was with from the huge fight last time. Oh well, it makes for a fun story...
author: Drew S.

description: DJ all night keeps the dancing vibe constant. Get ready to sweat.
author: Eric N.

description:
This place scares the living hell out of me. Is thier liqour license under review yet? They let girls in there that don't look older than the 13 yr old I nanny for. What What?? I am afraid just looking into that place. I have been there to dance once. I couldn't even get a drink it was so packed. And then proceeded to get molested by three randoms on the dance floor.  Nice. 
This place is like the definition of meat market! Gross.
It gets one star b/c it allows me lots of cannon fodder to make fun as I walk to the bar that grownups hang out in.
author: shannon t.

description:
The bar tenders are unfriendly and innattentive, drinks were sloppy, the people who made this bar a stop in the mission have moved on.
This place has gone down hill.
author: Chris T.

description:
my very first time was on a thursday
I remember I didn't eat a lot that day
the DJ announced that they were 
serving Hukilau at the end of the bar.
I was confused but I couldn't resist
running over there to check it out.  
God damn, they had a tray of chicken
katsu and spam masubi for everyone
in the venue.  I was the only one eating
it for a while - I guess the others didn't
hear the announcement - thank god. 
I was scarfing down the chicken but 
mostly the spam masubi - double fisted.

I also go here on wednesdays.  they 
play really good music.  RnB, soul, hip
hop.  But the problem is the venue itself
it's not made for a lot of people.  It can
get really really crowded.  The dance floor
is equivalent to the Paint area in a BBall
court.  Not sure what that is?  Watch the
NBA Playoffs on ESPN or ABC.   The painted
area is just like the dance floor - no bull *censored*
What I like is the dirty dog cart just right outside.
olaay!
author: Jonathan P.

description: I would say this place is alright. There are plenty of better bars/clubs in the mission. I somehow have ended up here a few times now. I don't think I will be back but who knows.
author: Anthony C.

description: Dropped in around 7pm on a Friday night with a friend just looking for a chill spot to have a reasonably priced drink in the Mission. Skylark fit the bill - not too crowded, strong drinks, happy hour goes until 9. Bartender was nice. Even got to catch some of the Giants game on one of the two TVs. Will definitely come back!
author: Sean C.

description: Door guy refused my very legal ID on a Monday night. Not sure who's hiring or training these guys but what a drag
author: Margaret S.

description:
2.5 Stars (cuz its free and has good music)

I've been on a Friday night.

Crowd is mixed for guys, but girls are mostly asian or white.

The Good:
1) Its Free.
2) Music (hip-hop) is pretty good.
3) No dress code.
4) Kung-Fu or B-boy videos on the wall above the bar

The Bad:
1) Dance floor is small
2) Can get real crowded
3) Way more guys than girls
4) Its a place that "off and on" so have a back up plan 

Go there if you want a "no frills" place that is free, has good music and no dress code.
author: One Black Mans POV.. ..

description: Since my last review I've been coming here pretty often. It's my go to place when I wanna hear some hip hop and get a good drink. I ordered a double bourbon on the rocks the last time. Lets just say my night ended in an argument with my gf and me blacking out. I think that was like a quadruple they poured me. lol They always have this shot of patron and corona deal you can't beat and the DJ's are pretty dope. Gets pretty busy on a Weds night but have loved coming here for years now.
author: Hyung L.

description:
We got here on the earlier side so we avoided the crowd at the entrance. We were able to find a booth that seated all 7 of us, which we hogged all night since our purpose that evening was to chill and chat.  As the night grew on the place got more packed, the music came on, seats filled up, and some dancing was going on.  

Overall, good place to take it easy for the night.  Loved the pear cider they served!
author: Lisa C.

description:
Oooh.. music good. 

Too many people, bad. VERY BAD. 

First.. it's hard to even walk in the door. Second... no one can hear you ask them to move. 

They're just people clogging up the trafficking aisles. Crazy.. couldn't move. I was suffocating. I'm being over dramatic but that's how I lived it. 

Yeah, horrible experience. I was with awesome people... but dude, it really sucks when you have to basically strip to get the bartender to notice you. I didn't do that, but I assume that would catch someone's attention. 

People are shoving everywhere.. it's HOT...it's just bodies, so many bodies, it's gross.
author: Eugenia Y.

description:
This place is dope. Drinks are made right and aren't to expensive. Definitely not your typical upscale club vibe, which to me is dope. If you're into dress up, Ruby Skye type of shit than this definitely isn't the place for you (but fuck paying 30 bucks to get into the club anyways right?)

Haven't been out for a Wednesday yet, but the reggae nights on Mondays are dope. Best part is they're 420 friendly!! 

Had to take a star away because they take awhile with the drinks because they're understaffed.
author: Tommy P.

description:
I've been to this place once and I will never ever go back. It is a shame, since there is no cover and I don't mind a little hip-hop to get my groove on. But, snap, this place is skeeze heaven.

The layout is narrow. I didn't realize I was claustrophobic until I tried to exit the place. The bar was crowded with the Bridge & Tunnel trying to get cheap cocktails and the back "dance floor" was crowded with people doing some bump 'n' grind. Dudes stare at girls in that way where you know that they are not thinking, "I wonder if she has a great personality." I would liken it to meat market where all the meat has gone bad but that's more like the Holy Cow. Here, it's just ghetto.
author: Jackie I.

description:
Skylark has never disappointed me.  When it looks empty inside, I just go somewhere else.  I dOn't grab a drink when it looks dead and then complain about how it's dead inside.  See?  I use my nOOdle.

The 3 times I've been there (a Thursday, Friday and Sunday), the atmosphere was more chill than the other usually crazed neighboring bars and they were spinning some good beats, some hip hop, which you rarely hear in bars in the Mission or, you know, in San Francisco.  I love me some hip hop.  Truly.  

I took my Dad here a few months ago when he was here on a business trip.  He is youthful and spritely and a generally cool dude.  He was drinking a rum and coke with my sister, a co-worker and myself and bobbin his 60 year old head to the music.  He likes hip hop, too.  Then he says to me in Chinese, "Daughter, I like this place.  It has a good feeling.  Don't tell your mother I was at a pub."  For that cherished memory, Skylark gets 5 stars.
author: Diana Y.

description:
This review is strictly for Mondays here at the Skylark - for their Dancehall/Reggae party.

If you are a white hippie who enjoys clouds of herb mixed with nag champa that will impair your breathing and your judgment - then go. There's plenty of space around the dj booth and the back for you to wabble back and forth in an interpretive way.

If you are a white person who likes to pretend you're black, then go.  This is the music of ja people.

If you are a sceney, ironic hipster looking for a place to scour and point and laugh at white people who think they're black or people who think they can dance but can't really, then go. there's a line of tables facing the bar and the dj booth- perfect for you to do your deed.

Seriously though, this was a fun night. The drinks were slightly over-priced, but the overall tone of the evening was relaxed and fun, which is a nice break from the normal uppity vibe in there.  check it out :)
author: Amber K.

description:
I can see why some folks would trip initially over Skylark's unglamorous feel. There aren't any fancy signs, the decor is minimum, and the dress is casual at best. 

Folks here are chill though...and the jams make you wanna dance. Stuff like De La Soul and A Tribe Called Quest mixed with current songs entices you to feel the vibe and eventually gravitate towards the back to shake your money maker. 

I had good company that evening in addition to the NO COVER. Good tunes and meeting laid-back people makes it a fun evening!
author: Chuck N.

description: Like so many other reviews, my friend also had her phone stolen out of her purse! Too bad this is such a problem here because the music and atmosphere were fun, and the bartenders were really friendly. Management needs to get a grip on the security of this place, it is ridiculous that there has been so much theft there!
author: Annah D.

description:
I've only been on Wednesdays when they spin hip hop, R&B, soul, funk, & old school.  Any combination of those and I'm in (espeically if Herb Diggs is around).  
I love that everybody's dancing all the way up to the front door & nobody cares.
author: Jen T.

description:
I cannot even count how many drug deals I watched happen right outside this door, and not pot deals.

I can get a drink anywhere (I'm 21!)  I don't need to see meth and crack deals happening while enjoying my vodka drink.
author: Tom Y.

description:
Don't go drinking in the Mission. It is the weakest, lamest thing that you can do.

I have not set foot in Skylark since they first opened about ten years ago, but I can smell the date-rape smell that comes out of that place from blocks away. On weekends, from the vantage of the window of the (excellent) Panchitas restaurant I have observed the following:

11:00 PM: 19 and 20 year old girls with open-backed tops spill out of Skylark onto the sidewalk, smoking Marlboro lights. They are already staggering, babbling drunk.

12:00 AM: Thuggy dudes who are too young to go into the club start massing out on the sidewalk. At this point, the sidewalk is so crowded that it is no longer useable as a sidewalk, it might as well be part of the club. In order to safely pass, you must walk out into the street.

12:30 AM: The first of the fist-fights and projectile-vomitings begin.

1:00 AM: The general area of the club can no longer contain the clubbers. They spill out in all directions and become a liability for other businesses on the block, like Panchitas and the corner liquor store. Things go downhill from here.

I'm all about a good freak-show, but this is just a dumbass-show.

Please don't drink in the Mission. Stay in your own neighborhood and find a bar there. Please?
author: David M.

description:
This is a fun place to go hang out to after dinner in the Mission, but before going out to whatever bar / party you're *really* going to that night.  No cover, no dress-code, no crowds, good seating.  My favorite is that the napkins have trivia on them.  Fun!

As a warning, it *is* sketchy and I will only go now if there's a large group of us and the guys outnumber the girls.
author: kiki d.

description:
There are some places, like R Bar, where I really don't mind being crammed into a small room like a sardine with a bunch of strangers.  The generally fun vibe tends to make up for any level of annoyance I might have at the crowd level. 

Then there are places like Skylark.  I'm not sure what the actual capacity is, but on most nights that I've been there (the last time was a few years ago), I'm pretty sure there were some major fire code violations going on.  There's a tiny dance floor in the back where house retreads are in constant rotation (shades of Hi-Fi in the Marina).  The crowd seems to be made up of people who showed up at 16th at Valencia on a Saturday night not knowing much about the Mission, looked down the street and saw a bar with a cool sign, and decided to check it out.  This isn't the worst place in the world to hang out, but if you happen to be in this part of the Mission,  you could do better by trying Casanova, Dalva, Delirium or even Pink... all within a block of Skylark.
author: Andrew E.

description:
Pro: Cool front booths that allow you to chat
Cons: Horrible mixed drinks. Come on bartenders when you order a 7 & 7 the drink should not be clear (brown liquor + clear soda=brown drink). The music was a toss up of top 40 and random R&B. The crowd got progressively worse as the night went on and it is impossible to use the bathroom. 
All in all not a place I would go again.
author: Courtney R.

description: This place depends on the crowd I am sure because it was so ghetto. My girls and I walked in, turned around and walked out. It was really horrible and totally crappy. This was Halloween weekend, WHAT?!
author: Natasha M.

description:
THE place to be on Wednesday nights after 12am. It has the best DJs in the mission spinning lots of old school classics along with Bay Area beats, without mashups (The DJs here are really creative in their song selection and the ways that they mix their songs. They don't just cut from song to song which is what I'm finding a lot of lounge DJs do these days). Drink specials including $3 Heinnies. And the crowd on Mixtape Wednesdays is also very local which I dig. Added bonus: when the place closes up shop at 2am, the ghetto hot dog cart selling bacon wrapped hot dogs with jalepenos is waiting for you outside!

During the weekends, this place is still pretty cracking, but the crowd and the atmosphere are the best on Wednesdays!
author: Rod M.

description:
Where do I start with this place?  I suppose I'll start with the obvious: it sucks. Majorly.  In my unattainable quest to try every bar in the Mission, I stopped in here with a friend on the way home from a little houseparty.

What should have tipped us off was that the bouncer, upon checking our ID's, said "Why are you here?  If I didn't work here I would never come here."  But I have a tendency to ignore red flags so we proceded.

The bartender took about 5 million hours to get to us (and it wasn't like it was busy) only to act like she was annoyed with us (which I always love), pour us the weakest drinks EVER (awesome) and promptly walk away after taking our 5-spot for the well drinks.

It was a very ethnically-diverse, East Bay-ish type crowd (and I'm from Fremont so I can hang, but really?) grinding to their fav hyphy jams.  Stole a little booth that was not cleaned (on par with the entire disgusting place, in need of a busser like WHATTT).

I could see how some people could dig the crowd/music, which is why I gave it 2 stars.  But this place belongs downtown or in the Tenderloin, not among the likes of the sweet haunts of the Mission.
author: Amanda K.

description: Good crowd in here. It is like a fusion of the Marina and the Mission....
author: Jim B.

description: This bar doesn't have a very strict dress code (all I've seen them been strict on are hats with logos on it).  There isn't any dress code and they play pretty good hip hop/mainstream music.  There is one long bar that usually only has 2 bartenders, but regardless you don't have to wait too long for a drink.  The neighborhood is a bit ghetto and sometimes the people inside are as well.  There is a dance floor all the way in the back, meaning it can get a bit sweaty back there =\.  But if I ever want to go out somewhere to dance and don't want the hassle of lines, dress code, or cover -- then this is where I go.
author: Pia V.

description:
This place isn't bad... loved the music they played (which was old skool mixed with the new that night... Wednesday, I think) .. although the fact that I could practically turn my head and saw almost everyone I knew from my childhood disturbed me. I guess this is where everyone's been hiding out? 

I didn't have much to drink because I was fresh off of a "let's barhop across the city" trip, but the only drink that I did manage to have was a rum and coke that cost me a pretty penny and was mostly coke. That's just not cool. 

It gets four stars for the atmosphere and music... three for watering down my drink. Suckage.
author: Caroline L.

description: If you come here then you've probably reached a new low in life. I mean, the music is always on point - this review is not about the music, mainly about one's overall experience there. I come here with no expectations of finding a new bird, it's just not going to happen. If you're cool with a sausage fest of grimy ass dudes then this is where you need to be. Sleaze balls galore -_- the women who come here are equally as trashy/tacky. There was once a legit crackhead in there tearing up the dance floor. How the fuck did a crackhead get in?? Do they even have an i.d? Money?? So this place is straight gutter and they have the audacity to have a dress code and charge at the door?! I CAN'T! It's like, excuse me? Do you see me? I'm too pretty to even be here, let alone pay for shit. I am only here to sweat my bangs out and tilt my head back when my favorite song comes on. If you looooooove reggae/dancehall (like I do) come to Mixtape (every Wednesday) and you will be too busy having the time of your life to notice the garbage crowd. Drinks are okay and decently priced. Bathrooms are gross for the most part and there is always a line. Dance floor is kind of small and it gets packed once everyone arrives (usually at midnight). There is a giant  fan by the DJ booth that is fun to dance in front of ^_^ it's like you're in a music video. Also, don't come here with any valuables. It will get stolen. It's happened to me and my friends pretty much every time we go. Even more of a reason to never show my pretty face there but some days I just can't resist. No other place in the city spins reggae and dancehall like they do here.
author: Lydia L.

description:
What can I say? When I think of Skylark, I think of all the nights I got drunk and got to dance my ass off. I think of summertime and the cool, laidback atmosphere. Skylark is my bootycall for the night. When all else fails, I go to Skylark and he welcomes me with open arms and a drink. Geeez. We could make babies this way. HAHA.

I love the no cover charge. I like the bouncers. They're friendly and actual human beings not fake ass cops. And they really protect you when it comes down to it. Just like the time so dude cursed me out for "cockblocking" yess they comforted me when I was going on a rampage.
