The drinks are yuumy. Nothing real special. But they satisfy me. I've been here mostly hiphop nights and also reggae nights which I don't mind. The bartender is a sweetie. there's usually 2 and they're cool. 

My fave thing about this bar is the crowd. Hence, the mission district. it's diverse and my friends and I always seem to find someone cool to talk too or sit down with. 

Just do me one favor and never change =)
author: Sarina I.

description:
Came here on a Friday recently since it was the closest bar to Pancho Villa and our full bellies couldn't handle walking much further. 

Basically, I was left with no real impression. The place was practically empty even at midnight. Luckily this meant the bartender was attentive, the drinks were pretty stiff, and it wasn't too loud to carry on a conversation. But other than that, I have nothing to say - positive or negative. Which is not a good thing. I spent over 2 hours here and barely remember the fact that I was there (and no, that had nothing to do with my alcohol consumption). I didn't even remember the name of the bar, it left that little of an impression. Needless to say, I doubt I'll return. And even if I go back to Pancho Villa, I'll use the boring-ness of this bar as incentive to walk a little further and burn off the calories from my delicious burrito.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Today is Saturday, right?

I went here around 9pm with a couple of friends, and we were the only people in the bar. I thought that was kind of odd, since I'm pretty sure it's Saturday, but no matter. That meant we got a booth by the window, and didn't have to wait for our drinks. Plus, my margarita was tasty, and extra extra salty. Just the way I like it.

I kind of dug the mermaid theme, too, but I don't know what that has to do with skies or larks.
author: Vanessa R.

description: This place may not be the nicest, classiest, or cleanest place, but it holds a special place in my heart. I've come here for 8 years now and just love the fact that there is no cover or dress code.  Good hip-hop, nice lil (crowded) dance floor, and the fact I'm cool with the staff all help contribute to my fondness for this place.  It has gotten a little ghetto over the years, but I still like it.
author: Jeff M.

description:
I have a special place for Skylark when considering my favorite places in SF. It was the first place that I went dancing when I moved from San Diego, and it was so liberating to go dancing without paying a cover, without needing to wear heels and dress like a stripper (although a few have stumbled in since this first visit), but being honored with  tracks from my people like Talib Kweli, Mos Def, Biggie, Tribe, Q-Tip, Musiq! and 90s R&B like 112, Lucy Pearl, Groove Theory (whose feeling me?)

Ok, now the reality is, after a few more visits, I understand the vibe a little more. This is how it works... My kind of music (the good stuff) comes on earlier in the night (10-ish), which means you may be the first person on the dancefloor (I'm down). At around 11:45, the crazy stumblers who don't appreciate the good stuff arrive and start requesting Top 40 music (I'll admit, I can dance to some of it), and distract me from my rhythm by waving their hands and shoulders foolishly. This is then mixed in with some questionable looking "hood" characters, and while I don't like hating on people who are having a good time, there's just not enough room for me and them....  but my que to leave is when the white (and sometimes brown) people start singing along and say the N word--- it just won't ever be right.

4 stars for 10- 11:45 crowd and music, and always good bartenders.
author: Kirsti P.

description: Skylark is great bar with great music and cheap drinks but the reason I'm going to make this one of my regular bar stops is the amazing staff.  I left my bag (and laptop) there on a week night and couldn't believe the lengths they went to track me down and it get back to me.  Sweet.  I don't know any other bar that would've done that.  Thanks Skylark and I'll see you guys soon!
author: Jared K.

description:
This place is ghetto.  The crowd is mixed.  Getting a drink was impossible last night.  There were 2 bartenders and 1 barback for the whole night!  You had to stand around waving your $$ to try and catch the bartender's attention.  Drinks are pretty cheap  ($7)  However, my drinks were super weak though!

They have trivia questions on their napkins.  That was entertaining.

Dancing was almost impossible.  On top of being a tiny dance floor, people kept coming in/out...which created a lot of nudging, pushing, moving... My friends and I gave up trying to dance after 2 minutes.  

There was no cover.  Yay.
author: Jenny K.

description: Not the typical Mission hipster bar. But with the right crowd you can have a good time. Pete is a great bartender, I dunno how they stay so friendly considering most of the assholes in here don't tip very well.
author: Adrian C.

description:
After a long and frustrating day at work, I was determined to find a bar that I could sit, enjoy a drink, and do some reading.  I realized that every fucking bar in the mission around 7PM is so dark that you can't read a magazine if you had 10X magnifying eye glasses on.  As I walked home in defeat, I passed by the Skylark and peaked in, and to my surprise there was nobody there, and they had red lights everywhere!  I CAN SEE!  I asked the bartender for a PBR with a lemon (that's my drink).  He replied, "A PBR with a lemon is like trying to heal a broken leg with a band aid".  I laughed and told him not to knock my drink before having one.  I swear, it's the most refreshing thing ever.

I sat down, did some writing to some Belle and Sebastian in the background and told myself this couldn't be the same place during the night, and it's not.

I got reminiscent about the good ole days in Seattle and started to miss all of my want to be hipster friends riding their bikes on Capitol Hill.  Then I knocked some sense into myself and left.  FRIGGIN HIPSTERS! :)
author: Justin C.

description:
Rules to live by if thinking about going to the Skylark-
- go for happy hour, it's nice, kinda loungey
-go on a weekday, the weekends are kinda crowded, but that's the mission
-go for a private party, they accommodate large groups and won't have attitude about it, even if it is the weekend
-drinks are kinda cheap, they aren't $6, but they also aren't $12
-check out the early entertainment, random guys singing frank sinatra- with the right buzz, this can make your night!
-watch out for the peeps outside- way shady and keep a good grip on your purse!
author: Valarie A.

description:
I come here when I get bored at delirium.

Then I get bored here.  And wasted.  Because shady guys who follow you aroudn the city start buying and your friend drinks and cab fare.  Thank god you're brilliant enough to sober up and get kicked out of the End Up.

So you're not stupid enough to take them home.
author: Angela H.

description:
People, come on! Skylark happy hour is GREAT! Trivia napkins! Nice bartenders!
Get there early and the loud music and dancing won't be happening.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Honestly, it's pretty ghetto here, but why did I used to come here every week?  The Dj's on the Weekends are usually good, you can usually find a bit older crowd (25-30) and the truth of the matter is this place is pretty much a singles/hook up bar.  If you are a single girl or guy looking for someone to meet, you can almost guaranteed find someone here.  If you want to go party with your girlfriend/boyfriend...you may want to choose another spot.  Oh yeah...this place is absolutely dead on all the other days of the week.

The bartenders are all great here as well, quick even when it is crowded up the bum and friendly.
author: Medwin M.

description:
For better or for worse, Skylark has become the Boones (aka Triangle Lounge) of old.  On most nights the crowd is local and therefore chilled and there just to have a good time.  And on most nights, the dance floor, with its sparse lighting and overpowering strobe lights are the perfect storm for the beer goggle patrol to come out.  Plus, its male and female bathrooms are next to the dance floor, which the patrons are notorious for leaving open.  There's been occasions where I don't know if I'm still on the dance floor or in the urinal.

That's why I gave this place 4 stars!
author: Don B.

description: Dirty hip hop and cheap ass well drinks on Thursdays. Yay!
author: Kevin L.

description: Music isn't bad, but the bartenders try to rip you off! Ordered a drink from this female Filipino bartender with tattoos on both arms, charged 21 for the same drinks she charged someone 19, gave her 40 and she gave 11 back! When I tried to ask her she purposely avoided my friends and I. Don't go.
author: Louis V.

description:
I really like that this bar plays the type of music i like to listen to....mostly hip-hop, and new pop-hop.  I love to get down with my friends and this is a decent spot to do it.  It is usually pretty loud, and for the most part people are dancing in the back.
HOWEVER there are a few negatives about the spot.
1. The dancing goes down near the back where there is litterally NO air cirrculation, it's hotter than a witches titty in there.
2. At least three crack heads will try to get some money from you but this is no surprise within the area.
3.The usual crowd of rowdy boys are seriously annoying, and tend to get a little too close.
I do kinda like coming here dispite the negatives.
author: Rachel P.

description:
I used to love going to Skylark ever since I got into Skylark for only $3 on NYE '06, but now the crowd has changed and it is no longer my default club. Two years ago, there were a lot of hip-hop heads there who didn't mind being in a crowded area as long as the latest music was playing. But the last few times I've been there, I've had to deal with prissy girls in their fancy skirts and heels who just take up space on the dance floor. If you wanna just stand around and not get bumped into, go somewhere else! Oh and I swear the DJ plays the same tired CD he must've bumped in like 2001. 

PS: For those of you who have complained about the thugs who linger outside, be nice. Those are my neighbors! Seriously, one of them lives like 2 floors below me, HA!
author: Iris V.

description:
everyone who keeps calling this place ghetto--as an insult--must be unaware they CHOSE to go into a reggae DIVE BAR in the MISSION. please go back to ruby skye so there's more room for non-ignorant, relaxed people who enjoy real hip hop and smoking joints in bars.

nothin but love for u skylark and lovely patrons, until we meet again....
author: Jenna D.

description:
Best bar in the city if you're a fan of hip-hop and the mission scene.  Everytime I hit up Skylark I have a good time... but you gotta be up for it.

The weekend schedule usually goes something like this:

9-10:30p
loungin' beats, mellow scene, easy to get a drink at the bar

10:30-12:30a 
old school hits that make you wanna dance and drink more, diverse crowd, dance floor gets packed, 20 minute wait for a drink

12:30-2a
dirrty booty-shakin' beats finish out the night, crowd turns to 80% male, street thugs start rolling in, ass-grabbing commences, dance floor withers down to guys looking for some action and girls too drunk to know the difference, 10 minute wait for a drink

2a (outside on the sidewalk)
sketchy people waiting outside observing the drunken loitering on the sidewalk, homeless people asking for spare change, a hug, or a handshake... my advice: get out and go home

just ignore all the drama and you'll have a good time here.
author: Brandon C.

description:
I would give Skylark a 3 star rating, but we encountered a pretty dicey scene there-- borderline dangerous.

If you've read any of my other reviews, I'm not a fan of the Mission. It's gross to me. I tried to overrule my friends on this one, but I lost.

Anyway, we were a little "outnumbered" in this place if you know what I mean. Everyone was either civil or friendly, but we kinda stood out, if you catch my drift. I can't say I felt uncomfortable there though.

Within like 20 minutes of getting our Fat Tires, some sort of melee broke out on the dance floor, which incidentally was rocking out to a great old school tune ("Return of the Mack" by Mark Morrison). It was hard to see what sparked it, but I think some drunk guy threw a beer bottle at the DJ booth or something. Security was on it pretty quickly and escorted this nutsac as well as a couple others out the door by force.

Naturally they had to go right by us at the bar and all these hoodlums were throwing beer bottles at this MF, which then broke around our feet. At least it wasn't some sort of racial gang warfare, I think it was just an idiot sparking other idiots to misbehave.

Hilarious quote from one of the employees as he swept up the broken glass. "It's just the weekend man. This is what happens."

Nice.

After that whole thing settled down, the bar chilled out again, and they played "Juicy" and "Hypnotize". It's cool that bars realize how old their clientele are and play songs we liked as kids. 

Definitely some riff raff in this joint, but it's not all bad. Props for the trough urinal. Reminds me of Candlestick. Tough to make your way through the simulated sex on the dance floor to get there though.
author: Dan P.

description: Great dark bar with pretty good cocktails. Like just about everywhere else in town, they have pretty good Happy Hour specials. Seems like they have some good DJ's as well, though they could maybe moderate the sound a little better. Went in for happy hour, but as the evening wore on, in came the "Woooo!" Girls with a bachelorette party. Couldn't leave quick enough.
author: Jeff R.

description:
I feel bad for every one that has had a bad exerience at the Skylark or has something bad to say about this place. From my stand point, it's the best bar in the mission. Honestly!

Lets look at the positives:
-Weed is A-Okay 
-Drinks come cheap (if you tip)
-No cover charge
-No dress code

Tips for a good time:
-Come early
-Mondays and Tuesdays are always the chillest
-if you become friends with the bartenders you can even be the DJ for the night ;-)
-leave early
author: Tedi O.

description:
I appreciate skylark.
No lines, no cover, no pretenses. Just alcohol and music.
The dance floor is tiny and there is only one bathroom, but I still come back.

Logistics:
Crowd: Mainly minorities (no, I won't say "ghetto" because of this) of all colors with a few yuppies mixed in.
Music: Hip-Hop, hyphy
Drinks: Strong and $8
author: Josie A.

description: so skylark is usually not a place i would go to on my own. HOWEVER, i only come here on thursdays bc my friend works door and drinks are $3. and when Masaye aka the most gorgeous bartender ever, is pouring, i enjoy my drink just a tad more bc they're strong. plus pupusas are right next door and if i wanted to go dancing, delirium actually has funk/punk /ska music playing on thursdays. line for the girl's bathroom is always long and the bouncer always eyes me funny. sorry brah.
author: Melanie C.

description: Terrible first time experience,  me and a group of friends went to this club about 2 weeks ago. As soon as we arrived I noticed the bartenders (Michelle and Monica) downing shots of alcohol with customers while plenty customers were waiting to order a drink. Nothing out of the norm, however they should remember that they are at work and should know there limits. Long story short one of the girls in my party got cursed out by Monica (if that was her real name) because she didn't know how to make a drink that was requested and they ended up giving my debit card to another person because they were too drunk. Management definitely needs to step in, the bouncers said they had been hearing complaints all night.  Other than that the Dj played a good set and the crowd there was fun. However when your debit card is given to the wrong person on a Saturday night it ruins the rest of your weekend.  Really inconvenient and the bartenders didn't really seem like they cared, they were very nonchalant about it  saying "you can just call into cancel" ...  Thanks I know that, but now what am I gonna do about money 1 in the morning on a Sunday.
author: Derrick L.

description:
I am hungover...I vaguely remember this place but I do know I liked it!  It's red and has a comfy booth and space to dance.  The cutest bartender ever...Erwin or Edwin(???) who gave me strong Stoli soda's w/ lime.

My head is pounding and by body is aching....

help

me.

water....

water....

thud!  (sound of me falling before getting to the water cooler)
author: Jay H.

description: 3 stars for being skylark ... good music, reasonably priced strongly made drinks, I like the feel in here - chill, come as you are, and a fairly diverse group of people.  An extra star for the additional entertainment - guys tryin to fight for dumb ass reasons (relax people, they're not ghetto, they're harmless), bacon wrapped hot dogs sold out of their food carts, and the guy that always takes his shirt off tryin to show off his body so he can get a piece.  I'm sure he does with the type of girls that come through but I doubt any of them ever call him back after.
author: Emily L.

description:
This review is for WEDNESDAY NIGHTS ONLY!

Dude.
$3 Heineken
$6 Mojito

I get drunk & she gets drunk.  Yes, I went there with my girl and, no, she was not groped (by anyone else but me).  There was about a 60/40 ratio of guys to girls, nice enough, sheeeet for a Wednesday!  In my single days that was golden.  The crowd was super chill (25+) compared to what I've seen on the weekends.

Music:  Early in the night they were playing Old School.  I'm not talking NWA & Run DMC, I'm talking Frankie Beverly & Maze, Stevie Wonder, James Brown, Jackson5, etc.  Then they broke into the MosDef, Talib, The Roots, a little reggae and a bunch of 90s cool stuff I used put on mixtapes.

But seriously, the 5th star was earned by my favorite drink special.  Are you ready?  $9 for a shot of Patron & a bottle of Corona.  Isn't that disgusting?
author: Segue P.

description:
Skylark is my spot! Lol. Let me explain the reasons:
1. When my best friend and I first ventured in here after getting a burrito next door, ya it looked a little sketch but seemed like good music. So as we approach the door, anxious to see what's waiting inside, the bouncer gives us a few words of wisdom: " watch your bags ladies. You'll be fine but just be careful, don't set them down anywhere. Just wanted to let you know. Have a good night" fuckin classic. Lol
2. The music is amazing. Hip hop, r&b and oldies with some reggae and top 40 mixed in. Best music I've heard in the city hands down.
3. The ambiance. It's not that bad lol. It's not the W but it's fun. Red decor, tables and booths line the walkway, which is Perfect for people watching. 
4. Best people watching in the city. Where else can you find homeless men, men with grills and dreads rapping Mac dre, men in business suits from la, and women in spandex and booty shorts. Lol ok I'm making it sound worse than it is. But they all try to hit on u and it's hilarious. 
5. Did u see their new sign?? Lol fab. Love it

In summary, if you want to have a good time, relax, throw on whatever, and have good music and pretty good drinks, and laugh at people, you'll have a great time. 

Oo and no cover and rarely a line lol. Love it.
author: Naomi Z.

description:
I have been here a couple of times and they usually have pretty decent music playing. I've heard mostly hip hop and some ska/reggae. I will list pros and cons, to which you may give your own ratings.

Pros:

Great drink specials
Decent music
Dance area
Close to 16th street Bart
Easily accessible by bus
Close by other bars if you wish to check out the mission scene
Close by some pretty good restaurants in case you get hungry

Cons:

Bartenders may be as drunk/loaded or more so than you are
Very small tables, so you must hoard a few if you have a group of more than 4
Two unisex bathrooms
Two bartenders on a Friday night
Limited selection of beer on tap -- I love beer on tap, so the bigger the selection the better for me :)

I think the crowd is pretty mellow, so you get a variety of people in there. Overall, its a great place to at least get your night started with the drink specials.
author: Danielle S.

description:
One of the reasons I even use Yelp is so I can try some of the places and see how my rating matches up to everyone else's opinion.

In this case it does..  this place is pretty average.

Well, let's look at the facts.  We have a bar on 16th, that alone should be worth something right?  The bar serves drinks, right? yes, I think that might be already two stars or something...

Unfortunately, there isn't much else going for it.  The layout is decent but I'm not crazy about it.  I agree the crowd looked a little shady but I'm not a slender female so I wasn't worried.  The beer selection was decent, but nothing too stellar.  I blame the screen above the bar, it gives people who probably shouldn't be at bars alone too much of a reason to hang around.  This seems like a good happy hour bar as the weekday crowd seems pretty laid back, but otherwise I think this place ranks pretty low on places I would be determined to come to on a weekend.  Actually, if you're going to hold a gun to my head about where I want to drink in the Mission and we're on 16th, I will always go to the nearby Delirium or Kilowatt or even walk over to Guerrero for the 500 Club or ... (incoherent recommendation while I spill beer on myself)
author: Steven R.

description: I wondered into Skylark one evening on my trek back from Candystore Collective to BART. I was the only patron at 8:00 on a Thursday. I ordered a vodka based specialty cocktail and settled in to view a Disney cartoon with the bartender. I drank two cocktails before other patrons arrived. Everyone seemed so low key. It's almost hard to imagine the Skylark as a happening hot spot. Apparently, their Peaches parties are off the chain. They even serve peach Bellini's!  I left long before the festivities began.  I could see this place for at least an old school style happy hour.  It's a dark cave though.  I imagine funny things hang around dark caves.
author: Camille K.

description: This is my spot on wednesday nights. mixtape wednesdays has become pretty crackin. its usually a hit or miss in terms of the crowd, but the drink specials are cool beans. 9 bucks for a shot of patron and a corona. yeahhh, see ya monday! the music is dope as well, which always has me cumming back.
author: Alvin P.

description:
This place is my guilty pleasure.

That's all I've got for y'all on this place.  Go there, don't expect it to be anything and it will be everything.  

Nothing says "San Francisco" like not being able to smoke a cigarette in a bar, but being drenched by waves of marijuana smoke.

Drugs are indeed rampant - but hey, it's nice to have a one-stop shop, right?  You can get wasted, then high, then shake your tail-feather, then go next door and get your grub on, then repeat or go home.

Yay for Sky Lark.
author: Brandie A.

description: The music is pretty good here I think. They were spinning lots of throwbacks and some newer hip hop as well. Lots of people were there, and a decent energy from the crowd. It's pretty cool if you're already in the area, but I don't know if it'd be a destination spot for me.
author: Lauren S.

description: One of the more yuppie friendly bars in the Mission. Attractive space with comfortable seating, a small dance floor, and decent DJs. Drinks aren't pricey, beers for $4? Not bad.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Do not order a martini here.

(Skylark, if you're listening, a better gin selection would be great!)
author: Sahra H.

description:
been coming here for the past 3+ years. and is a sorta of a default when I'm not trying to do anything big. It can get a bit crowded and since the dance floor is in the back with no ventilation it gets really stuffy. they always play good music. sometimes you do get some sketchy people but hey that comes with the neighborhood.

Drink prices are good compared to other places. I actually went there last night. and is the 1st time i got crappy service. that would be the reason for the 3 stars The female bartender was making lousy drinks, skipping people and then has the nerve to cop an attitude when i pointed that out to her. I guess they hired her for her rack and not the bar tending skills
author: Alfredo N.

description:
I usually only go to Sky Lark if my friends drag me, but at least there's not normally a cover and  have music & a dance floor if you want to shake your ass - and the selection of women isn't half bad either. Personally, I think the drink prices are a little steep and I usually pregame a t Kilowatt before making my way in here. 

They play bizarre shit on the TV above the bar so if you're not feeling the crowd and just want to chill out & have a drink... I suppose you've got something to watch.... right?
author: Jeff S.

description:
Went here for a girl friend's bday on a Friday night. She really hyped this place up so I was really expecting a good crowd and a nice bar/lounge to hang out in.

Never expect a diamond from a cubic zarconia.

This place is sooooooooo damn small! Dance floor.... WHAT DANCE FLOOR? You mean the one where everyone is just standing around on? That's not a dance floor, that's JUST A FLOOR.

Fugly and SUPER GHETTO guys! Even with VODKA GOOGLES on I couldn't spot a cutie in the crowd. But of course, I don't really see any guys worth looking at in any SF/Bay Area club. 

Need a drink? Go to the bar across the street and come back. You'll get a drink faster that way rather than waiting for the damn bartender to notice you. There was only like 2 bartenders for the whole bar on a Friday night!

Need to get out? Be prepared to push, shove and kick some major @ss. This place is sooo small that you have no other choice but to kick your way out of the waves of smelly gross people.

I spent most of my time outside smoking cigs.
author: Britney C.

description:
no. 1: i am SERIOUSLY disturbed when people (esp. ppl who aren't of color) describe someplace as "ghetto." Is that your codeword for black??? why can't u just say black??? is ghetto synonymous with black??? what do you mean by "ghetto"? someone explain, and maybe i won't be soo freakin offended. 

no.2: when yelpers call something "ghetto", after I get annoyed, I realize it's 99.99999% likely that I will enjoy that venue, or at least the music. and I did. the highlight of skylark is the DJ who can make smooth transition and plays hands down good hip hop, r&b and reggae faves. songs you love to sing too. so shout out to that awesome pilipina (i think) Dj that played last thursday night. 

no.3: drinks are decently priced and they accept debit cards so u don't  need to worry about spending your emergency cab money on drinks

no.4: the crowd was "diverse" (as much as it can get in the mission) and I like that there were mixes of people of color and the awkward looking white guy in a green michigan tshirt dancing by himself -  everyone can have fun.  I can bring a multicultural group of friends and no one should feel out of place. big PLUS.... i guess some folks can't stand really "ghetto" scenes. ARGGGGGGH.....
author: Antoinnae C.

description:
I like The Skylark. Cool and hip looking place.  Friendly and kickback crowd. Very diverse crowd here for being in the Mission.  It can get pretty crowded though, but you can always step out for some fresh air.  Cool music, another place that plays lots of ol skool 90's hip hop (big plus for me).  And most important...friendly women who actually give me the time of day.

Good place to go if you're not into the crowded craziness of a nightclub.  No cover charge either.  Good luck though finding parking, if you decide to drive your car here.
author: Robert L.

description:
Im not too big on Hyphy no more, but this is the most hipsterish hyphy in the area!! I love it and hate it!! The bartenders are hella dope, know their drinks, and will jump over the bar to slap you if you deserve one! Drink prices are decent, some of the drinks are overpriced while others are pretty cheap! Music will get you going dumb!!!

The bar itself is nice, I love the dark reds and painted ceilings.. I would go there again mainly because my friends love coming here.
author: Eric A.

description: Great place, great bartenders, dancing, shows, dj's. Cool stuff all and all, bathrooms suck really bad though.
author: Christopher F.

description: The spot on Wednesday Nights.  Great music, pretty cool and diverse crowds.  No dress code, sometimes a $5 cover...It's a little grimy, but thats what makes it what it is.  The Mission is always a great spot to barhop different scenes, and really get a chance to experience one of the great atmospheres in San Francisco.  Go outside get a hot dog on the grill with some bacon on that. Skylark is one of the destinations you need to end up if you're a hip hop or reggae head.  Sometimes, you'll even be able to light up a bleeze. OH, and the big deal, Wednesday Nights = $9 for a shot of patron and a corona... fully equipped with limes.. holla at it!
author: Antonio C.

description:
Not as fun as it used to be. They play a lot more hiphop now and the crowd has shifted accordingly.  If you aint feelin it, move on.  Lots of other drinking joints around the corner on Valencia 

Thumbs UP:  Week nights are better.  DJs still mix it up good.  Sometimes they show soft core porn on the walls 
Thumbs DOWN:  Past its prime.  Weekends are made for the bridge and tunnel crowd.
author: Jeff C.

description:
THURSDAY NIGHTS ONLY:

I LOVE THURSDAY NIGHTS HERE!!! i was a regular all summer long till school came back into my life! then the going out every week hype stopped! i try to get in there on thursday now when i can! 

Music: TYCOON STATUS ENT.!!!!!!! Dj Doc and Dj Nyce spinning it all night long! as they say "From the Bay to L.A". for reals tho they know what they're doing! old school, new school, bay area, etc they really do play it all!! seriously have me and my girls on the dance floor till the lights come up!

Scene: its dark, kinda dingy, metallic glittery sofas, located on 16th an Valencia, i mean it really is a BAR! the crowd is a mix! hipsters, hip-hop heads, hyphy kids, and the regulars!! if you go enough like some of us do you'll start to see this place/dj's kinda have their own following you start to see and run into the same people you met there! 

Bartenders/Alcohol!!!: drink specials all night long! easy to get a drink at the bar! they know me cause im there so much (idk if thats good or bad) they usually hook up the drinks for me! its usually like a buy 1 get the second one for free! lol or they give me a discount on my tab! so take my advice be like me be friend the bartenders!!!!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Damn you, Skylark!! Why couldn't you be bigger?  I mean, you got your vibe right, the folks are chill, and the music here is definitely bumpin'!! But, come here on a packed night and it's almost a struggle to even, remotely, enjoy yourself.  

My advice : Come here early, post up at the bar, get your drank on, & attack the dance floor before the crowd comes.
author: gEe C.

description:
Be prepared to dance by yourself.  The quality of men available are less then steller.  But, the music is throwback R & B which was hella cool.  The scene is a little sketch but a girlfriend and I held our own.  Plus there is Panco Villa down the street to grab a snack.  I'd go back if I wanted to get back on touch w/ my ghetto Stockton roots.  

VEggie Friendly: Yes
author: ashley l.

description:
I like this bar alot when in general...
It can be grimey no doubt but it's a dope bar.
They normally have some pretty good DJs and 
the drinks aren't that bad either
Overall not bad
However don't be shocked if it's not for you at the same time...
author: Rich P.

description:
I do many things that I would not recommend to others.  Some of them are as innocuous as wearing too much gold jewelry, or watching the Hills every single Monday.  Some of them are completely unmentionable and not fit for print.  Somewhere in between the former and the latter is giving my number to a 21 year old hipster at Skylark.  Months ago.  He still calls, despite the fact that I have not answered for, well, months.  Oh, and he gave my number to his friend.  COOL.

While I don't always think you can judge a venue by the people that frequent it, in this case, I would have to say that you can.  Frequenting Skylark, like giving your number to a 21 year old, is not something you can do without a dose of shame and regret.  You will ask yourself, "Why did I go even have to go that route?  How has it benefited me in any way?"

Enough of that.  Skylark is small, dark, crowded, and the dance floor smells like pee.  Also, full of hipster douches.  I know, I know, I could be describing almost any bar in the Mission!  Isn't that weird how that works???
author: Jessi C.

description:
Come on folks, it's a Mission district bar. Good beer selection, and the wine by the glass is better than most high end restaurants, interesting/colorful characters.. and the DJ's kick ass. 
What more do you want from a neighborhood bar?
author: don l.

description:
I walked into a Mission bar and got teleported to Oakland.
Pros: affordable drinks. Familiar hip-hop. Happy crowd. NO COVER CHARGE.
Cons: feels unexpectedly like Oakland. Don't get me wrong--I like Oakland when I'm there, but my expectations were not set for that type of experience.
author: Pete L.

description: The crowd is less homogeneous than other bars in the Mission, and although I appreciate a bar where I can hear the Smiths, this place plays strictly hip hop. Quality hip hop, too. It's not particularly my scene, but that's what I like about it.
author: Alex V.

description: Went here on a Monday. There was a decent amount of people here there. Dj played good reggae and dance music. Crowd was half hipster and half 'yay area' kids (aka somewhat ghetto). Nice bartenders, nice doormen, no cover, no dress code AND they were playing Scooby Doo on the overhead (definitely a plus). Fun times for a Monday night, I must say.
author: S. M.

description: If you like smoking pot on the dance floor with sketchy mission men, this place is for you.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: Too much smoke with stoners smoking way more weed than they can handle, evident in their eyes, and place is very small and crowded like sardins.
author: Tom T.

description: Last night I attempted to come here for my friends going away and hip hop night. The door man tried to tell me the ID was not mine when it was obviously my picture and the people that saw him do it stopped me to look at my ID and agreed it was mine. Took me 5 hours in the DMV to get this ID and 3 months in the mail because its the new California design, it has a bear that shows when you shine a light on it, its my ID. I was born female and appear masculine so I am used to being harassed about that and as I got eye contact with this guy in line I knew he was going to mess with me about it. I get there and this door guy, that looks like every guy that harassed me while living in Northern Florida, looks at my ID, smirks then says he's going to have to ask me questions because he doesnt think its me. He references how my weight is different and then told me he's not letting me in because I cant state the address on my ID but i stated everything else. Yea, well Ive moved 4 times in the past year , excuse me if I forgot one of those addresses. A friend of mine showed him my ID and told him it is me and he then stated something about my gender being female on there and how I had facial hair in my picture, which was barely stubble. I can grow facial hair, tons of female born people can grow facial hair, get over it. The picture is not that much different and i put it as my main picture to prove a point.  You are in San Francisco and there are a ton of gender variant appearing people here, get over it, you discriminating against me isnt going to change me. You can act like youre justified but everyone of my friends who came out to talk to me knew this wasnt really about my ID but about the door guys bias against my masculinity. In the end, although i am disappointed that people like this doorman exist and that we cant all just be positive and accepting of others regardless of how they identify but by the judge of their character... I am ok to have not come into your bar that night because on a side note, it smelled strongly of sewage the last time I went there last Thursday night and the beer is too expensive.
author: Dean B.

description: I don't wear overly tight mini skirts.  I don't let my boobs pop out of my tank tops. And I don't scam on skeezy guys dealing drugs on the dance floor.  Therefore I don't really fit in with 90% of the "women"  (if you are under aged are you a woman or are you still a child?!) I saw hanging out in this joint. And good golly this damn place was so hot and the drinks were pretty weak. No no never again for me.
author: Rebecca H.

description: I met some people here and they only picked it for the location, none of us had been there before. There's something about this bar that I just don't like but can't quite put my finger on it, it's just kind of creepy.  The torn up seat cushions and cheep ammonia smell didn't help. The beer was kind of skunky. The only reason I'm giving them three starts is because their happy hour lasts till 9.
author: Manny F.

description: Skylark is LOUD, packed with guys and did I mention LOUD?  No thanks.
author: phil h.

description: After hitting Hobsons and feeling the need to get down this place definitely filled the void for some music. The drinks were made just right but how can you really fck up a jager bomb? The over head screens showing cartoons at times and porno at other times made for a great conversation. The dance floor was small but people packed it and just like John Legend says we just don''t care. The crowd is chill and gives off the dive bar lounge kind of feel. I will definitely hit up this venue especially when they have their hip hop nights going on.
author: Justin G.

description: Lame as fuck - the guys just stand around and stare, it's too loud, gets super crowded, and the music blows.  The only good thing is that they were having specials on Patron.  My inner alcoholic thanks you.
author: Max B.

description: not memorable.. drinks are very weak... if i cant tell there is alcohol in a diet coke drink that is bad!  The music was pretty cool... 90s hip hop.  The crowd was pretty weird... douche bags, ghetto kids, preppies, a few cool people sprinkled in but.. not impressed.. I saw 2 altercations.... I only came here cause everywherelse was too crowded!
author: blair k.

description: Skylark is one of my fav spots. No cover charge EVER. Drink prices are koo. They play rap some r&b oh & Reggea :-). The place is small, kinda wish it was bigger. You dont have to dress to impress. Oh and b4 i forget....smokin Mary Jane's flowers is allowed ;-). Mondays are definately crackin. Not sure bout other days. Saturdays every spot in frisko is. Koo spot.
author: Miguel A.

description: So I end up coming here a lot every time I am at the Mission. I'm sad that they don't really make good Tom Collins, nor do some of the bartenders know how to make them at all. =/ I'm sorry but I need my old man drink! But their special Ruby Skylark drink is quite tasty. And they even have pear cider! Great for weaklings like myself. I'm happy for that that at least. And most of the time I have been here, I have enjoyed the music. I do not like Skylark on Saturdays, but I guess I really don't like any of Mission bars on Saturdays, because they're always super packed, sweaty, and sometimes you'll smell miss mary jane (which actually isn't bad, but you know they won't share). On a recent Saturday, there was only like one bartender for a long period of time? What the hell? However, I did go on a Tuesday, on a slow night I liked it a lot. Bartender was super friendly and I was really feeling the music. And I could pee. No bathroom line! Sweet. If you're looking for something chill on a weekday, come here... but if you want to getttt crazy come on Saturdays.
author: April D.

description: Dun doit for me.  Normally, I hear music and I just want to move.  But this dance floor never calls my name.  At Skylark, It's never this shorty's birthday.  I never shake ma ass or show anyone what i'm workin wit.  And I never, never fell like anyone there has a sexy back.  But maybe it's because I can never contemplate fitting me and my big moves on that unappealing dance floor.
author: Audrey T.

description: I like to shake my ass, but my ass doesn't like to shake at Skylark.  Too loud, too crowded, and the music is boring.
author: Katie S.

description: Been here once for the night life. It was crowded, it was musty, felt dirty, but it was free. Free alone saves it from getting only one star.
author: Jonas T.

description:
Will never go here again!  The bartender is an asshole!  The place accepts cash and credit card, but this guy yells at me for using my credit card and tells me to go to the ATM.  If you only want cash then say cash only or even cash preferred.  But since neither was the case, I'll use my credit card if I want to!

Here's what happened.. When I first got to the bar, I bought a round of drinks with my credit card.  I wasn't planning on buying more drinks, so I did not start a tab.  Later in the evening, when it was close to last call, I bought another round of drinks.  I gave the bartender my credit card to pay.  He looks at it, and says, "Didn't I run your credit card already?"  I said yes but I didn't think I was going to buy more drinks.  He proceeds to yell at me saying, "I asked you earlier if you wanted to start a tab and you closed it.  Do you know what a pain in the ass it is to close a credit card.  Now do you want to leave it open this time?  Because if you're going to close it out, there's an ATM machine right there.  So are you going to leave it open or go to the ATM machine because it's a fucking pain in the ass to close it and I'm not going to run your credit card again!"

I was so taken aback by getting yelled at that I just said fine, leave it open.  I didn't want to cause a scene, although everyone around me had already heard and thought it was ridiculous.  I was extremely mad, embarrassed, and surprised at the actions of the bartender.  

I did not catch his name, but he was the taller Caucasian guy of the three bartenders there that night.  He was wearing a brown shirt and had short brown hair.  

So, if you do go here, don't order drinks from this bartender.
author: m e.

description: Quite a small dance floor- always got the tunes jammin'!  some call it ghetto, but whatever, I can always know it is a guaranteed good time!  Only a small single ass bathrooms, so that is for sure not a plus, but the drinks make up for it... Drink on! and pee later!  LOL!
author: A. C.

description: Great music to dance to...love the DJ. VERY scary boys...but sometimes you'll find one that's just hanging out in the corner wanting to share his joint with you.
author: Tanger T.

description: LOL.... read all the reviews to this place and then you'll understand right as you walk in. Yes, all the girls get groped and cannot dance by themselves. Luckily, I had some guy friends with me. But these creepy on the prowl dudes do not let up. Even if you reject them 5 times, they do not understand NO I DON'T WANT TO DANCE WITH YOUR SORRY ASS. Be careful though, it's not worth getting in a fight for. Though some loser guy got beat up after the club let out...
author: Beth W.

description: Blech.  A narrow bar with a meager attempt at a dance floor in the back to mediocre music.  The worst part, as my friend described it, was the smell: a combination of incense and wet shoes.  Ick.
author: Corey C.

description: if you want to add some excitement to your night you should definitely stop by. As I was enjoying a delicious bacon wrapped hot dog, ready to go back inside, a small fight started brewing. The fight quickly turned into a melee and spilled into the middle of 16th. Minutes later four SFPD cars were on the scene and the bar suddenly closed. I guess I missed the stabbing from the previous week...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Ummm yeah. When you think of the mission you think hipster right(not that I like that). This place is sooooo ghetto. The clientele is full of ghetto people getting beyond nasty on the dance floor. Walking to the bath room through the dance floor I felt like I needed a NC-17 warning. No decorum. I'm not a prude but shit get a room. Sitting down and drinking w/ my friends wasn't bad.
author: Chris L.

description: Friendly staff. Great on off-nights. Strong cocktails. Expect a crowd on weekends. No tude, either way. A neighbor bar.
author: Josie S.

description: This is where Marina chicks come to slum.  Skip it.  I will say that Steve is a cool dude.
author: Thadd L.

description: Decent divebar... drinks were good, bartender was chill, large crowd going on a Saturday night. The dance floor was pretty packed, but decently under control. Decent tunes, and a mix of sketch and non-sketch people. Oh, and I don't think they charged cover, so that was nice.
author: Alissa B.

description: Gnarly gnarly gnarly. My diminutive stocky jewish friend Harry likes it here. This is in spite of the fact that he witnessed a shooting here and blood squirted on him. Damn, that is so hip hop. I'll give it two stars instead of one.
author: Nicholas E.

description: I chose Halloween night to check out this hot spot and there was a long line out the door.  Walked past the front and you can smell the musky funk.  So do I venture in?  Of course.  Bouncers are nice Samoan dudes.  There wasn't a cover nor dress code.  It was a Reggae Monday night.   Headed to the bar, and they had 2 -3 bartenders.  Now this is a proper bartender.  They know each person who came first and last and went in order.  No homie, you waving your $20 ain't gonna get their attention.  1st they're not strippers and 2nd, you'd probably tip them the same anyways.  Asked for two double Jamisons with coke.  It was $18, so hmm, I guess that's about right.  Booths surrounded the walls.  Head to the back and its the dance floor and truly what I call a sauna.  My friends and I could only last 30 minutes at a time before sweating a butt load and having to head to the front door to get some oxygen.  We did this cycle 3x that night.  Now, I'm an OK fan of reggae, but they do it right here.  The DJ booth is small, but they had MCs taking turns and adding funk to the sound.  It pretty much brought the house down.  I would totally go again, but man, I looked like I took a shower when I finally left.  Hair and clothes were all wet. . . Ewwww.  They really need to work on ventilating back there.  Then I'll really be a big fan.  Thanks!
author: Janice F.

description: A good place to chill out not including weekends. Try and snag the front booth before it gets too crowded. Their Tuesday night house-breaks party is worth dropping by.
author: Nish N.

description: Wow -- I liked this place a lot more than ya'll.  Maybe it's cuz my first car was a Skylark and it made me kinda nostalgic.  Or I wished that the mermaids on the ceiling would come sit with us on the sparkly silver vinyl benches (which would've been soooo cool in my car -- both the benches and the mermaids...).  I found the service to be quite friendly, and was happy they had Fat Tire on tap.  It did get loud later on when folks started dancing, but you'd expect that on a Saturday night.  Nobody molested me, but I was there with a burly pal of mine, which may have been just the preventive ticket.  (He's single, FYI, ladies...)
author: Andi T.

description: I stopped by this place for a drink on early a Friday night.  It wasn't too crowded yet and the drinks didn't take long to order but somehow my beer  didn't taste very good and I just left most of it standing there as we left.  The one cool thing about this place that night was a guy singing these old school songs, like the theme to "Married with Children" which I enjoyed hearing for the first time in years.  His voice was awesome so it was fun to hang out for a bit and listen to him.   Maybe I'll update this review if I ever stop by this place again though I honestly don't see much reason to, I've been to much better bars and have a feeling there are better places in SF to check out next time I'm in town.
author: Herman S.

description: I was a fan of Skylark when I first moved into the city, but the more I go there the more I realize that it's more ghetto than ghetto fabulous. The drinks are pretty hit or miss a lot of the time and the crowd ranges from mildly annoying to downright scary at times. It used to be a fun place to hang out for dancing or just for drinks, but it's not on the top of my list these days...
author: Michael E.

description: Skylark is an old standby - you can count on it for a good, crazy time, either drinking at the bar or dancing in the back.  The crowd is fun, diverse and laid back, and they play a great mix of new and old school hip-hop.  I did get my purse stolen here once, but hey, what did I expect leaving it at the table?  And... it's true that you might run into a few molesters, but they usually can be fended off with an elbow jab or a disapproving look.  I'll have to dissent from the rest - I love this place!
author: Elizabeth P.

description: Skylark offers the finest selection of blinging grills, pushy girls, and grabby hands. I love the music - great for booty shakin'. The dance floor, however, makes me a little claustrophobic and usually is sweaty, crowded, and would be a bad place to be during a fire or earthquake. Yeah, if you are breathing and have a vagina, you WILL be molested.
author: Jessa B.

description: This bar is pretty butt. Anyway, looks pretty harmless from the front, but sounds like it's pretty like groping in the back dance area. Anyway, we were in there and out of there pretty quickly.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
players need not apply
because this place is already fully staffed.
author: Barney B.

description: This place gets really crowded on weekends and for some reason the crowd is never that friendly. I like the music they play but it's not worth dealing with the crowds.
author: Cathy T.

description: It was super crowded and not the best music. It took forever and a half to get a drink and I later found out they charged my credit card twice! BOO!
author: Gladys C.

description: Always packed and the music is great-- old school hip hop for hours.  I usually end up here at some point if I'm in the Mission.
author: Rayna A.

description: this place should be called DATERAPE. The guys who frequent this spot, with their wannabe gucci creep me out. Every dude there is foaming at the mouth with the "i want to fuck you " look. it gets way too cramped,the dj space/"dancefloor" is small as hell. grossssss
author: Lauren V.

description:
I stumbled in here a while back with some friends.

It's kinda ghetto. The scene was interesting, a very diverse group. To be honest, there were a lot of people here that were pretty sketchy. Ladies, I wouldn't go here to meet a man. For such a small, narrow space, it was WAY too crowded.

The music was mostly hip-hop and was pretty good.

I didn't want a drink but a friend of mine did and had a lot of trouble getting it. The crowd was just crazy the night we went.

I don't know about this one...there are so many other bars in the Mission to hang out in that don't smell, aren't as crowded as this place, or as ghetto.

Skip it.
author: Nicole R.

description: Slim Shady Saturdays with more normal people outside bumming change, cigs and crack on the corner. The consensus has never been so spot on. Weekends at Skylark are no fun at all. Everytime I hear someone, usually from out of town, call and say "hey meet me at this bar on sixteenth, hold on, wait a second, oh it's called Skylark," I say, "have a nice night buddy!" On the plus side, weeknights can be sweet with a good dj.
author: Phil M.

description: Pretty good music, but in attempts to dance, be prepared to be hovered over with the hoverers going for grope.  Go with friends, dance with friends, but don't expect to meet a new hottie!  Oh and skip the restroom.
author: Natalie E.

description: Used to be a cool space for music and dancing.  Now it's turned into another Blondies.  Totally ghetto with the compliments of grabby thugs.  Great bartenders on Friday night, fun music, (ladies) just steer clear of the dance floor, and you'll be allright.
author: Teresa H.

description: I've been here exactly twice in my life. The first time was in September 2005 and the last time was a couple of nights ago. The one thing I do remember from both visits is dancing. Both times they had popular hip-hop music to dance to, but this last time the dance floor was far emptier. Since I didn't actually drink there, it's hard for me to rate the quality of beverages or bartending. But I enjoyed the music and the fact that there was no cover.
author: Donna W.

description: Dancing to "I Got 5 On It" has never been more fun!! Perfect place for a late night in the Mission! Little ghetto, cool house music, and mixed crowd.
author: Virginia S.

description: I love me some Skylark. Or Skeezy as a few acquaintances like to call this joint.  It's the spot I like to kick it at on Wednesdays, mostly because they play hip hop and because cover charge is $5.
author: Lauren S.

description:
skylark was EH.
im not gonna lie, i had HELLA fun here. but i think it was because of my friends.
DO NOT DANCE BY THE MENS BATHROOM. that shit is RAAAAAANK!!!!!!!!!

it gets super crowded on the dance floor but there is a fan and its itty bitty, but theres a fan. whenever my friends went to get drinks they came back hella fast so im assuming the bartenders were quick.

the crowd was really good though. everyone was friendly dancing with everyone else. all the jams were good. nothing bad to say.

except be careful of the bums that hang out outside. one picked up a shoe from the ground and tried to give it to me....
author: A. V.

description: This is where I end up if nothing else in frisco is crackin and i dont feel like spending any money. Me and my friends will roll through here and bring a bottle in and get a cup with some ice and pour our bacardi in and chill. The music is always good and the crowd is coo, theres a variety. The skylark does not let me down ever. Extra points because the homeless crowd is interesting too. I swear this guy had the best sidewalk sale ever. Me and my friend were posted outside and this guy had this mary poppins like bag and kept bringing item after item out. I swear he had some really cute shit, with tags! So he was entertaining for about 15 minutes, then went back in and danced some more and bounced, i can always count on skylark as a last option for mild entertainment.
author: Lorain C.

description: no cover when i went around 11:30pm. I was wearing a white shirt, guy said its not allowed, told me to take it off and just hold it because I had another shirt underneath.
author: Robin L.

description: expensive drinks & rude staff. ugly crowd (guys wouldn't take no for an answer & lots of petty theft). would not recommend if you want to continue to have fun. the two stars are ONLY because the DJs were on point.
author: Christlyn R.

description: What happened to thursdays in San Francisco?! After leaving empty medjool we stopped here late night on a thursday and it was pretty empty too. Sat comfortably and sucked down some cocktails but the crowd left much to be desired. Nothing really special about this place but I would probably give it another chance if I were in the area.
author: Jane K.

description: By no means am I an expert on bars, but the Skylark has a good vibe to it, if you're looking to dance or chill to some good hip hop or reggae.  The service is cordial and the patrons are cool.  The vibe is almost always welcoming.
author: M R.

description:
the skylark is a great bar, one of my favorites.  but then again, that was 2 years ago.  i went back not too long ago and realized that i didn't like this place all that much anymore.

skylark is the first bar i went to in sf, and was with hong/gene/babbs/jimmy/george/etc...

"here's jimmy's mom! our house, in the middle of the street" -babbs.

karen and i went here once, she danced on the bar but hit her head on the hanging lights. the bartender gave her a free shot =)
author: Ameer N.

description: i like that dat bay shit and they play it here............no dress code, no charge, can't beat that................the bathroom is hella far though and gotta walk through the crowd to get there.
author: BENADICK F.

description: I've only gone for Pagode with Grupo da Sete on Sunday evenings, but it's always a great time. Good band, fun crowd (lots of drunk Brazilians), high energy and I think it's free for women before 7:30 (?) It's not expensive, though (?$7?) for a good live band in an intimate atmosphere. The bartender seems to always be the same guy on Sunday nights and he's very friendly and pours 'em strong.
author: Rachel L.

description:
it was packed on a friday night, there was no cover charge, and the bartenders were awesome. 

this place is definitely a meatmarket, so if you didnt come to hook up bring a bunch of your friends.
author: Miz C.

description: Skylarks not bad, but not great. They have a really long bar but only two people working, so it is not easy getting drinks. They have three door men, I don't know why? The tables are tiny so it is hard to get a good sized group sitting around to drink. The dance floor is small and some how it makes me feel like I am back in middle school. Boys are standing on one side and girls on the other... kinda. It's like the guys are waiting for a chicka to make eye contact with. Who knows, But it creeps me out. The only really good thing about this bar is the danceable hip hop music and the dark lighting so I can avoid  the creepy middle school boys awaiting a chance to make eye contact with me. haha
author: Ashley M.

description: This is just a good little hangout, I always have a good time here.  No dress code, no cover, nice bartenders.  Wednesday nights are the best, good music and no crowds.
author: Nanette D.

description: A lil out of place for the mission, but I think that's why I kinda like it ... Old school to new school hip hop, just my kind of spot! The only minus was fightin the sweatshop to get to the bathroom (sometimes I don't do well with crowds) but other than that, drinks were good (always a +) and the vibe was cool -good for people watching (especially the wood be macks & pimps)-nice!
author: Mack M.

description: great meet-up spot, can get crowded quickly on weekends. best nights to go were Wed or Thurs.
author: Joe O.

description: Decent decor, semi cool bartenders, and not much else to write home about. The crowd was kind of eh.... I can't say I"d make this a regular spot of mine, but might drop by here for the occasional drink. This seems like a good place to start the nite.
author: Srinivas R.

description: Okay, I don't always like this place, but I gotta say that Steve is one of the best bartenders in town.  He rocks!!!
author: kerry l.

description:
honestly, i like the skylark.  you get there early, or on a weekday, and its pretty empty.  the bartenders are nice and they have a decent scothc selection.  the djs can be pretty decent too.

then, at about 11pm, the place fills up with a mob of straight guys looking to get laid.  and not subtlely either.

so i'd say get there early or not at all
author: Steve S.

description: Come here on a Saturday night if you like hip-hop, hyphy and an "authentic" San Francisco crowd. Don't come here if you want to impress an Orange County princess.
author: William L.

description: So it maybe crowded, sweaty and ghetto but some energy brings you back to this spot over and over again. All you yelpers gave it a 1 or 2 but have you asked yourself why you keep going back? It's like a bad habit...Good music if you are in the mood for some old school hip-hop with the occasional top 40's R&B. Alright, alright I met my honey here so it's got special memories for me...either way you gotta check it out just once.
author: Kavita S.

description: Heard & saw a guy get shot across the street from this place. End of story. Ok, "good drinks," but probably better drinks to be found in the city, esp. the mission, or the mish, for all you marina poeple in the mission.
author: Kelly H.

description: Came here last year on a weekday and it was struggling more than Ben Affleck's career.  Me and my ex pretty much comprised the dance floor.  What a difference 300 some odd days makes.  Now, it's got that sweat condensation sheen on the walls from all the gyrating bodies.  It's a task to get to the bathroom in the back of the club; you'd have to be some type of Asian Moses to part the brown sea that is the dance floor.  Other pluses include fast drink service and a hoppin' vibe.  It's nice to hear "classic" Hip Hop, considering the choices out there now.  "I-N-D-E-P-E-N-D-E-N-T do you kno wat that mean mane?"  I do, it means you suck and I'm surprised you can spell at the 6th grade level, mane.
author: Sam N.

description:
aside from the crowd bein a little suburban trashy (more black pants than trucker hats), i don't really know why this place gets such a bad rap.

good hip hop, no cover, every night.

if it were in the marina, it would be 'amazin'
author: Seiji C.

description: Wednesday night:  Pretty cool spot however it gets really crowded.  They play good music but the dancefloor is stuffy and filled with eh-looking people.  You will catch me either at the bar or outside (if i'm ever there).  Complete sausage fest, which is just how I like it but the guys there are pretty scared aka no game so most interesting people are the bums hangin out outside.  Oh and it's Filipino-fest on WED..it's filipino hipsterville!
author: ShayShay G.

description: one of my favorite bars in the mission. the music here is usually on point. when you get there early they start you out with that good ole 90's r&b and hip hop. gets your night started off right. as more people showing up and the ethanol starts to take effect on your brain the music gets a little bit more  up beat. but 11:30 everybody is up and dancing. it can get a little hot in here but you can just make sure to take off your sweater and get funky with it.  it is a little rough around the edges but they keep a good crowd in with their stricyly enforced dress code. i never really felt like there was going to be a fight in there but then again i don't go very often.
author: Ashley H.

description: I liked this place. A real small whole in the the wall with good music and a great crowd. My girls and I walked in dressed to impress and were well received by others patrons in the bar. Everyone was happy and dancing all over the place while others choose to sit and mingle amoung their friends and others. The drink were very strong and loaded with good alcohol. Although it did take a while to get a drink but the atmosphere really distracted me while I was waiting for mines. The only downside were the creeps lurking around the outside area of this place it really made it intimidating for me.
author: Carolina H.

description: It's not pretentious, and they usually have decent music playing.  It's kind of been hit or miss the last few times, though.  And last time I went, there were really weird people on the dance floor.  Hmmm...
author: Briana M.

description:
went here on a wednesday night for mixtape and the DJ's were off the hook!!  if you're just looking for good music, this is definitely the place to be on a wednesday night.

minus 2 stars because the bartender (hot as she was) took waaaaaay too long to make drinks, and the dance "floor" was about the size of my bathroom, and conveniently located right in front of the two restrooms:  so if you had to go, you had to wade through the crowd of drunk dancers who are packed in like sardines.  Also, since the dance floor is soooo conveniently located, if someone um... goes number 2 in one of the restrooms, when the open the door the whole crowd can get a whiff.  classy.  so, i'm kind of confused by skylark:  dance floor's too small for it to really be a club, but the music's too loud for it to really be a lounge.. i don't know.  i'd go again, but not if i had to pay a cover charge.
author: asia c.

description: Its beyond explanation, but I continue to be amused and drawn to the crowd at Skylark.   Some say I flirted with the 'ghetto side' of my inner being growing up and maybe I like to see people coming to the Mission to bump and grind. Decent music and relatively quick service before people come pouring in from Blondies.
author: Alicia J.

description: They have a good dancefloor and they are always playing hip hop most conducive to booty shakin'.  Sometimes it's totally empty, and sometimes it's so crowded you can't breathe or move.  I have fun most of the time and always end up returning to get my dance on.
author: Sid D.

description: Am I just getting old or is the Mission no longer the hot spot it once was.
author: Philip M.

description: I've only been to Skylark for its reggae night, which happens every Monday. Hailing from a fairly multi-ethnic city like Chicago, I've been surprisingly hard pressed to find reggae bars that weren't brimming with white folks from Jacksonville Florida donning reggae hats with fake dreads sewn into them, you know, the one's who mistakenly quote Bob Marley, have to give you some hackneyed bro embrace every five minutes and deliriously scream "Yeahhhh!" when a particular mood strikes them. Makes the hair on the back of my neck stand on end. Nonetheless I was pleasantly surprised by the authenticity of the reggae the DJ's spun at Skylark. It was roots mon, no UB40 here. The crowd was mixed, grinding hips and by all outward apperances fairly fucking hot. Apart from the strong though average priced drinks there are other elements of Caribbean authencity to enjoy. Though the dancefloor wouldn't allow a jitterbug to cut a rug it's perfect for cozying up to that cutie you saw earlier by the bar. SO buy another drink, give the DJ your request (they're approachable) and skank the night away bredren.
author: Charles S.

description:
So I write and write about Skylark. This is my third typed up review I've done. Its so difficult to have a solid opinion about this place so I thought I would lay this one out straight and to the point: 

PROS 

Best music in the city - tired of KMEL, 949, Beyonce, Usher, and the "Autotune" revolution of "Hip Hop" music? Come to Skylark. Listen to old school / new school Bay Area music, old school Hip Hop jams, 2pac, Snoop, BIG, etc etc. Real quality Hip Hop, NOT POP. They also have reggae nights which are tight as hell too. 

Good crowd: Most people are out to dance, party, have a good time. Read carefully: just because this place displays diversity does not give your pale stale corny white ass the excuse to call it ghetto. Some don't like Buffalo Exchange, vintage flannel shirts and American apperal so stop being so judgemental. 

Good experiences: if you went to the wackest bar in the World but could still tell stories about crazy never-forgotten experiences you would love that wack ass bar. Skylark is in no way a wack ass bar. But when you have cool experiences, it makes the spot worth going to. 

CONS 

Have had mixed experience with the staff. Theres a bartender there who is not only arrogant to a sin but talks to his friends and gives away free drinks on nights where the place is packed with paying customers. Also once yelled at my friend when we decided to write "0" as the credit card tip so that we could tip him fat incash. Needless to say, he wasnt tipped at all after. At the end of the night, I explained to him that he received a "0" on the credit recipt because he was about to receive a 50% tip "CASH" the way most like it. Then I told him he blew it, and gave him a quarter. He took the quarter and threw it "at me." By "at me" I mean 10 feet to my left. He proceeded to try to kick us out of the bar (the lights were already on) and we laughed and slowly walked our way out, while the bouncer laughed with us. This experience doesn't cause me to not come here anymore. It actually makes for a good story everytime I'm there. 

I will say the female bartender is very friendly, as is the tall white dude. Never had problems with either of those two, very professional, quick service, friendly. 

Bouncers have ridiculous dress code rules. But it does help keep the place safe. And really thats what its about these days especially when you have a crazy crowd. And the latino dude that bounces there is tight. He does his job well.  

Also the drinks tend to lack a serious punch. I like to go somewhere else beforehand where they actually put alcohol in my drink and head here afterwords. 


So there you have it... the good and the bad of Skylark. Enjoy it for what it is.

Goes from a three to a four for my experiences.
author: Dave M.

description: I'm really hit or miss with this place. If you go at some weird hour on some random day, it's a pretty cool place to hang out. Grab a table, enjoy some reasonable drinks, listen to some tunes. But if you go there at a more "normal" hour, or on a Friday/Saturday night, it's a bit too crowded to enjoy anything.
author: Jon N.

description: Maybe it was because we grabbed a booth, or because there were a bunch of us and we didn't really care about anyone else, or because we were drinkin' and enjoyin' and not really carin' but we ended up having a great time here. Music was fine, typical hip hop stuff, good stiff drinks and a good looking bartender who was always ready to feed us more booze...good times!
author: Irene F.

description: Small, good DJ, but gets REALLY crowded on weekends.  It's got a very, very small dance floor between the end of the bar and the bathrooms, and the last time I was here, I was so wasted I stopped waiting in line for the ladies room and simply let myself into the men's room instead.  My friend also threw up AT the table we were sitting at, and supposedly I was skanking in a corner, by myself, to hip-hop music.  Clearly, an all around wonderful place.
author: Catherine K.

description:
from my blog:

uncanny, common tendency:

why must i have an appetite for lebanese-german mutts? 

(fyi: arjay's born in ohio, eduardo's born in brazil--both with lebanese
mothers and fathers of german descent.)

btw, i wanted to sleep with arjay after meeting and catching up with him tonight at the BEST.DIVE.ON.EARTH: the one and only SKYLARK. 

(think: replace the cheap beer with joints at an amherst college SoCo party, with an equally diverse and good-looking crowd who WISHED they were really that cool.)

new find, new fav; Tunnel Top Bar 2.0.

OH. did i also mention that it felt like a harold and kumar scene at my
favorite *joint* everrrrrrrr???

........................and only half a block away. (!!!!!!!!!!!!)
author: Geo L.

description: Mojitos! Didn't get to stay there that long...but it looked like a real chill place.
author: Anita C.

description: This place ain't bad.  I go here when I want to go out, drink, and dance a bit without having to dress up.  There's no dress code.... so I like that.  The crowd is alright... not bad.  The line for bathroom is really long though, and kinda gross.  But all in all, not bad.
author: suzanne l.

description: Why does this place only have 3 stars? Everytime I visit home, we always head out to Skylark! I think it's those little coaster napkins with the trivia question that keep me going back. True.. the drinks could stand to be a tad stronger/cheaper, and there could be more (than 1) bathrooms. But the crowd is always friendly and fun. Plus, I spent NYE 2007 here and witnessed a lady pissing on the lamp pole.. how much better does it get?
author: Sheena C.

description: Skylark is an ok bar. The drinks aren't too expensive and the music is usually good. Parking can get hard around here and also the neighborhood isn't the safest but Skylark is full of all types of characters. The bathrooms have great little advertisements on the walls, I was extremely entertained while using it. I can stop in here for a drink to begin the night or end the night but I don't know if I can spend a whole night here. It is what it is.
author: D J.

description: We came by  to check out this bar after dinner at Andalu.  The DJ, Kyle was playing pretty good old school hip hop and rap.  So we hung out here for an hour reminiscencing about the good rap back in the day.  Technically, it was the guys reminicing about the music, I was just listening :)  The crowd was diverse.  With all that said, I'll come back in a heart for a girls night out.
author: Jay L.

description: Kind of random place but it was refreshing to find a place like this. So a few friends were out on a Monday night looking for somewhere to go have a few birthday drinks after dinner and somehow ended up here. We got there around 9:30 or so and there were literally 5 people there (including the bartender), I guess it was reggae night so we decided to stay for a little bit to see how it played out. The bartender was really cool and was very quick to serve us. Somewhere around 10 or 10:30 the place started to fill up with all different types of people (once the reggae music started). I recommend this place for people looking for some good reggae music with interesting people.
author: Christina D.

description: Music is off the hook at this place during the weekends... it's pretty small and can get crowded... Depending on which night you go, you can run into some wierd people as well. But still... great hip hop bumping all night!
author: Lucy C.

description: I used to hang out here quite a bit, and before 11 it is empty, and after 11 it is sweaty and crowded. It's got a narrow gauntlet you have to walk down to get to the dance floor.. which means you get pawed out of control. It's one of the few hip hop clubs I know about, I guess, that's why I go there. I have met so many guys here, and most of them were not skeazy, but the skeaze percentage is very high so use your judgement, which can be tough when you're pounding the pabst, which is probably why there are so many guys here.. ah, circular logic!
author: Anna B.

description:
"They play a lot more hiphop now and the crowd has shifted accordingly." ....so spoken by a previous reviewer.
true that and bring it on!!  skylark is down.  it is my favorite place for kickin it with a small group...low key but always fun. good cheap drinks and you can count on hearing some of those old school hip hop songs that make you go, "ohhh shit! remember when THIS came out??"  
(not going to lie, the first time i went we passed this dirty bum that goes, 'you girls are a long way from the marina, aren't ya?? haha...)
author: rachel l.

description: You can take the girl outta San Jose, but you can't take the San Jose outta the girl!  For those of you who like to get low (low, low, low) like yours truly, this place is hoppin'.  OK, you'll have to mind people groping you as you make your way to the dancefloor.  Just be flattered, and walk tall.  I dig the 'take you back' tracks they mix in with the newer hip hop.
author: Lissa J.

description: It's an alright place to go for a drink, hang out, and dance to some music.  Somehow I ended up here on a Tuesday, and there were a bunch of rowdy college kids who unsuccessfully tried to bust a move on the dance floor.  I think I'm going to avoid coming here on Tuesdays.
author: Naomi N.

description: Love this place. The crowd is mixed and the music centers more on good quality hip hop and less of that new crap. If your hungry theres spots all over the place around the area where you can grab something to eat. My favorite at the moment is the taco truck on 16th and Mission ^_^. Oh yeah, to the people saying it's too "ghetto", you guys don't have the slightest idea what ghetto is lol, please go back to the marina.
author: Mike A.

description:
Definitely a part of theboom-time,  usual suspects Mission scene, Skylark's DJ's are always spinning innovative hip hop and while the drinks are pretty normal, at least you're guaranteed interesting people watching and some comfortable seats at the bar :)
Also, not bad for some desi-watching....
author: Anjali K.

description: The Mission is my new favorite area to party and I loved the Skylark.  It is everything I am looking for when I am in the mood to find a one night stand.  Everyone there is hooking up and the drinks are good.  A nice dancing area and booths in the back (although some in near the bathrooms which can suck).  Not pretentious, a good place to just chill.  Also, if you aren't feeling it Blondies is close by.
author: Kathleen O.

description: Went to this spot last night, I'm new to the city and I was very impressed with this bar.  The drinks were stiff as shit and the crowd was very laid back.  I will be frequenting this bar in the near future.
author: Eric K.

description: This bar is so crowded every time I've been.  Still, I usually have a good time here.  They play good music, you can get your grove on.  Interesting crowd too.  Fun place to bar hop to!
author: Sarah F.

description: I have a soft spot in my heart for this bar.  I have no idea why.  I dont think the bartenders are that great, neither is the space.  I think its that I always like the music they are playing and every once in a while you want to be in a very crowded VERY dark place trying to dance.
author: b s.

description: Ok. This bar has been inoffensive, given me the alcohol I wanted, and has sometimes been less crowded than the other 16th st locations.  I don't know that I have any good experiences to relate, other than I got seats.  But I haven't had a bad experience yet.
author: Heidi P.

description:
This is my favorite neighborhood bar. I have a great time every time I come here! The DJ's are always spinning something danceable and there is actually a dance floor. The bartenders are real professionals.

Love this place!
author: Crystal G.

description: Great place to dance to hip-hop music, although the dance floor can be cramped at peak hours.  What's great is that it's FREE to get in because it's a bar, but don't expect much in the way of atmosphere.
author: John c.

description: This place is cool.  We ended up here at 1am on a Monday and still had hella fun!  There was a live DJ who was playing reggae music.  The dance floor was small and I felt like I was hotboxing (I could smell the weed coming off of some people) but that was fine by me- it all goes with the reggae theme right?!  :)  Oh and lastly NO COVER CHARGE!!!!  We didn't even spend a dollar here.  yeahhhhh!
author: David P.

description: i danced with black chicks and they showed me how to pop, drop and lock it.
author: Jamie C.
