description: Yeah its a lil grimy and yeah the paint is peeling of the roof over the dance floor but this is definitely on the top of my list when it comes to great places to dance (but if your'e one of those people that go to clubs to stand around and be wierd instead of ummm DANCE...then this isnt the place for you)...great music and GREAT DRINKS. There is never a cover...there's lots of seating...its gets way crowded on Wednesday and Saturdays but it feels like a house party and I LOVE IT!! Trust me..I can party with the most pretentious and the most grimy but this is neither... its totally a gem of the Mission...DJay tactics spins every 3rd Saturday and he is by far on of my favorite DJays in the city...always plays those good classic hits and ends it with something grown and sexy that makes you wanna go home and get down and dirty with your man...I love it and for all you boogie pretentious people giving it bad reviews keep doing it...that way it will stay cool..calm...and FUN with that great house party feel...I bet the people giving it 1-2 stars think 15 dollar drinks are the norm too.
author: Kokoa L.

description: A previous poster stated "If you're breathing and have a vagina, you WILL be molested". I don't know what it is about this place but that vibe is contagious because whenever I'm there...I look for anything that is breathing and has a vagina. Maybe it's the hip hop. Maybe it's the UFC fighter that's buying you shots for no reason. Maybe it's the maryjane floating in the air. Maybe I am just a dog? But this place is indeed a meat market. And I don't mind. What would you prefer: an awkward non-agressive indy boy staring at you from afar or somebody that just walks up to you and tells you what he wants? Well I don't prefer either of those two...I'm not gay...I think....not that there's anything wrong with that...I mean...if that's what you're into. So I like this place. It's the only place that I can think of when out of town friends ask for a bar that plays hip hop. Can anybody else think of one? They play all the old skool classics and even some hyphy shit. The bartenders are great and I think the vibe is...what it is. You know what you're getting. What...did you expect to go to a hip hop bar and not get molested? It's part of hip hop culture to be upfront and forward about your game. It's not subtle. So...it is what it is...and I don't mind it. Come here...it's aight!
author: Steve H.

description:
this review if for hip hop/oldschool Wednesdays
-diggin the music (herb diggs was spinning that night) 
-it was pretty empty at 11pm but got packed by 12am
-it seems like there are a lot of regulars on wednesdays that stay within their circle of friends & some random one-offs that sit at the bar and stare like they want to talk to you but seem to shy to
-the bathroom is all the way in the back behind the small dance floor  
-cool mixed crowd, not pretentious, no dress code, you can where your sneakers, hats, and skull design or Ed Hardy hooded sweatshirt zip-ups (ha ha)
-never knew this place existed right around the corner of one of my fav tapas restaurants (Ramblas)
-right next door to Pancho Villa 
-it does get a little sketchy as you walk closer to Mission St, stay upwards towards Guerrero, and you'll be cool (I used to live in the Mission so I'm not as freaked out as some other girls would be that are not familiar with this neighborhood)
-parking sucks as usual (do not park in the middle lane on Valencia like some folks do, you will get a ticket
author: Michelle E.

description: no room to move, too noisy to chat. bumping n grinding too close for comfort. perhaps a less crowded place is not preferable?
author: Hae-Jin K.

description: Came here on a Thursday and LOVED it! No cover and GOOD music. They actually played non-commercial hip-hop which was refreshing. Loved the laid back vibe. Bartender was nice and didn't take no more than 2 minutes to get my drink. Bouncer in the front was chill too.
author: Ro F.

description: So if you go here make sure you are wearing neutral colors i.e. pink and orange maybe...no joke...I saw a guy get the shit kicked out of him while my friends and I sat in the booth by the window. The guy was getting kicked in the head...that shit was crazy...but even crazier homeboy got up like nothing happened and went on about his "bidness"...True to form I believe in 2nd chances and went back another time with a group of friends that are a bit more open-minded. It was a saturday night and they had an in house DJ...he had VINYL so I was expecting to hear sumtin sumtin...no the VINYL was all for show that dude was wiggity wiggity whack as f**k. But we danced...and the guys...look I love urban gentlemen...really I dont mind a fellow with some street creds BUT when we are dancing and your ridiculous HIGH is affecting my sobriety then we finna have issues boo...yeah not sooo much...so yeah its really a 2 and a half but I will be kinda nice...u need to revamp your spot people.
author: Yolanda O.

description: i do love the vibe at skylark. i've been here on a saturday AND wednesday night. and wednesday was pretty crackin!! the crowd was super chill, no ghetto-ness present. just a bunch of folks just dancing and drinking. all love here. the bartenders are nice. the doormen are cool. no cover. slight dresscode for the boys. most definitely not for 21 yo beginners. parking is kind of hard. and it is near the mission. so please come in groups. oh yeah the djays on wednesdays are cool.
author: Maureen M.

description: about the worst bar I've ever been too...nasty bathrooms, scummy people, horrible music, weak and expensive drinks...I saw the well alcohol they were using and it was VERY lowshelf...they musta went to the basement to get that swill....AND maybe the worst bartenders in the city on top of all that...stay far away, very far away....I could go on and on with amazing stories of rude bartending and the like but you get the point.
author: Adrian H.

description: not too shabby and I like things that are reggae related .. what can I say
author: Jill W.

description: $4 jager-bombs. hip-hop on blast (hip-hop hooray!) . mixed crowd (diversity is a good thing folks)
author: David D.

description: the female bartender that comes to amber bar is hot. :)
author: Pickle R.

description: So this place kinda shocked me. While I was expecting to have a great time, I had a totally different great time than I was anticipating. I thought - oh...this bar is kinda funny. I should get a lot of good laughs and funny stories from this bar. BUT I DIDN'T!! I was shocked. The bartender was this early 30's number with a weave, who (sorry!) looked like a total bitch...and she actually was REALLY nice, very friendly, and I felt like the bitch for thinking she was gonna be the bitch. But she was great...I forgot her name though. The service was fairly quick, as long as you weren't obnoxious - which I appreciate. If you're a tool flashing your wad of rubber banded bills at the bar or if you're yelling "sweetie! over here!" to the bartender, then you're ignored. I also expected things to be over priced, and they weren't! $40 for 3 shots of shelf, 3 beers and 2 mixed drinks with shelf. That's super decent! The music was cool. It was a cool mix of people - ranging from people who clearly left work late and needed somewhere to kick off thier night to girls that left work early to hit up forever 21 to get the latest jewel toned shirt she could yank down long enough to "make" a dress to people (like me and my friends) that were just tired of sitting in the dark confines of The Attic. So yeah, I recommend it. I've heard from friends and a couple folks that night that the DJ on Wednesday night is amazing. Makes crossing the bridge worth while on a Friday night.
author: Chia C.

description: This place is just what it appears to be.  It's sort of divey and unremarkable, but sometimes that's just what you want.  The crowd on a Saturday night seemed to include a lot of slick-haired guys and scantily-clad girls.  There's music and a dance floor that gets increasingly sticky as the night progresses, but there are also plenty of tables if you just want to relax.
author: S P.

description: Kind of an average bar with loud music and dark lights.  Nothing too special.
author: Saikat C.

description: I like this place.  It's a dope little hip hop spot in the Mission.  It's hella small and can get packed on a Saturday night.  The bartenders were okay, there was a dumb guy that bartended there that we always made fun of.  They play pretty good music.  The dancefloor is crowded and HOT.  and every single time I go there, there's this nasty hispanic guy grabbing girls' asses and vaginas.  I know it's the same guy every time.  be careful!
author: Charlene R.

description: drinks are decently priced here, good vibe, friendly crowd.  the music was okay, but not memorable.  great and convenient location though!
author: Robyn F.

description: Three Stars for the bar specials and No Dress code. Juan and Juan is a must (shot of patron& Corona) for $11 i was on these all nite. The spot is a lil ghetto but its the mission!! The only negative was that on thursdays they dont play hip hop, mainly rock  and some reggae. Once your drunk the music is the  last thing on your mind.
author: C G.

description: i like this place.  i like that it is a bar but that it also has a dance floor. not too many in the city like that.  i'm not really a "club" person but after a few cocktails i suddenly get the urge to dance. i also like the fact that its pretty much only hip hop music, cuz i hate techno. and i always have a good time here.  why not five stars? the lone bathroom. and the bathroom line that starts to get in my way on the dance floor.
author: Ms. M.

description:
the place is filled with jerks.  people steal your shit if you leave it around. they stole my jacket on a wednesday.. who does that??/       the guy at the door will gladly take my 5 dollars to get me in there... but acts like he doesnt speak english when i tell him someone stole my jacket.  

if anyone sees anyone in a dark blue lettermen jacket with MY NAME on it... LALO MORALES... please have them return it to me. laloadrianmorales@gmail.com
author: lalo m.

description: just went here last weekend (Saturday) for a quick start to the night.  the music was on point, it was mostly all hip hop.  props to the DJ for the beats
author: Richard L.

description: This ia always a stop when I am in the Mission, but just a STOP.  It can get real crowded.  I didn't like how the bouncers reacted to a drunk idiot who pushed my friend.  A guy puching a girl doesn't get kicked out here.  After that I told myself I am never going back if that's how they run their business,  but I found myself there again.  It's okay, not a fav, but usually good music, especially Mondays w/ reggae, but fri and sat nights sometimes draw a less desirable crowd.
author: E G.

description: I love this place. Great music (Kyle the DJ), great bartenders, awesome crowd. It used to be that it could get violent sometimes but most of that MS13 crowd is gone now since they ripped beat the crap out of some dude and started a brawl a while back. Now its cool and hip hop hyphe.
author: P C.

description: honestly i don't know why I keep coming back here...there's nothing special about it and is almost always mostly to completely empty when I've been.  but it's sort of dark and inviting in a grimy way..a good place to get your first drink on the way out to some other bars in the mission area.
author: jozilla w.

description: mixtape muthafuckin wednesday!!!!!!! if you haven't been yet check it out. drink specials, great dj's. my favorite night of the week. now on to the bartenders. prolly some of the best bartenders around. they know how to handle the busy sometimes shithead crowd. go in tip big and have some fun!
author: Ausewaldoe J.
